summary_comment: Professor Bodine is known for his comprehensive and challenging approach to teaching finance, covering extensive material that requires active participation and dedication. While many students find his classes informative and personally engaging, they also note that the course demands significant effort and can be quite demanding. Overall, his teaching style is highly regarded by those who persevere through the challenges.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bodine is known for his comprehensive and challenging approach to teaching finance, with a focus on real-world applications and active participation. Students find his classes demanding but rewarding, with some describing him as both insightful and intimidating, while others warn to avoid him due to his controversial and sometimes offensive remarks.

Ratings.comment: If you want an easy class this isn't for you. Bodine basically explains every field & thing in finance in this class so there is A LOT of material. The exams are fair just study the slides and don't overthink. You NEED to go to class and he will make fun of everyone but it makes the class more personal. Very funny, very informative, a little hard

The Goat. Learned more from him than any other professor at OSU. Show up to class and you'll be fine. Discussion-based class where he gets everyone to participate and relates the class to real-world news. Some say he's intimidating but stick it out and I promise his class is worth it. Would take this class every semester of college if I could.

The guy thinks that he's God. Will insult you in front of the class if you don't answer one of his questions correctly. Most of what he says needs to be fact checked. Very opinionated and tries to force his opinions on his students. Makes inappropriate and racist comments regularly.

One of my favorite professors I've ever had. Everyone seems to love or hate him, that's just his personality. You will never get to experience a class with such a guy. He is as "real world" as someone can get. He will tell you how it is. Perhaps the most successful and experienced professor in Fisher. I would take his class again in an instant.

Great teacher, not a great professor. All materials are on a different canvas website which makes it difficult. Says no dumb questions then berates people for asking dumb questions. Learned a ton from the class, but if you are looking for a stress free grade this is not the class for you.

Prof. Bodine can be intimidating at first, but if you do what he says and show up to lecture, you will learn a ton. I got more out of his classes than any other course I took at Ohio State. Exams are challenging, but if you study they are very fair. Ultimately, you get out of it what you put in.
HORRIBLE!!! AVOID!!! You would be stupid to take this class with him.

summary_comment: Professor Doroodian is known for his knowledge and care for student success, though communication can be challenging as he is difficult to reach and responds slowly to emails. Students find the class demanding but valuable, particularly for finance jobs. However, some critics describe him as a poor lecturer with a heavy accent and an unaccommodating demeanor, while others praise the class content and his willingness to help with extra practice.
summary_comment_short: Professor Doroodian is known for being knowledgeable and caring about student success, though his communication can be extremely poor, making it difficult for students to reach him. His teaching style and class structure are challenging, and some find his lectures hard to follow due to a heavy accent and strict classroom management.

Ratings.comment: never got back with me

He does not respond to emails whatsoever and is very difficult to communicate with. Takes days/weeks to answer and to even get a response you need to email him 45 times. If there is a technical issue, he basically says he can't do anything about it and is very reluctant when it comes to accommodating.
He is a nice person but the class (BUSFIN 4255) and him are difficult. You need to study a bit for getting a good grade. Though the content of the class is important for any finance job.
Fantastic Professor! He is very knowledgeable and intelligent. He cares about each student's success and learning.

I recommend taking 4250 online because it is very easy, but he provides no value besides reading the slides. Terrible lecturer with a heavy accent that could barely explain what was written on the screen. Easy class, bad prof, I will retain nothing from this class.

He was a terrible teacher. Was boring and cold called people all the time. If you look at your computer for more than 5 seconds, expect to be told off. There are no acceptable absences AT ALL. Especially picks on girls

Definitely the best class I ever took. So many things learned during this semester. In the beginning, the professor could seem a bit rough but he will always try to help students by providing additional practice questions. If you are not afraid to work and want to learn many things concerning international monetary policies, this class is for you!
He's not accommodating to his students

If you want a good idea of what it's like to sit in one of the mandatory lectures, I suggest watching the Ben Stein lecture scene in Ferris Bueller's day off.
Attendance is graded, exams seem unfair.  Would recommend taking something else.

summary_comment: Professor Vokata is highly regarded as one of the top instructors at Ohio State University, known for her clear and engaging teaching style that makes complex topics accessible. Students appreciate her patience, willingness to answer questions, and the value-added nature of the course content, which includes challenging yet instructive quizzes and projects. Her passion for the subject matter is evident and enhances the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Vokata is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality at Ohio State University, known for her clear explanations, passion for the subject matter, and structured curriculum that effectively prepares students. Her classes, while challenging, are supportive, with valuable feedback and a strong emphasis on practical learning through projects and quizzes.

Ratings.comment: This is one of the best professors you can find in the Ohio State University. The lectures and curriculum are well taught and structured. The quizzes are hard but useful. The group project is also hard, but she gives really good feedback to help you learn!

Prof. Petra is the best professors I have ever had in college. Her teaching is very clear, whether it's a complex concept or an abstract theory, she always explains it in a easy to understand way. She is very patient , always willing to answer all kinds of questions. The exams are of normal difficulty. I would highly recommend taking her class!

Dr. Vokata is the best professor I have ever had at Ohio State. She is so passionate about the material and it translates so well into teaching and actually understanding. I highly recommend her for investments! I wish she taught more classes because I would absolutely sign up for them! the material isnt't inherently easy, but she makes it clear!

BUSFIN 4221 introduces the principles, theories, and history behind investments/financial securities and Professor Vokata does a wonderful job at explaining them. I loved how the course was structured in a way where everything aligns together and engaging in class made it a lot of fun. Truly value adding course!

Dr. Petra Vokata is a super nice professor. Don't hesitate to ask her any questions! We have a several in- class quizs and exams throughout the semester, which is not very hard if you attend all the classes. Group presentation project is also very inspiring and helpful.
Very patient professor, would love to solve any problems in a very clear and easy way to you have after class. If you ollow all the homeworks and will

She is very caring and makes the investments both entertaining and accessible for all students. As long as you come to class and pay attention to the material, the concepts won't be too difficult, but will still be intriguing and insightful.

She and her TAs are very responsive to emails. I learned a lot in this class (multiple quizzes, guest speakers, and final exam). One of her TAs helped me land a job at JPM- she's very nice to talk with as well.
There are extra credit for most quizzes. Fair question and final, not hard to get an A. Really Nice professor!

first quiz was by far the hardest. a lot of the quizzes had questions that came directly from practice quizzes or in class extra problems. the midterm was basically the same as the practice midterm with different numbers.
Very concerned about the students and will listen to their opinions about lecture. Really nice person, there are bonus for most of the quizzes.

Professor Vokata is one of my favorite teachers I have ever had! She is kind and helpful to students. She listens to students feedback and implements exactly what they want into the class. The ciricullum is very reasonable very organized, and easy to follow. Overall she was an awesome professor and I loved this class!

Prof. Vokata is my favorite professors at OSU. Her curriculum is reasonable. She often actively reply to every email and collects student evaluations to adjust the progress of the class at any time, in order to create a harmonious classroom atmosphere.I believe she has done her best in terms of thinking from the perspective of a student!

summary_comment: Professor Patterson is perceived as having fair and straightforward exams that cover only two chapters each, making the course material relatively easy to grasp. However, his exams are criticized for being poorly written and difficult to interpret within the given time, and his lectures are seen as ineffective, with many students finding them unhelpful for learning the material. Additionally, students describe him as rude and unprofessional, with some citing issues such as changing exam structures without notice and dismissive behavior towards students seeking help.
summary_comment_short: Professor Patterson's teaching quality is widely criticized, with students finding his lectures ineffective and exams overly difficult and poorly structured. Many describe him as rude and unprofessional, with some experiencing significant issues during exams and office hours.

Ratings.comment: The course itself is not very difficult, the exams cover two chapters each, so understanding the material is fairly easy. However, some of his exams are poorly written, and you have do decode the question before being able to do calculations, which is fairly difficult to do within the time frame. He is also kind of rude and unwelcoming to questions

The exams are not that difficult, especially compared to Marc smith. He will never try to trick you on a question either. They only cover two units, so you can literally learn all the material in one or two days. Yes, he's not the best lecturer, but his class is very fair. I got a B+ in accounting and I am doing a lot better in this class.
Billy Patterson can't lecture and his tests are ridiculously difficult for an introductory finance course. Honestly a terrible professor.

Administration needs to do something. When the average on an exam is a D- and there is no curve or support, there is a clear problem with the professor. Not the students. He is egotistical, rude, and acts like he is above teaching/academia as a whole. He is a horrendous speaker and not equipped to prepare students for the material he gives out.

Fun
Awesome
Great
This guy just shouldn't teach

This semester is honestly not too far off from the last one in terms of organization. Second is exam was completely different from the first in terms of difficulty and structure. Not to mention the fact that you essentially have to go out of your way to learn the material yourself because the lectures do not help. This guy needs a reality check

Billy is extremely unprofessional and a terrible teacher. All he does is read off the slides and does not help you understand the material. First test was a joke and he completely changed the second exam and we did not know what to expect. I know of someone who went to his office hours for help and Billy laughed at him. So unprofessional

People leaving bad reviews are so soft. This class is extremely doable. Billy just kinda screwed himself by making the 1st exam super easy and making it seem like the rest of the class would be free. It's is a lot easier compared to accounting people just don't want to put in the same amount of effort for this class because they are lazy.

I do feel a little bad for Billy but he did it all to himself. His class is an absolute mess and it is hard to comprehend how it could have possibly been worse last semester. His lectures are boring and he very poorly goes over conceptual items, and I've never seen so many students leave in the middle of lecture. Plus second exam was awful 62% avg.
62% average on the exam no curve, half the stuff we never went over. Lies about attendance saying it's required but never uses the top hat.

The class being unorganized and confusing is one thing (literally he even made the extra credit confusing) but Billy is just flat out a mean person who obviously thinks he is "above" teaching. My TAs being good has saved me this semester. Hopefully Billy either gets a reality check or he just leaves after the semester because he is a disaster

So obvious that the last couple 5 star ratings and even that 3 star rating is from Billy himself or he paid one of his TAs to do it. All of them say A+, you can't even get an A+ in an OSU class. Plus how would you even have a grade yet? This just contributes more to his massively bruised ego. Can't wait for the post-course surveys to come out
Lectures are incredibly boring. Start looking at the clock 40 mins before class ends. Exams all over the place

I know Billy posts here because what student would say "His TAs are great." Literally no student would say that no one thinks about their TAs and they only know like 2 of 25. I know someone last semester who was a finance TA for a year and quit cause of Billy. He said all of the other TAs strongly disliked him too and a ton of them quit.

The course itself is very straightforward. You should expect to learn the majority/all of the math in recitation. The lectures are not the most engaging and he talks to us like we have an elementary vocabulary. But the tests are fair, just do all, and I mean all, of the recitation problems and you'll be fine on the tests.

Terrible. If over 40 people are giving awful ratings, I have a hard time believing that anyone but Billy would give a 5. Hopeful that he improves for the rest of the semester or the SEIs are going to be insane.
To the past two 5s we know what you're doing Billy get off this website and work on your curriculum dude

Billy is an underrated guy. He does not make his exams impossible but you definitely have to know the content well and know how to do the problems without question. Just study and you'll be fine. He is also always open to talk and is flexible with his hours. His TA's are also amazing.
Yes, the class is hard but people complaining about an impossible exam didn't study and do homework by themselves. Billy is a fair professor, and I genuinely enjoy his lectures.

The exams are unfair and inconsistent. Studied hard for the first exam and did very well. Did the same process and more for exam 2 because I expected it to be a little harder but it was very unfair. The questions were completely different from all the questions we went over in lecture and recitation. Went from an A to a C.

Billy's exams has 5-10 questions we didn't do in lecture,hw, or recitation and he expects us to turnup and figure it out. He purposely made his exam impossible so he can meet his requirement from fisher to maintain a 75 average for the exam. He

Honestly might be the worst teacher I've ever had. His first semester at Ohio State was a dumpster fire and this one's not better. The overall average on the first exam was good, but the second exam was borderline impossible factoring in time and calculation problem difficulty. The class average was 23% lower than exam 1. Horrible Teacher.

Studied nonstop and did great on the first test. Used the exact same process for the next one and did horribly. At some point, it's not the students, it's the teacher. Genuinely the worst instructor I've ever had. The test was impossibly unfair, and I hope he realizes this and does something to make up for it.

Basically, imagine if Marc smith was a terrible professor and didn't know how to teach. I feel bad for his TA's. No review lectures, no study guides for exam besides the general topics, which he doesn't even follow.

This class made me reconsider my major, I was doing really well with all of my other business major core classes until I took this class which Billy made it nearly impossible to learn all of the new concepts and not to mention how difficult he made all the tests.

To the recent 5 rating of Billy. Wow you really love to have a superiority complex and stand out in the crowd don't you. No one asked for your kiss up opinion. I got a 100 on the first test and thoroughly studied the lectures and recitations for the second test and definitely failed. There was not nearly enough time.Stop making everything about you

It's so embarrassing being a business major sometimes, and I'm giving him 5/5 just out of spite of the bad reviews. No, exam 2 was not impossible. Just review the lecture and recitation problems until you know how to solve them like the back of your hand. Of course the exam isn't going to be coloring inside the lines. Grow up and study your notes

First test this semester was fair and students did pretty well in general and this made him mad so he decided to make the second test impossible. I studied for three days straight, knew all the material, and failed the exam. There also is nowhere near enough time to take the exam. You have to rush and do every problem perfectly to finish in time.
Worst managed class ever have heard nothing but awful things from every single person in this class

Billy Patterson has tried to convince us about how his class is better now but it is not better. He tests on concepts that were not covered in class and the content he does cover in class is so rushed that most students are unable to keep up and learn any of the content. He needs to brag less and actually do what he says he will.

Billy is a nice guy but not fit for teaching. He moves so fast in his lectures, you really have to rely on your TAs to understand the material. The second exam might have been manageable if there was significantly more time but was entirely too difficult compared to the types of problems we went over in class.

Billy is by far the worst lecturer I've had in all of Fisher. After messing it up bad last year, he somehow still can't figure it out. 70+ lecture slides that he rushes thru at an unreasonable pace. 2nd exam was a joke. He needs to go.

Billy is the definition of a guy who has all the potential in the world to be a very good professor, but just can't seem to get out of his own way. His class has zero structure and there is a severe discrepancy in terms of difficulty when it comes to exams. Exam 1 was more than fair and Exam 2 was impossible,
Just bad, bad. Recitation and lectures just made things more confusing.

This man is so self-conscious about his rate my professor rating he mentions it all the time. His slide decks are way too long to the point where he can't get through them in lecture. 2nd exam was impossible and the class feels unorganized, inconsistent and rushed. He probably won't be here too much longer judging on him having 6 jobs in 8 years

I like Professor Patterson, but when he says on the very first day of lecture that he overhauled the course after a brutal previous semester, yet proceeds to make the same mistakes again, there is an issue. He is very caring about the students and goes out of his way to help, but he continues to make the same mistakes over and over again.

Billy is a nice guy and all but he is just not a good lecturer. The guy tries to squeeze 70 powerpoint slides in a lecture and still tests you on the material whether he actually reached the material or not. The 2nd exam was horrible and half of the concepts were barely touched on in lecture.
Billy is honestly a horrible teacher, his lectures are confusing and he rushes the question and sometimes doesn't finish the answer. He goes over class time and the second exam is horrible.

People leaving these ratings are outrageously soft. The class was not even difficult, I don't know how people survived accounting if they thought this was hard. Billy's lectures got a bit boring at the end of the year because students complained about him going off-topic or not discussing material that was directly relevant to exams. I liked him.
He said the class was not going to be like last semester so many times but it definitely was like last semester.

Billy was extremely accommodating throughout the semester. It was his first time teaching, and he did the very best he could given a large class. By the end of the semester, exams were an appropriate length/difficulty, and an A could be achieved without a reasonable amount of effort. I have no doubt this course will get better in the future!

This professor was new to this course. Made the exams extremely hard. Attendance was required and done through tophat, and graded at the end of the semester. We could only use the financial calculators. The first exam was curved because of issues. the second exam had too many questions. the 3 and 4 weren't too bad. good luck!

After Exam 2, he told everyone the class would be curved; a friend learned privately he wouldn't curve (he made the last two exams way easier), but Billy did not retract what he said earlier. Lecture: he talks in constant, fast, monotone jargon. Use his open-forum office hours ALWAYS. Study recitation probs and the textbook, not McGraw assignments.

We were Billy's guinea pigs and it showed in the quality of the class. I think in the future he will be a lot better as his exams will not be a disaster. Just do your homework, show up to class, pay attention, study a little, and you will be fine. The subject matter is a little difficult but just put in some effort and you can get a decent grade.

Very rude during office hours. I said I would "find time to work on the recitation" and was given a lecture about how college students are lazy. He then asked me what I did this morning and that I probably had time to work on it. I said I had two interviews this morning, and he blatantly replied "so?".
I had never missed an assignment or class...

Billy was a mess the whole semester. He spent the entire hour and a half of our first lecture walking us through his entire resume starting with his first job. Like how does this relate to business finance? His lectures were all over the place, and he cannot write good exams. I didn't sit for the final. Overall I learned nothing from his class.

Billy is a good guy who struggled a lot in his first semester teaching. He messed up the exam system so bad, but I think he'll figure it out. On top of that, his lectures are really boring even if you like finance, so you need to pray for a good TA. If you study the recitation and understand the conceptuals, the last exams are easy.
Class became better toward end. Really wish this class had slight curve but I don't think it will happen.
Really horrible experience as a starter class for finance. Pretty sure they stopped telling us the averages after exam 2 because it was so bad.

Terrible format for the 2nd test which he fixed 3rd and 4th tests were definitely a better format that was easier to study for. I would be surprised if there is no curve in the class after all that has happened.
Worst professor at Fisher college. Highly recommend avoiding him at all costs.

He was fine and made up for a lot of the slack with exams by adding a 20 points to the first one, 40 point curve to the second, and made the third significantly easier. I did not take the final, so I can't speak on that, but because of how the exams went you could drop one of the 4. He was reasonable and once he figures out the exams it'll be fine

First two exams were a mess but it seems like Billy figured it out for the third exam. However this does not excuse Billy's attitude while dealing with these issues. Came off as rude and condescending when talking to students. Was quick to place the blame on others before it blew back in his face.
Best class at fisher!! You can tell Billy really cares about his students success and is passionate about finance! Exams are easy if you study and go to class!

The first and second exams were awful due to us being his guinea pigs, but allowing us to drop an exam because of this is fair. Exam 3 was easy imo if you studied for it. I think it'll get better next sem, amazing TAs but his lecture/conceptual content could be a lot better tbh. I think things will be a lot better in the future.

On top of the course being a mess, Billy was the rudest professor I have ever had at tOSU. I think he was stressed from his course being a disaster, but that give him a pass to have a terrible attitude. Would not take again.

Billy is someone who tried and failed. The thing I admire is he owned up to his mistakes and made things right. It was his first semester, he deserves to be cut some slack. Exam 3 was much more fair and I firmly believe that if I were to take the class next semester, everything would go much smoother structurally.

Give Billy a break, he owned up to the bad experience of exam 1 and the difficulty issue of exam 2. Exam 3 was very fair if you studied for it. The slander about exam 3 is not warranted. Yes the semester started off rough but it was his first time teaching the course. He has been fair to the students.

First and second exam were terrible, so he allowed a drop and a curve. Third exam was also quite difficult. He's a sub par professor AT BEST. What I don't understand is why our final grade wasn't based off the syllabus after the drop, but exam grade weight increased. Ex: instead of 620/820 your final grade is slightly lower, basically 590/820

Terrible professor. First exam went horrible enough for him to drop it. Second exam was so abysmal he curved. Third exam was difficult as well. This man cannot teach nor are his exams fair. With all these atrocities he says he won't curve or round at the end, what a guy.

I used to hate this guy because we had to buy mcgraw access for 130 bucks (other professors' sections didn't) and because of the first and second exam.  But each time there Billy owned up to the unfairness of the exams and made it right.    I think this class will get better (also keep the 3/4 exam policy it reduces stress so much)

I would take everything being said right now about Billy with a grain of salt. This was his first semester teaching the course and while it does unfortunately show, I think it will without a doubt get better as he continues. He is very accommodating and has listened to student suggestions. We were just his guinea pigs, but I see it getting better.

This class isn't as tough as some say. Billy has been accommodating, letting us drop the lowest exam grade and giving a 40 point curve on the second exam. Exams are challenging if you don't study, but with effort, you can get an A or B. I think lectures and course structure could improve, but I believe this will improve with the coming semesters.

Worst class I have ever taken at fisher, IDK who put him in charge of teaching this course because 50 average on the second midterm really says alot about him. Apologies every time for making the exam too hard and so many kids failing but yet again the next exam is as hard as the previous one. Don't take him!

Take it from me, i bombed the first exam. The 5s and 1s are lies. He made mistakes but tries to fix it. overall a good prof, willing to meet outside class. People are hurt over grades or thankful for the curve. Also everyone keeps mentioning his other job and sports, but he rarely brings them up. Not gonna say he's the best but ppl are dramatic.
Like this is we should all boo him collectively during lecture

Had a very rough start in the semester. 1st exam experienced technical difficulties, which resulted in him changing the syllabus to allow one dropped exam grade. Second exam was too many questions and less time which resulted in class average very low, and he gave us a 40 point curve on a 180 point exam. Overall content of course is tolerable.

Worst professor ive had thinks hes better than everyone and its the students fault for failing when his online exams dont work or he gives basically no time to take an exam. He talks about his personal experiences instead of teaching or asking questions, we get it you work in the cell phone tower business; that doesnt help me pass the class.
He sucks and is so unfair. Horrible tests no matter how much you study, gave a 45 question math heavy test in 70 minutes. Class average was a 50 for that exam. Do with that what you will.

I didn't want to leave a review until I saw all those 5 star reviews below. DO NOT TRUST THEM. "Billy is better than most professors at Fisher" my butt. Some of these 5 star reviews are really suspicious, because who would unironically write "THIS is what college is all about- learning how to fail, and making things right. Billy the goat!"

Fake 5 star reviews. He also does not deserve any credit for "owning up to his mistakes" and "trying to make things right". He literally had no choice. He messed his first semester up so badly, and was in danger of losing his job. He still is, and for good reason. He got scared after the disaster of the first exam reached Ted's ears.

Yes, hes owning up to some of his mistakes. No, that does not mean you should give him a 5. To the review that told everyone to "study" and "grow some balls", quit brown nosing. If the entire class gets a 50 in an intro class that's on the professor. I'm giving him a two because he is trying to make up, but the class is still objectively awful.

Those who think Billy is the worst professor at fisher are in for a rude awakening. Very nice guy who wants his students to succeed. People make mistakes and Billy has owned up to every mistake he's made in this course (exam curves, exam drop, etc). As long as you actually put forth an effort and study, you will do just fine in this course.

Lots of mistakes were made during the first half of the semester, but he is trying to change. Appreciate his effort to make the class better but right now the class is still horribly setup and we are already two exams in.

Let's read the writing on the walls, consistently got 1s then randomly got a bunch of 5s out of thin air, yeah, not obvious at all! Don't listen to a thing the positive reviews say, if you do a bad job teaching and the average is that low, sounds like a proper reflection of his teaching abilities. "Lock of the week" (these don't hit btw)

Looks like a couple of people handed him a 5 star for curving a test by 40 points. This is intro to finance not calc 3 the tests should not need to be curved. If anything it speaks to his inability to teach material that shouldn't be that difficult. He's trying to trick you guys into saving his job and some of you are falling right into his trap.

Very confused by all the 5 stars given AFTER his exam. He curved it so much because the average was a 50% -- he didn't have a choice and that grade is a reflection of poor teaching. Not only is he not a good professor, he is not a nice person and doesn't seem to like teaching. Worst prof I've had in Fisher and probably at OSU.
Billy makes sure that you don't fail!
Worst class I've ever taken

These new 5.0 reviews are very strange, whoever is reading all of these reviews take it with a grain of salt. AU 24 is Billy's first semester teaching this finance class and it is a struggle but he is genuinely striving to improve. He communicates clearly and although the class is frustrating at times, this class is completely doable with this prof
too difficult

What is with the influx of these five star reviews just because he curved an exam? If an exam needs to be curved upwards of 40 whole points because the average was so low, that speaks to an inadequate teaching ability. Exams are harder than Marc Smith's despite teaching and preparation being significantly worse. TA's aren't good either.

To my glorious King Billy Patterson, the true savior of students:

Thank you for taking accountability and curving the test—it's a rare thing to see a professor look out for us like that. You've brought some much-needed relief to our stressed-out lives, and for that, we are grateful!

His lectures are literally giving out textbook definitions for terms. No calculations are taught at all and expects us to take the exams with little time and so many problems. I don't know how anyone can actually work through the exam of 45 questions in 70 minutes with so many calculations.

One of the worst professors at Fisher. Lectures are rushed and don't match exam content. Recitation TAs are out of sync with lectures and explain concepts poorly. Horrible testing environments and not nearly enough time to complete 45 questions with "none of the above" as an option for each. More interested in sports betting and golf than teaching.

Worst professor at OSU. Billy treats this class like a side gig and probably spends most of his time golfing after his two lectures. We never get enough time on tests, and it feels like he's not interested in helping us succeed. Ball don't lie, Billy. Your Rate My Professor rating is a 1. OSU, give your $130k to someone else.

Billy Patterson might be the worst professor in fisher. He does not cover the content well at all and his tests are ridiculous. It almost feels like he actively wanted his students to receive a poor grade…

Despite teaching an intro finance class, he expects prior knowledge and gives exams every two weeks, with only one lecture per week. This leads to rushed explanations, making lectures ineffective. I've studied and completed the homework, but it didn't help my grade in the slightest. He's a good person, but ultimately an incompetent teacher.

Absolutely the worst professor I've had at Fisher. Course is set up terribly, students don't get nearly enough time on exams. It seems like him and the teaching assistants aren't on the same page every week as they ask if certain topics have been discussed in lecture yet. Overall just a very bad experience for a core class.

This professor is absolutely awful. The hardest Fisher class I have ever taken and it is an intro level course. I have never written one of these but this is SUCH a bad professor that I felt the need to tell you. The exams will ruin your GPA because there are too many questions with too little time. Terrible testing environment. Do not take w/ him!

Billy Patterson is more focused on giving "sports betting locks" than he is providing a deeper understanding to his lecture material. His exam gives way to many questions with not enough time. I hate Bonnie Schroeder too, this guy not as bad, but boy does he make it close.

Exams are extremely tough, with 45 questions in 70 minutes with around 13 of those being math problems. Formula sheet was on the same page and on the back of the answer sheet we were required to fill in, which was not allowed to be removed from the exam.There is literally no reason to handicap your students like this. Lectures are useless.
Does not care about his job, tests are incredibly difficult and unfair towards students. He has no idea how to be a professor, no idea why Ohio State hired him.

New professor. Don't think he's qualified. Says his side job is selling phones? But he definitely treats being a professor as his side job instead. Lectures are not beneficial because he just gives answers with no explanations

summary_comment: Professor Oglevee is highly regarded for his engaging and interactive teaching style, making his class a favorite among students. He emphasizes real-world experiences through personal anecdotes and successful guest speakers, particularly those from the business world. While some find his class structure loose and occasionally challenging, most agree that active participation and engagement lead to a rewarding learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Oglevee is highly regarded for his engaging and discussion-based teaching style, which focuses on real-world experiences and guest speakers, making the class enjoyable and practical. Despite some initial challenges, students find his knowledge extensive and his approach to teaching effective, especially for those interested in entrepreneurship.

Ratings.comment: My favorite professor at Ohio State and favorite class. It's a discussion based class, so you just have to show up and participate and you won't need to study for weekly quizzes. He shares a lot of his personal experiences and has great guest speakers that were very successful in starting or investing in business. Definitely take it.

He is very cool beans



































































And also my uncle

Kinda scary at first but you get used to it after a week and he becomes a softy. Brings real world experiences to his lectures. Really cool guest lecturers as well. It's a great class if you want an introduction to entrepreneurship. He also runs his own business which is really cool. Do the reading and you'll do fine.

An amazing fun professor who loves to teach and is very knowledgable. Class was easy, the way he teaches the class is by talking with the class the entire time. He will go over material and ask the class questions as he goes. One pitch presentation by yourself, like 9-10 articles to read but I didn't read them. Group work and easy final exam

If you like Shark Tank, then this class is up your alley. This was one of my favorite classes at Fisher, he gives so many of his real world experiences which is a nice change from the academic lectures.. regarding his attitude, he is from New York so yeah, but once you look past that, it's a great class- I recommend it as one of your electives.

The class is ok but it doesn't really have a structure its pretty much just lose accumulations of what Dan thinks is important. Youll bounce around from subject to subject like nobody's business. The class is not really that hard but it gets annoying to watch 2 1/2 hrs of lecture videos a week. Also the poster assignment is dumb and super heavy.
His class is OK. If you are not a native English speaker his class is not for you. Be careful when you ask him questions, he might tell you your question is insane.

Professor Oglevee is a bit difficult to deal with at first, but he teaches his class with a purpose. If you are willing to pay attention in class, show up, and read the articles, you will be able to fully take advantage of the class. One of my favorite classes at Ohio State!

He teaches and acts the way he does for a reason, to get you prepared for the real world. He doesn't sugarcoat anything and will tell you how it is whether you like it or not. The subject matter is not that difficult so no need to worry if you go to class. He is a wealth of info so take advantage of it while you still can.

Dan is a good guy as long as you don't believe a word he says. He's got this impressive smokescreen but when you peel back the onion, that whats you have. A stinky onion making you cry. He's very nice-to-your-face and forgets you the moment you walk away kinda guy. Dan cares about 1 thing. Dan. A perfect professor for Game of Thrones

Interesting class if you're interested in what it takes to start a business. However, it is VERY MUCH based on his opinion. Should be called "The Life Of Daniel Oglevee." He is very narcissistic and it does tend to get annoying. However, easy class. Just do the reading and come prepared.
The class is very easy but time consuming. He and his TA never answer emails or any questions. Overall kinda pointless class but you need to take it with him

Dan's financial modeling class was the most useful 7-weeks of my MBA. This class revolved around building an arsenal of wall-street-grade financial models and preparing group case models to defend in class. Learned a LOT about formatting in excel, but it's made an immediate impact on my effectiveness at work. Expect to work for 7 weeks but worth it

Without a doubt, the best professor I've had as both an undergraduate and now as an MBA at Ohio State. Dan has developed a persona and reputation for being a tough professor and he lives up to it. He lives by the adage "first class work in a first class way", and demands high standards from his students. I've taken every class he teaches.

this class is like being homeschooled.  You are completely on your own.  The prof never returned emails and didnt have office hours.  One of the worst classes Ive ever taken.  The class is easy until the last two weeks.  The  class is basically run by the TA.  Oglevee was NEVER available, the TA was an idiot. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
I love his class! You can expect to learn a lot from him. The class material was not dry, and it was more like a MBA form. This is the class that worth you paying for the tuition.

This is a required class for finance major. And it is way too much. Not difficult or anything. Just we need to build excel sheet all over. kind of remind me of CS&E tho. His instruction was very unclear, especially at the beginning, we were so lost.
Hands down the best professor I have had, grad or undergrad.

Oglevee is a great guy but certainly one of the most difficult classes you can take. I would say finance students have a distinct advantage in his class over entrepreneur students since there is alot of fin modeling. Good life lessons and good professor but just very hard

Oglevee is awesome. His style of teaching isn't for everyone, but its definitely a unique approach. The thing I like about the class is that I felt the work I put into it reflected my grade, which I can't really say for any other Fisher class. Anyways, don't ask too many questions about the class; its an adventure and knowing 2 much would spoil it.

Professor Oglevee has extensive experience in the business world. He has worked on Wall Street and been an entrepreneur. He spends at least 20 minutes of each class session telling stories (which are very enriching) and giving tips on succeeding in business. He has high expectations but you will learn more as a result. Fantastic class.
590 is an amazing class. It is demanding but it was the most rewarding class of my 6 years at OSU. Dan challenges you to analyze you point of view and pushes you to defend it.
Great professor who is genuinely interested in the topic and helping students learn.  Focuses on real-world skills and teaches in a very hands-on way.
Very Nice Guy.  Very Helpful.

"My way or the high way" style.Zero tolerance on tardiness.Has unique grading system which he will not explain how it works. Lectures basicly gave tons of information and to see what you think of it.You have to be talent or expereinced or extremely passionate to succeed.
I actually really liked his class. Best Class I took at Fisher.  Real experience is shared with students.  Talks about real issues in the business world including social issues.  Good class.
learned incredible skills with him. Honest, direct and sharp.
Team teaches with Bill Rives, but in my mind is the better of the two professors. He can be a little rough around the edges at first, but is entertaining and extremely helpful once he's lightened up.
Best Professor for a business major. You'll learn a lot in any of his classes.
He is great!
Outstanding professor - His Bus-fin 494 course was the best class that I have taken at OSU.

Prof. Oglevee is BY FAR the best teacher on this campus! He knows more about the financial world because he has been there. He has great insight not only into the realm of finance but also how to succeed in business life. If you do nothing else at OSU you must take 590 with him! He cares about his students and is so interesting outside of class!!

Prof Oglevee is BY FAR the best teacher I have ever had at OSU. He gives so much insight to useful real world experience for business majors. His class is the only class I enjoyed attending in college. If I had one piece of advice for anyoone pursuing a career in the future, it would be to meet this man!!
Uses obscure multiple choice questions on quizzes and tests. You must read the text before attending class. Overall very helpful and sometimes entertaining.
Oglevee is one of the most refined business professors I have ever had. I strongly recommend taking his Derivatives class. He brings a wealth of real world information to class.
hard class but well worth the effort;good guy
He was a great professor who shared real life experience with us.  He cared about his students and explained the subject matter very thoroughly. I would take him for another Finance class

He tries to be a good teacher, however he wastes too much time telling personal stories.The tests are confusing, and meant to see how well you read the textbook. Oglevee does nothing more than read off a powerpoint that we already have, so he's worthless

Always calls on the same 5 people in class.  Does not give anyone else a chance to speak.  This was supposed to be a corporate finance class, and all he talks about is how much money he has lost in his ventures.  Would probably be a good start-up teacher.
TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM!  Great teacher, has real world experience, cares about students, learns names, small classes, interesting subject.  Highly recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Michael Wittry is highly regarded as one of the best instructors at Fisher College of Business, known for his passion, care, and ability to make complex financial concepts accessible and engaging through real-world applications. Students consistently praise his dedication to their success, his clear and insightful lectures, and his willingness to provide additional support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Michael Wittry is highly regarded as one of the best instructors at Fisher College of Business, known for his passion, care, and ability to make complex financial concepts accessible and engaging through real-world applications. Students consistently praise his dedication to their success and his willingness to provide additional support, making his corporate finance course a standout choice.

Ratings.comment: 100% best Fisher professor. Such a caring professor, super willing to look out for his student's best interests. Big big fan of Michael Wittry. Corporate Finance with him is an absolute must.

Great professor, lectures aren't boring, he really cares about watching his students succeed. I wish he taught more undergrad classes. His tests are kind of hard, but if you apply yourself, it's not too bad. 100% recommend taking Corp Fin with him.

Wittry is awesome. Funny dude, super chill and understanding. In-class time is used to go over practice problems and conceptual topics. The class isn't that hard, study an hour or two before each quiz and you'll be more than fine. Would 100% take this class with him again
Great professor. Wittry is very passionate about teaching and about his students and I cannot recommend him enough.

Professor Wittry is the best professor I have ever had. He combines being passionate and knowledgeable with just being a great person. Lectures are almost always enjoyable, and he often brings real-world content into the classroom. Take Wittry for Corporate Finance.

Probably the best professor I've had while at Ohio State. He's such a great teacher, but also a great person overall. His lectures are very insightful, and to the point, and his classes are not boring. I will miss his class!

Professor Wittry is an amazing professor. He cares a lot about his students and is very knowledgeable in finance. He makes sure everyone understands the content and makes himself even more available for those who need extra help. Compared to what I have heard about others who teach this course, I recommend taking it with him.

Corporate finance can be a dry subject but Professor Wittry both taught it well and tried to apply it to real-world events which made the material easier to digest. Not an easy A but not a crazy workload or anything, and Professor Wittry goes out of his way to help his students.

Professor Wittry was definitely one of my favorite professors. You can tell he really cares for his student's success and tries really hard to make sure you understand the material. The course consisted of bi-weekly quizzes, a group presentation, a midterm and a final. I wasn't a huge fan of the course, but the professor was just purely amazing.

There was a quiz almost every week that wasnt too bad. There was a simulation that you had to do with a group, then with the same group we presented a current event. The midterm was fine the final was difficult, but he gave a practice final that was about the same as the actual final so that was nice. Read your textbook and dont fall behind.

Professor Wittry easily became one of my favorite professors at Fisher. His ability to deliver material in a way that is understandable is what sets him apart from all other professors. He definitely cares about all of us succeeding and is always available after and outside of class. Weekly quizzes were very beneficial I wish he taught more courses

Best teacher I've had in Fisher! Mike is one of those professors that goes above and beyond to ensure the success of his students. He was so helpful and genuine in office hours, made sure his students were well prepared for his exams and quizzes, and related all material to the real world. Would absolutely take a course from him again!

summary_comment: Professor Werner is highly regarded for her teaching quality, being both knowledgeable and approachable. Students find her classes engaging and easy, with a focus on participation and practical applications like trading simulations. Her friendly demeanor and clear explanations contribute to a positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Werner is highly regarded for her accessible and approachable teaching style, making complex concepts easy to understand. Her extensive knowledge and genuine interest in her students' success contribute to a positive and engaging learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Nice class, not very difficult - accessible outside of class and will work with you. Extremely knowledgeable.

Trading and markets was a fun and easy class, she lectures and teacher well. She is super sweet and kind and always has a smile on her face. Class material was easy, I promise if you show up majority of the time you will get an easy A in this class. Most of the stuff is participation and the quizzes and final exam weren't hard at all.

Among the best Professors in Fisher!! She did so much in her field, very knowledgeable, is a part of multiple prestigious organizations yet still genuinely makes time for her students. Really down to earth and explains concepts super clearly. She makes us excited yet chill in trading simulations- "buy low sell high!" and wears her nasdaq sweater.

Ingrid's background is surprising considering how approachable she is. Very accomplished. She is also never in a bad mood. Also, about 50% of this class is spent basically playing a fun computer game simulating trading. Try and pick your group members for the various HWs and projects well in advance.
Shes Awesome! Loved the course.. and very helpful and friendly

summary_comment: Professor Sarkisyan provides comprehensive and easy-to-follow lectures, though his quizzes and tests are challenging, requiring significant independent study for success. Students have noted that there are additional opportunities to earn points outside of exams, particularly through quizzes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sarkisyan provides comprehensive and clear lectures that are easy to follow. However, the quizzes and tests are challenging, requiring significant independent study to perform well.

Ratings.comment: Professor Sarkisyan's lectures are fairly comprehensive and easy to follow. Quizzes and tests are difficult and you will need to learn independently to do well. Other opportunities for points are available if you do not do well on exams but need to do fairly well on quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor Sheridan is highly regarded for his effective teaching and engaging lectures, though some students find his initial demeanor intimidating. He is praised for fairness in grading, particularly on exams and projects, and for making complex topics accessible. Students appreciate his real-world application of investment concepts and his ability to inspire learning, though a few note that his confidence can sometimes come across as arrogance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sheridan is highly regarded for his effective lecturing and practical approach to teaching, making complex topics accessible and engaging. Despite some students finding him intimidating initially, many praise his fairness in grading and the value of attending class regularly.

Ratings.comment: Sheridan comes off scary asl when class starts but he grades easy and this exam are extremely fair if you come to class literally just study the slides and know it well. He grades the projects easy again just put in the time. Thought this class would be way harder than it is and he's a great lecturer. Hardest class to get into for a reason.
The best professor I've had at Fisher.  Lectures are great, and he is extremely knowledgeable and experienced

Professor Sheridan was awesome to learn from. He may not be for everyone but I learned more from him that in my entire time at OSU. He made me feel that I was spending money for his class that was actually worth it. The exams will be impossible if you don't go to class, I found myself wanting to go to class which is rare as I am a serial-skipper.

Professor Sheridan does a great job applying what was learned in the Intro to Investments class (Investments 4221) to the real world.  His lectures are very informative and even entertaining.  I have enjoyed this class more than any other course at OSU.  If you are passionate about investing, this class is for you!

Bad and mean person, thought himself smartest person in the world only because the experience of working in Wall Street before. He act like you are supposed to know everything and never talk more about anything. If you want kindness, dont choose him. He will let u know what is pride and prejudice.
Very Charismatic and great.

Professor Sheridan is such a great professor. He has taught me things that will literally change my life. Exams are fair and quizzes are easy. The investor policy statement was one of the most beneficial projects for my own personal investing future. On top of this he is a great lecturer. So glad I took this class!

Easily the best professor I have had at Ohio State. He makes the material fun, and by his delivery and engagement you will get so much more from the class. Easy grader on projects if everything is completed correctly. Exams can be difficult, but if you attend class should be easy to get by without much studying.
He is passionate but his class is sometimes confusing.. easily grade projects but hard exam.

He is the best professor I had in my time at OSU and Fisher specifically. His class is fun to go to and you will learn more about the real world and what is going on, than any other class you take here, I guarantee it. Go to class, not because he cares if you are there, but because you will learn so much. He is the man
Not a nice guy or a good person. Knows finance though..

Investment Strategies was an amazing class! The class ended up being curve about 1-2% which brought me to an A. There are a few quizzes that are easy, 2 projects which he grades pretty easily, then a midterm & final. Sheridan is passionate about the markets and this was my favorite class in Fisher!

Good guy and definitely knows his stuff about the financial markets. Can get a little political at times which takes away from the class since it has pretty much nothing to do with investment strategies but his crazy amount of knowledge outweighs any negative.

Prof Sheridan has been my favorite Professor not only in Fisher but at OSU in general. If you are interested in asset management or investing in general, Sheridan does a phenomenal job of doing market updates during class and setting you up for success as an investor. He is also hilarious and has quoted Jack Harlow a few times. Highly recommend.

TAKE THIS CLASS. This was my favorite finance elective by far, and I really think that I learned how to invest for myself and my future. This was the most useful class I took in four years. Sheridan is so funny and I really loved his daily market updates. Take this if you want to learn something! And go to class! Exams are pretty tough tho

I learned more in this class about investment finance and personal finances, than my other three years of undergrad. Exams are easy, projects are not bad as long as you have a full group. The class is focused solely on whats going on in the markets, so as long you show up everyday its an easy A-. Hes not very nice or flexible, but teaches well.

This was my favorite class at OSU by far. Sheridan was kind, helpful, and incredibly knowledgeable about finance/markets. This being said, the class consists of challenging material, projects, and exams (choose groups wisely). For those interested in asset management / IB, you will greatly benefit from this course. It landed me a great job!

Took his personal finance class for non-finance majors, and the fact that this isn't required is crazy. He gave us 2 pop quizzes (on carmen, but he told us about them in lecture and you had the whole weekend to complete them) for 10 points each, while the three homework assignments were 100 points each!! Lowest exam grade dropped. Highly recommend.

Matt is a great professor whose passion for finance is deep-seated.  Class lectures aim to help you understand how current events and the macro-economy affect the marketplace.  This class is going to be hard for you if you are more comfortable reading textbooks versus going to lectures  a good amount of testable material comes from lectures.

Very good lecturer. Knows the material well and imparts that knowledge well. Gives fair exams which were a little challenging, but all multiple choice with a focus on terminology. Entertaining lecturer too, always seems prepared to keep the audience engaged.  Overall, very good professor.

Matt was an outstanding professor. He really knows the material and delivers it enthusiastically and understandably. Brings in current news regarding the commercial real estate industry. This class gets you Argus certified, a gold standard DCF software for the RE industry. Must show up and go through case studies to do well. Not a gimme grade.
The Urban Meyer of teaching

Sheridan was the man. Fun lectures, learned a lot, and he is wicked smart. He trys to make complext topics interesting. It's a hard class if you can't attend all the time. I felt behind if I just missed one class. He covers about 13 chpaters in the text and adds a ton more material. Also requires WSJ. Tests are hard.

If you can take a class with Matt DO IT, and then fail so you can do it again -- he's that good.  Matt makes class fun, teaches you what you didn't know you needed to know, and makes finance better than it is. Hands down one of the best at Fisher. Do it.

Very good professor. Ties current events to classroom material 100% of time; 85% of the class is going to be over current events. Great resource for the industry and very easy to talk to after class or in office hours.

Investments 4221 taught by Professor Sheridan was the best class I have taken at Fisher. The class is taught 85% on current market events and 15% from the book. This I thought made the class very interesting especially when he correlated market events with his past career experiences of working with some of the top fund managers in the world.
Phenomenal professor, best I have ever had. Would take again.

Matt is an excellent professor and very engaged in teaching. Argus is a very useful tool for a career in Real Estate, and he always used current news and events, which made the class even more interesting and helpful. I totally recommend this class!

Matt is the best professor you can have in this field. He is extremely helpful, and he incorporated related news into the lecture, which I think was really a great thing. Strongly recommend this class!

Matt was an awesome professor for just starting at OSU. Real life stories applying to the finance world, going through the Wall Street Journal talking about recent events, and the course material all made for a great class and a lot to learn. Awesome guy.

Matt is one of my favorite professors in Fisher. He's a typical wall street guy, charming, humorous, and professional.  He's teaching style is different from most of Fisher faculties, probably because he has working experience in Bloomberg, NYC. Wall Street Journal is a must for the course. Getting an A is easy as long as you come to class.

One of my favorite instructors at OSU. Unlike other finance classes it wasn't overshadowed by assumption-laden theory, but instead was much more practical. Matt's industry experience was evident in every class. If you go to class, pay attention, and ask questions, you can't help but learn a ton about financial markets and current market events.

If you really want to learn reality finance, you can not miss Matt! He reads and explains news from WSJ and Financial Times every beginning of class. He also uses Bloomberg software to explain lecture content. Taking Matt's class= fun + learn a lot+good grade ( if you pay attention to class).

Matt likes to read us the hottest financial news thru Financial Times, New York Times and Wall Street, which are really helpful as we can approach the real financial world. This is also demonstrated in our exam. He is also a funny guy and you can learn a lot and have fun in classes. Taking his classes is a definitely good and smart choice !

Boys and girls!!!! If you are interest in real finance world, Matt is the guy can help you. His class is THE BEST in OSU. His class is easy, funny, interesting, real and most important things is give you a real view of finance. For example, he will try to read all important news on the class, from my working experience i know how important it is ?
Pretty down to earth prof. He's very helpful and his classes are actually enjoyable. He uses current events to explain things and his exams are no too bad. It was def worth taking his class

summary_comment: Professor Salopek is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with numerous students praising his knowledge, engaging lectures, and ability to make complex topics accessible and enjoyable. His classes are described as both informative and entertaining, with many students recommending him to others and expressing a desire to take additional courses taught by him.
summary_comment_short: Professor Salopek is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with students praising his knowledge, engaging lectures, and ability to make complex topics accessible and enjoyable. His classes are consistently praised as some of the best in the Fisher College of Business, with many students recommending him to others and expressing a strong desire to take additional courses from him.

Ratings.comment: Bro has 24 5-stars for a reason.
Amazing Professor, would recommend him to anyone who can take him. Very knowledgeable and funny guy. Made me want to come to class. Going to take him again for his higher level course.

What everyone says is true, Salopek is an amazing professor. His lectures is extremely interesting and everything he teaches is relevant. Attendance is mandatory but it's such a good class you'll want to be there anyways. Quizzes and exams aren't hard, just study what he says and you'll be fine
Amazing professor! Makes the class so easy and enjoyable, very minimal studying involved. If you have to take Investments, take Salopek. You won't regret it! Best professor in Fisher

Steve Salopek is the best professor in Fisher! I had him in AU 22 for investments and it was my favorite business class I've ever taken. His lectures are engaging and it is easy to pay attention and follow along. He worked in the industry for years and has incredible stories from Wall Street. The exams and quizzes are very fair. He is hilarious!

Steven is one of the best professors at fisher hands down! he is super knowledgeable and engaging and cares about his students succeeding. easy to get an A/A- by giving effort into assignments. so good almost made me switch from corporate finance to investments!! TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!! you wont regret it!
Great teacher.
A really cool dude

Professor Salopek was awesome especially for someone like myself who came into his class knowing very little about investments. He has great real world experience that he ties into the material to make it interesting and tests and quizzes are really fair and straight forward. Would highly encourage people to take his class if they can!!

Best professor I had in Fisher. Most I've learned from a course and with little stress or effort. Incredible lectures. Minimal homework. Unbelievable industry knowledge. Cares for his students. Funny guy.

One of the best Fisher professors. This class was the easiest A I've received in my college career because he is such a great lecturer. His career is super interesting and definitely knows what he's talking about, but still really cares about his students. Take this class!

Take his class. Cool guy and knows his stuff. Actually wants you to learn that's why its on the easy side because he doesn't try to test you on things he doesn't teach you. He teaches you learn you do good. Wish more classes were like this. I would take this even if it wasn't required for my major.

Steve legit changed my life. You WILL get out what you put in. I showed interest in him and the material from day 1 and Steve was able to put me in contact with somebody at JP Morgan which ultimately led to me accepting an offer at JPM. Moral of the story is Steve is a legend and is genuinely interested in his student's success and will help!

I wish he taught every class at Fisher. The best Professor to take. Caring, respected and wants you to learn about the financial markets. Show up on time, stay engaged, ask questions and review his PPT slides. Guaranteed A
Best professor, by far, I've ever had in my life. He worked on Wall Street for over 20 years of his life, and knows Investing like the back of his hand. He will change your life, no joke.

Professor Salopek is by far my favorite professor in fisher. He cares about his students and is available both in and outside of office hours. His lectures are great as all of the important information is on the powerpoints making it easier to study but he brings in fun examples from his wall street experience to make lectures engaging.

This is the best class I have ever taken. He teaches the required material by connecting it to relevant current events. The lectures are always engaging and are never boring. Every assignment is extremely relevant to a career in Investments and is an opportunity to really learn something. Exams are straightforward and quizzes are open note/book.

GOAT. He is probably one of the best professors that I have taken at Fisher. His wall street experience is great and is really straightforward. There are no tricks in his midterms or quizzes. All the other fisher teachers can learn how to teach from this man.

Steven Salopek is by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU. I learned more in this class than I have in any other here. He is reasonable, informative, and understanding. You need to be in class to get the necessary information, but he makes you enjoy being in class so this isn't really an issue. He is extremely fair with grading & testing

Professor Salopek is by far one of the greatest professor's I've ever had. His knowledge of Wall Street is incredible and he puts great effort into making his classes interesting and useful. His class is a breeze if you pay attention during class, and it's honestly hard not to listen to him talk. He's a brilliant guy and an awesome teacher.

Steve is the best professor I have had in Fisher. He is very straight forward and always ties his lecture content to current events, making it easier to grasp. He is very funny and lets you take quizzes with open notes.

Salopek makes this course wonderful by bringing great people who have interesting experience in their careers. Weekly assignments but they don't take more than 1 hour each week. Cares about us and gets to know every student. Salopek also allows students that complete the course access to future speakers. Would definitely recommend!

Professor Salopek was truly an inspirational professor. He cares about his students and his passion for teaching is shown in his lectures and stories. Quizzes are open notes and exams are fair (he doesn't try to trick you on problems). Lectures can sometimes be dry and straight off the powerpoint, but I would take Salopek again in a heartbeat!

Best teacher I have taken at Fisher in 4 years. Professor Salopek had the most interesting lectures and every student was engaged. Very personable in office hours and is always open to any questions, even outside of the topic of investments. Really brings his 25+ years of wall street experience to the classroom. Would take this professor 100%.

He worked in Wall Street for over 20 years. The class is strongly related to outside world. Not only taught knowledge but also skills needed for jobs. Quizzes are open books and midterm is fair. Take him if you could. Suggest him to anyone

summary_comment: Professor Papadakis is known for her demanding yet fair grading system and the necessity of active participation. Students must prepare extensively, as she frequently cold calls on them and emphasizes attendance. While the course requires significant work, many find her approachable and her lectures engaging, leading to a rewarding learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Papadakis is known for her demanding yet fair grading system and the necessity of active participation in class, including frequent cold calls. Her courses require significant preparation and self-study, but many students find her approachable and her lectures engaging, leading to substantial learning despite the workload.

Ratings.comment: You have to do so much work for this class especially if you get cold called later in the semester because you gotta be ready to really explain what she asks for. This is BY FAR THE EASIEST ADVANCE FINANCE COURSE by it lowkey hella work. She is lowkey unclear on what she grades on but grades pretty fair. YOU MUST GO TO CLASS AND PARTICIPATE!

Absolutely loved her, shes so nice and gives interesting lectures. Theres a lot of reading and prep work for class, she cold calls everyone just once throughout the whole semester, and takes attendance & participation every class. 3 individual assignments and a big group project at the end. Shes a very lenient grader though and easy to talk to.
Not taught like a typical class.  Participation and attendance is mandatory.  Must be prepared for cold calls for credit.

Assignments are very on your own and unclear. Lectures are okay if you can be comfortable with being cold called on. She is friendly in lecture, but save yourself if you ever have a question on a case assignment. Grades are very few and tough, so it's hard to really get a great grade.

There were cases before class and discussions in class. Three assignments, a final project, and group simulation were the only assignments. Topics were interesting and she is passionate about the content. My advice to students would be to attend every class and seek one-on-one help to get the necessary feedback that isn't given automatically.

Professor Papadakis has a great class setup. Three assignments, simulation, presentation, and rest is participation. She will cold call on you at least once, but it is easy to earn participation credit. Just read the cases prior to class and attend class regularly and you will get an A. Seems like she's asking for a lot, but it is easy to do well.

KP is an extremely knowledgeable professor & is always willing to help/answer questions about HW & case studies. Attendance and cold calling is graded. Its easy to get an A if you regularly attend class and follow along with the case studies. Not attending will leave you feeling behind and lost. I would definitely take again, I learned a lot.

Great instructor. Class is tough but she grades very fairly and is very willing to work with students outside the classroom. Participation matters and she takes into account effort given in class. Would take again

Loved Kennia. Her lectures are fun and interesting. Just show up to class, do the assignments and you'll get an A. She is so nice to meet with and is genuinely interested in helping people. I learned a lot from this class.

Many individual homework assignments, with one group project at the end. Participation is important to her, but it honestly doesn't take much to get a decent grade. Don't be worried if you're lost--most students are. Just try your best and be sure to communicate if you're having trouble. No exams makes this class a lot less stressful than others.
Loved KP! She's very personable and understanding. She is definitely a tough grader, but I feel like I got a lot out of her class that I'll use into my career. Highly recommend!

Good class and professor. Grades consist of 3 case assignments and participation on weekly discussions on cases. She will cold call on you a few times over the semester. Fairly relaxed grader on the case assignments. Probably spend 12 hours per graded case. She can seem tough on some questions she asks or responses. Most cases are interesting

I had a tough time in this class. And I am a straight-A student. She expects students to know everything and expects us to solve the cases before class when she hasn't even taught anything! She wants everyone to participate and makes it a significant portion of the grade. I only took it because she was the only one. Else, HARD PASS on her classes.

Read 14 cases (1 per week). show up and contribute to the class discussion and you will earn your 20% participation grade. Submit 4 excel files based on 4 selected cases (more about interpreting data than the actual numbers); this makes up other 80%. My favorite class at Fisher, hands down

She knows her stuff when it comes to corporate finance, she has the education and experience to back it up too. You are graded by only five things with one being participation but she is not a tough grader at all. Participation is a key part of the class so come prepared and you'll be fine. Overall I usually looked forward going to class.

Participation is 20% of the grade. She often cold-calls, so it is important to prepare before classes. Tough grader on the homework assignments and doesn't give feedback. Very tough to do well unless you participate; showing up to class but not speaking doesn't give you any points. All case-based (weekly case discussions and 5 case homeworks).

Kennia knows the material well and is funny in class.  Participation is important, as it is a large part of your grade.  She gives good feedback on your projects, and isn't too tough of a grader.  I would recommend taking her class.

It doesn't seem like you learn much in this class.  Changes the policy of grading throughout the semester, not consistent, and not organized.  PPT slides are not helpful, in order to learn or to complete the assignment  one needs to google everything.

summary_comment: Professor Birru is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and willingness to help students. His teaching style is described as humble and supportive, making the material accessible and memorable. While his exams can be challenging, particularly the final, students find them manageable with proper preparation and attendance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Birru is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and willingness to assist students. His classes are challenging but manageable with consistent attendance, and he is known for his kindness and approachability.

Ratings.comment: Birru is a great professor and his lectures are engaging. He is really humbled and willing to help students to solve their questions. The exam was not easy, but as long as you attend to the lectures, it's gonna be ok.

Very nice and humble guy. Lectures are engaging and encourages students to ask and answer questions; flows almost like a story so it's easy to recall during the exam. 3 homework assignments and a final exam which wasn't too bad.

The final is not easy (multiple choice & a few short answer) & it is worth 45% of your grade. The is mostly about the efficient market hypothesis not individuals investors behaviors. Birru is super kind though and a great professor.
Great professor! Really a nice person to talk with.

The class is 3 homework assignments and a final exam worth 55% of your grade. The homework is not difficult and does not take very long. The final covers all material and is tough to study for because its the first time you see how he formats tests. Overall, the exam was not overly difficult if you took the time to go through all of the slides.

summary_comment: Professor Irvine is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes even challenging subjects like law more enjoyable. Students appreciate his passion, the interactive nature of his lectures, and his commitment to their learning, though they note the class requires significant preparation and participation. Despite the difficulty, Irvine's dedication and clear explanations lead to effective learning and well-prepared students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Irvine is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes even challenging subjects enjoyable. Students appreciate his passion, thorough preparation, and genuine interest in their success, though they note the class demands significant effort and participation.

Ratings.comment: Irvine is kind of goated. Dude had memes from 2010 in his slides and was funny as hell. If I was old enough I'd sit back and crack open a cold one with that man. I will ask him to be my firstborn's godfather.

Was not looking forward to this class and I have never liked law, but professor Irvine made it so enjoyable. He does cold call, but its okay and it's genuinely is because he wants you to learn. You basically work through real example cases in lecture to make it make sense. I would recommend and really enjoyed this class overall!

Professor Irvine is passionate but the class is challenging. Lots of textbook reading and participation required. Use unstuck study to supplement your studies - it really helped me prepare for the tough exams.
