Great professor who tries to get everyone engaged. The exams are really difficult and it can be easy to fall behind because the class is a session class. I hope they can change the class to semester long because there is just way too much material to cover in half a semester.

Professor Irvine is the best professor I've had at OSU. He makes the law interesting and genuinely cares about his students' success. The class is not easy and there is a lot of reading, and he expects you to come to class prepared and participate. If you put in the work, you will do well and you won't regret taking this course with this professor.

Professor Irvine was one of my favorite professors this semester! His class took a minute for me to get used to, but once you get in a good habit of reading the textbook, it's super easy to maintain. If you do the readings, the cold-calling isn't bad at all. I found the class super interesting and learned a lot! Exams were difficult, but fair.

Professor Irvine is one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State. The classes are structured well—reading beforehand and cold-calling/participation while he teaches the content. Exams are tough but fair and I felt prepared after attending class and studying. I learned so much about law—you should definitely take this class with Irvine

I think this is the class I have learned the most in at OSU. I do not like law but he made it interesting and I genuinely learned so much. Just paying attention and participating in class made me retain so much that studying for the exams wasn't a lot. He cares about the material and the students so much and it shows!!!

Professor Irvine definitely takes a minute to get used to. He is a really caring guy who cares deeply about the topic and makes the class interesting. He will cold-call you in class, so make sure you read the pre-lecture material. The tests were not easy but definitely fair. He is willing to help if you have a question. Would take him again.

Professor Irvine genuinely cares about his students. The class is not easy, involves a lot of textbook reading and participation in class (he will call on you) but if you show up and put in the work you will be fine. He is very passionate about the material and makes the class interesting!

Professor Irvine is the best! He made 8 am lectures actually interesting and genuinely wanted to engage his students and teach them what he knows. While this class is one of the harder ones I've taken at OSU, he curves final grades a lot and I got a ton of extra credit for not missing a class and doing well(ish) (Bs) on the exams.

Great professor! While his class is probably harder than the other professors that teach it, I learned a lot. You must read the chapter before class because he will call on you. His lectures are helpful and he makes them entertaining. He is very focused on ensuring students understand the content and he is accessible outside of class.

This class is definitely one of the harder classes I have taken in Fisher. Do NOT skip the readings or lectures. The cold calling is not as bad as it sounds. Professor Irvine is a very genuine guy. He truly cares about his students. I definitely thought this class was hard, but attend office hours for bonus points!!!

I loved him as a professor but the class is very difficult. Most people complain about the cold calling but it is not that bad at all. Tons of reading is required which is quite a pain and your grade is determined by 2 tests. I failed the first one and it cost me my entire grade. Make sure to study hard. Good guy though and the lectures were fun.
Professor Irvine is very passionate but makes the class a little more tedious than it needs to be. Participation credit is somewhat subjective.
Professor Irvine is a really good teacher, and you will learn a lot from him. The exams are pretty tough but as long as you participate and go to office hours you will do well in the class.
Tests are ridiculously hard

Great teaching approach if you're pre-law. If you're a business student, he's probably like nothing you've seen before. He WILL call on you, and you should probably know the answer. You can't pass all the time without your grade not being affected. If you want a challenging law course taught be a man who knows his stuff, take him. Easy A? Not him.
TERRIBLE. If you want to take this class take Blackburn. His exams are impossible and call on you during lecture and if you don't know the answer he takes points off your grade. AVOID HIM.
Great person, lectures are interesting, and he genuinely cares about his students. If you have a good attitude and put in just a decent amount of effort, you'll do well.

Took him for 3500 and 4510. He has a vast knowledge of the law and tries to make the class fun. However, he requires a LOT for a 1.5-credit class. His exams are tough and they cover 8 to 9 chapters, most of the questions are situation-based questions just like the homework. He calls on people to participate so be prepared for that!

To be honest for a 1.5 credit hour class, his classwork is just a lot. He expects you to read 10-15 pages every week and gives homework every other day. Take Blackburn to pass it with ease or have Irvine to  struggle. Your choice.
avoid him
Best

Professor Irvine as an individual is great. He is great at being interactive in lecture, and expects students to participate (will cold call on you). Exams are very tough, there is a lot of pre class reading (class is 3 days/week, new chapter everyday), homework assignments due before class. Personally recommend prefer another professor.
worst.

Professor Irvine is a nice guy, but his class is way to difficult considering the other Law professor that teaches this class is very lenient with grading. The exams are extremly hard and way to long.

Irvine was an amazing professor - you could tell he genuinely cares about teaching the law. Attendance is mandatory and participation is mandatory but he actually makes the class fun, especially for a 9am. You get a 1 pg cheat sheet on exams. Go to class, read the book, and you'll be fine.

Irvine is my favorite professor Ive had. He cares about participation and getting to know you. You need to come to class prepared and having done the readings. The readings take anywhere between 30-60 minutes. The effort you put into this class is what youll get back. Get to know Irvine and the material and youll enjoy it!

Irvine is a great professor and gives amazing lectures. But in order to understand what the lectures are about, you need to read the book. His exams are super tough, but fair in all honesty. He also usually gives a good curve too.

I enjoyed having Irvine for 3500. I think some people may find him disrespectful, but he is very blunt. It is easy to tell he has worked in law and attended a rigorous law school. There is a lot of reading, but as long as you keep up with the assigned work and attend class, you should be golden. He is a solid choice for 3500.

Professor Irvine has great lectures and really wants you to learn more about Business Law. He holds great lectures and goes over plenty of examples of what he is teaching. He usually allows you to use one side piece of paper filled with notes for the midterm and the final. The class is difficult mainly because exams are worth most of your grade.

I feel that he does a great job explaining the topics and genuinely cares about his students. If you put in the work to read the material and pay attention during class, you will be sure to get an A. Also gives us a page of notes for the midterm. I would 100% take his class again!

I really enjoyed having Professor Irvine for both 3500 and 4510. I saw that some people found him to be disrespectful. I can see where they would feel that way, but I think he's just very enthusiastic about the class. You can tell he genuinely enjoys teaching, and he's super helpful at office hours. Don't skip on the readings, its super important!!

One of my favorite professors I've had. Expects you to be prepared for lecture but very accessible outside of class. There's a good amount of lecture prep but it does help prepare you for quizzes. Can be a challenging class but professor Irvine cares about making sure you understand the material.
Very difficult, extremely rude, would not recommend. Not good at explaining, self absorbed.

had to meet three times a week for 20 minutes and expected you to come prepared with questions. mixed feelings because i loved the coursework but the weekly quizzes seemed impossible to score over a 75 percent. cares about his students but in a dry way . yelled at my class for us doing badly on a homework which was funny but also annoying

One of the worst professors at osu, extremely disrespectful. I asked him questions he laughed in my face and told me what I thought was ridiculous on multiple occasions. Cold calls everyday. I can handle hard but he is rude and uncouth.

1.5 Hr Class that harder than most of ur 3 hrs. Professor is mean yells at students for getting questions wrong and whistles annoyingly over microphone at 10am. Test and quiz are hard. HW extremely hard class avg 66 would not recommend.

Came into the class pretty nervous about Dr. Irvine. I might have a different opinion after the first midterm, but this guy is one of the best professors I've had. Lots of reading for sure and that gets annoying. And he does expect a lot out of you. But his cold calling and humor keeps you engaged on a dry subject for 50 min. Pretty impressive.
Expects too much from his students, class is 3 days a week ,meaning you must have taken very descriptive notes of 3 chapters or else you will lose points in participation and pop quizzes.

One of my favorites. There is a lot of reading and he cold calls, but the reading is basically a bunch of Jerry Springer style stories so it's not entirely dry. And it's more so general concepts and lots of important stuff in bold, so even if you're super tired just reading over once will be enough to get through class. Tests are tough but fair.

Irvine is a great professor and person who you can tell genuinely cares about his students. Very accessible out of class and wants to help. However, the class is a solid 2 hours of reading 3 times a week, and exams are difficult. Generous curve at end of class

The only thing good about Irvine is his personality. Amazing guy, extremely funny, and very knowledgeable. However, DO NOT take for law. This was by far the hardest class I have ever taken and the most work I've done than all of my other classes combined. He's a great person, but not worth 2+ hours of reading 3x a week and insanely hard exams.

great guy who makes the class fairly interesting. will definitely hold your attention, but cold calls for pretty much every question in class. 20 pages of dense reading roughly every two days. Def easier profs you could take

Prof Irvine is amazing at what he does. He's by far one of the most passionate professors I have ever taken, and the only professor that woke you up at 8am- for a law class. He is by far one of the best professors at Fisher. However, the class is notoriously difficult- tons of reading and cold calls, with little to 0 grades. Pray for a curve.

There are def easier professors you could take. But Irvine is the best. He's so funny, makes you WANT to learn the material and makes you work for this. Make sure you read every night. He likes to call on people and you better know the answer. If you sit in the front row, he calls on you less. The exams are more application based so know your stuff

Prof Irvine really knows Law well and enjoys teaching it. He gives very engaging lectures so BE PREPARED when he calls on you. Attendance is mandatory (graded) but worth it since you learn a lot and he's also hilarious! READ the chapters/handouts, TAKE NOTES, and GO TO CLASS. The class isn't easy but I learned so much and enjoyed every meeting. 5/5

Don't take him early in the day, and definitely don't sit front row or he'll call on you nonstop. Readings every class and 50-100 questions on midterm and final. Way too much work for 1.5 credits. Pop quizzes as well. Heavy reading. Heavy lecture. Must show up to class for participation.

Irvine is a great guy and makes the criteria interesting. However, he goes SO fast and calls on you at random in class. It's hard to keep up. Graded on attendance and participation. Exams are fairly difficult; put in work and you can pull of a B on them. Don't be afraid to ask questions because when he passes it, he won't go back.

Irvine is very passionate about law, which is what made his class fun and interesting. However, it is a lot of work. You have to read each chapter and takes notes so that you can answer any question he throws at you during class. He is super energetic in class and expects a lot out of everyone. His exams are also decently challenging as well.

Professor Irvine is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. He makes the potentially boring subject of law interesting. Make sure to do all of the readings, though, because class participation is a must if you want a good grade. The exams are a little tough, but as long as you keep up on the readings and engage with him in class, you'll do ok

This is my second time taking professor Irvine and I enjoyed it just as much as the first. Law is a pretty dry subject but Irvine does a great job livening it up. If participation is low or people do not know the material, he will have pop quizzes so read the chapters. Exams are tough but fair if you study appropriately

Had Irvine for 3500 my freshman year and enjoyed his class so much I decided to take 4510 as a finance elective my senior year. Same format as 3500, 7 weeks with a whole lot of reading and participation required. Favorite classes and professor by far at OSU, really cares that you learn the material and does it in a fun way. Highly recommended!!!

Very smart man; extremely knowledgable about his subject. Makes law somewhat interesting. Lots of reading and he cold calls you in class. Exams are very tough (the final was 81 questions in 80 minutes) but he gives a fair curve. If you do the readings and show up to class you will do decent.

Exams are horrendous. 81 questions in 80 minutes and each question is based off of a wordy text prompt. Confusing, he labels three participants in a problem Jack Jill and Joe. Unnecessarily hard and he tries to make you fail those exams.

Irvine is an extremely engaging and intelligent professor. The midterm & final together make up over 75% of your grade so make sure you read all the textbook sections, take diligent notes, and go through his power points. Always read because when he calls on students if 3 people answer incorrectly there is a pop quiz. Challenging but learned a lot

Truly an awesome professor. He is certainly knows the material like no other. Its a 7 weeks course so you have to read, read, read, it is a must in order to pass. He has pop quizzes and grades for attendance/participation so it is important to be at class. Midterm and Final can be tricky if you do not study, take notes while reading. He curves well

Professor Irvine makes a pretty dry class worth going to.  He is an extremely funny guy and his lectures are awesome. There is unfortunately a ton of reading, and he randomly calls on people to make sure everyone is keeping up. He makes pop quizzes if the class is not prepared on any given day. Exams are pretty tough but theres a pretty nice curve

INTENSE but very good at what he does. Walks around classroom to engage and has no shame is calling anyone out. KEEP UP WITH THE READINGS or you will get behind fast. Exams are challenging but hey, that's law for you.

Professor Irvine is hilarious! One of the best lecturers I've ever had. Definitely makes going to class pretty enjoyable. BUT, by far one of the harder classes I've ever taken. The reading never stops, exams are extremely difficult, and there are pop quizzes. He expects you to read EVERY piece of text on whatever is assigned (book, article, etc.)

What makes this class difficult is the amount of material covered (20 chapters), not the material itself. Read for thorough understanding before every class and make sure to participate. Class is enjoyable as long as you're prepared, and you'll find yourself laughing a lot. Exams were tough but not impossible, and he gives a very fair curve.

This was not an easy class by any stretch, but Prof Irvine makes it enjoyable. You should have fun during class. The work outside of class sucks - a lot of reading and you will struggle if you do not do the readings. Exams can be really specific. I got a B by participating, doing the hw, and getting low  70s on the exams.

Prof. Irvine is the best professor at Fisher. I had him for 3500 and enjoyed the class so much I took 4510 as an elective (Finance). Do the reading (tons of reading), take good notes on the reading, participate in class, and you will do just fine. Be professional. He will make you work hard for an A. This is how college is supposed to be taught.

Dr. Irvine is one of the best and most meaningful professors within Fisher. All of his lectures were engaging (since he calls on people randomly, which forces you to pay attention). The class is definitely hard though, and there are substantial readings every night. Exams have huge weight.

Second round with Joe. Do the readings, come to class, and pay attention. He expects you to prepare for each class like a professional, and there is a lot of reading in this class. However, he is also fun, really engages with his students, and makes a boring subject like law pretty manageable. He is a great professor, but the class is not easy

Very intelligent, funny professor. He blasts music before class. Make SURE you do the reading, he will randomly call on people and gives pop quizzes. Offers case studies for EC. Make sure to raise your hand and talk in class for participation. He starts the day off with a joke so have one ready! One of my fave profs, although he is very strict.

Calls on you randomly and knowing the answer is a smal part of your grade so it makes class very stressful. Make sure you have read the chapter for class always and know the material. Doing this really sets you up for exams though in exchange. Also pop quizzes can hurt you when they came up if you aren't ready. Exams are somewhat difficult to.

Irvine was by far the most student friendly teacher I have had here at OSU. He is extremely knowledgable, very nice, funny and is a great teacher. Yes, you have to read a lot because he will randomly call on students but he makes the class very interesting.
Irvine is the best professor I've ever had. You won't regret four years of collage after taking his class! Lectures are amazing and what he teaches is very useful in daily life.
The final was much harder and more specific than the midterm. He is a nice guy but this class takes a lot of work and reading before you go into class

Fun class, but it was really hard. Offers a decent size curve of about 7-10%. Have to  go to class because give pop quizzes and he takes attendance. Only one midterm worth 35% of your grade and final is worth 45% of your grade the rest is homework and pop quizzes. Need the book and come to class prepared bc he calls on people randomly.

This professor tried to make class fun. He is a pretty cool guy. Always blasts music before class, and sometimes will give a quiz. If you read and go to class, you will easily get a good grade. He doesn't require attendance, but he takes participation grade.

You have to work hard to earn an A. Keep up with him in class, try to participate as much as you can. Especially for international students like me, because he speaks really fast. So do the reading, go to class, raise your hand, and that's it.

Irvine is a great teacher overall. He is hilarious in class to help keep you engaged, makes law somewhat fun! Make sure to do the reading, show up everyday, and answer some questions in class to get participation points and you will do well. There is a curve at the end with optional bonus credit available.

Class was a lot of fun.  He always blasts music before and after class, and his lectures are extremely engaging.  He WILL call on you at random, so make sure you've read the material.  Exams aren't easy, but if you've put time into reading the book well and taking good notes, you should do fine.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TAKING DETAILED NOTES.

Best Professor I've ever had.  Guy is a Dude! Hilarious. Phenomenal Teaching Style. Lectures fly by because he keeps you so engaged. Plays music before class and gets you HYPED for Law. Read the book, highlight stuff, take notes, do the homework, and you'll be fine. Only class in my life I've ever looked forward to going to. Irvine for President.
Irvine is the man. Makes lectures interesting and fun. I can honestly say I enjoyed going to class. Get ready to read though

Irvine is great. The class isn't easy, but it could be if you put the work i and really try to learn the information. I feel like I have taken a great deal from this course and he is my favorite professor so far at Fisher. He is hilarious and truly cares about his students. Absolutely recommend.
GREAT-Must take him

The exams are tough but if you do all the reading and attend class you will be fine. He is a fantastic professor that really cares about his students and is very knowledgeable about the material. He made class very enjoyable and unlike most classes I've taken, I feel like I actually learned something and retained the information.

Test are really tough. You have to read so much. You cover 20 chapters for a 7 week course which is ridiculous. There are homeworks due before each class. I participated a lot every class and still did not get full participation points. Teaches the material well but the test questions are 10 times harder than the information you learn

Irvine is a great teacher and is very passionate about law. You must read the book and be prepared for class because he WILL call on you to answer questions. This was a very hard class and his exams are extremely difficult. He takes attendance every day and 30% of your grade is based on participationHW & quizzes. Banking on the curve to get a C.

Prof Irvine is passionate about what he teaches and will turn a seemingly boring lecture into a funny and engaging experience (that is if you did the reading, otherwise you can barely contribute).  Must read and must go to class if you want to pass.  Couldn't imagine taking this course with any other professor.

HE's a really good dude. Makes Business Law, a normally boring topic, interesting and fun. You have to keep up on reading because he calls on students at random, but I don't think anyone minded because his lectures were so engaging.
The best professor I've had in Fisher. Reading every chapter is crucial. Substantial curve at the end.

He really makes a boring subject as fun as it could be!!I love his personality as a person. One thing to note is that you will definitely be called to answer questions so be prepared. As a professor, he's kind of strict during the semester, but curves up two letter grades in the end.
Fun prof, tests are kind of hard. Reading was a lot and very hard for a 7week class.

He's truly invested in making learning an interactive experience. While the subject is boring, he does a very good job of keeping the class interesting. Very good sense of humor, come prepared with lawyer jokes.
He is really NOT a good teacher!!!Never reply emails!!Everything is hard.Worst teacher I have ever seen
Good teacher, boring subject. He does a good job to keep it entertaining. Fair difficulty class, be sure to stay on top of the reading and attendance is mandatory

Professor Irvine is one of my favorite professors during my studies at OSU and definitely my favorite from inside Fisher. You may think that law is boring but he will find ways to make discussions interesting. Class attendance mandatory; tests are fairly hard but he gives a decent curve at the end of everything.

By far the best professor I've had in my 4+ years at Ohio State. Truly cares about the material and loves his students. He made this class fun for me, which I did not expect at all for a law class. Make sure you read because he does ask questions and will have random quizzes if multiple people don't know answers to his questions.
You have to take Irvine for 3500.  He is engaging and truly cares about his students.  Make sure you read though (He randomly questions people). But if you read, you will do fine on his tests.

Great class! Basically the same format as 3500. Far class. Like everyone is saying, an amazing teacher that makes law very interesting. I feel like I can truly apply the information learned to everyday life.
He is amazing! Very interested in student's success. This class isn't easy or hard, very fair. Make sure you read all the assigned readings! Probably the best class I've taken at Fisher so far.
Law made into a fun class! Yes it exists! Challenging during lecture, but exams are fair! Take him!

This was the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He is clear about the information that is important, which makes the tests easier. Class is generally laid back, but attendance is mandatory and you must do the reading prior to class. If you put forth  effort, you should do fine and thoroughly enjoy this class even if law isn't your favorite.

Irvine is the best professor I've had in Fisher.  He makes class interesting, which is good, because it's mandatory.  He expects you to read ahead of class and will give quizzes if there aren't enough people or people aren't prepared.  Definitely take him! Not too difficult of a class either

He is a nice teacher. He makes the subject interesting, and he cares about it.  He makes it mandatory that you must read for every class; bring your book to class. He makes the class applicable to life. Exams are challenging.
He is a very nice teacher.  He makes learning the matter applicable to your life. His tests aren't easy. He is willing to clarify a lot of the material.
not a nice person and really hard with grading, avoid him if you can

Professor Irvine is one of the best professors I have ever had, when he lectures about any information, he makes it interesting and almost fun to learn. He is also very passionate about law and very passionate about teaching as well. I would highly recommend taking him if you have the chance.

Great teacher. you have to actually do the reading every night because he will give pop quizzes even though you will usually get a 100 on the quiz if you read. Most exam questions are examples of definitions and law cases.

A great guy with a love for teaching. His tests are very hard and you have to read/take notes in class. I would disagree with others who said you can skim by and get a B. He does curve but you need it after the test difficulty. Would still recommend!

It?s a boring subject with an entertaining professor. He is clearly here because he enjoys teaching and while he wants you to learn the material, he makes sure you do it in a fun atmosphere. I have taken classes with the other professors teaching 510 and if your schedule permits, I wouldn?t take 510 from anyone else!
Probably the best professor I've had. Makes class fun. Make sure to read before class because he will call on people randomly.
Great teacher. Very enthusiastic and entertaining. Very easy B with minimal work. Have to study a bit more to get an A.

Possibly the best teacher I have had in my entire collegiate career. His personality makes attending his two hour lecture fun and productive. Midterm is hard, final is a bit easier. Read the book, take notes, do HW, and study HARD for an A. Generous curve puts majority in B range.

Nothing new to report. Great teacher, quite possibly best I've had at Fisher. If you show up and do the work you will most likely get a B, above and beyond effort makes it possible for an A. I'm ok with a B because he is that good of a teacher, especially for a boring subject. Truly has students best interests at heart, refreshing for OSU.

By far one of the best professors i have ever had. he really cares about all his students and wants them all to do well. the class is hard, but he very fair. he expects you to read before class and be ready. he made this class enjoyable and he is pretty funny. i hope i get to take him again. great teacher, take him if you can

Best teacher I have had in Fisher, or at OSU for that matter. Teaches the material very well, forces you to read everything before class and he is very engaging and funny. He will cold call students all the time and give you a hard time if you are not prepared--so do the reading! I would recommend taking him over any other professor for this class.

Irvine's class is challenging simply because you're expected to know the entire chapter upon arriving to class. While this might sound daunting, it's not as hard as it seems. Just read ahead and be prepared and you'll be fine. It's well worth it. Irvine is the best professor at Fisher and you'll learn a lot and have a lot of fun at the same time.

Prof. Irvine is the best teacher I have had thus far in college. He truly enjoys teaching, and makes class enjoyable. There was never a dull moment, and I took the class at 7:30 pm. Follow his 3 rules, and you'll get at least a B.

Really is an awesome teacher.  Probably the most entertaining class for how boring the material can be.  He calls on you throughout class but keeps a joking manner most of the time.  Just read the book before class and study for exams.

Irvine is hilarious and you will learn A LOT in his class!  I wouldn't take this with anyone else.  He is the best teacher in Fisher.  A forewarning though if English is your second language this class might be difficult for you just because he talks pretty fast.  If you can understand English well though, you will be fine!  Read the book!

Worst grade I've ever received at fisher (C-!)... I think I bombed the final, anyway I'm not going to let my grade reflect my rating like most people do...  Prof. Irvine is a great teacher, knows his material and makes the class enjoyable.  Trust me, you will learn, he calls you out if you don't know the answer!  I would take him again honestly...
Awesome teacher by far

A+ teacher. Very clear and knows what his talking about. Very interesting and keeps the class entertained. Read the book before you come to class because he will call on you randomly (don't worry if your international student with a hard name to pronounce, he won't call on you ever). Read and listen in class and you should do fine. Also, do the EC.
Best teacher I've had in Fisher. Very entertaining/funny. Read the book before class and review the chapters again before tests and you will do fine. Be on time, be prepared, and pay attention!

Great teacher. Make sure you keep up in class, I think that there's a fair curve at the end, which is nice. It kind of seems like a lot of your grade is up in the air, but as long as you read and understand the book you'll be fine.

One of the better professors that I had at Fisher.  The format is such that you have to read each chapter and do the homework before coming to class; know the material as he will call on you in class and put you on the spot if you don't know the answer.  Kept things light with his jokes and offbeat humor.  Be on time, be prepared and pay attention!

By far my favorite teacher in college. Extremely fun to banter with and incredibly intelligent. Wish I could take it again, it was that good! The class moved back to 10:30, which makes it a great time of day too! Always in good spirits, keep up with the book and you'll love this class/professor!

this guy is honestly the best teacher i have ever had. He keeps everybody entertained and interested in class. He makes an hour 48 minute class feel like a 48 minute class because he keeps you on your toes and really makes you participate whether you want to or not. very thorough, funny guy good humor great professor

awesome guy, very helpful and makes class fun to go to. exams we hard and he is the only teacher for this class who requires homework every class (even tho he most likely doesnt ever look at them) lecture can be confusing because he just talks and doesnt write anything down. you will earn more with him that blackburn or weinstock.
Awesome. Wish he thought accounting too.
I cannot stress this enough. Best teacher i have ever had! The class was extremely interesting and not hard at all. Do NOT take this class with any other teacher!

Irvine is absolutely the best professor at Fisher. The first day of class I was very intimidated when I saw him. He looks like an FBI agent on the X-Files, but after awhile I realized he's one of the kindest people on Earth and he's also very funny. Be familiar with the material for class. Class is fun. Don't worry about your grade. He's very fair.

Take Irvine if at all possible. He makes the class interesting; sarcasm and jokes make boring chapters somewhat entertaining. Make sure you read the book, because you NEED to be prepared! 30% participation grade is nice, too!

This professor was probably one of my favorites so far...his class is really exciting because you actually get to interact...I don't know about any of the other profs that teach this class, but I would recommend Irvine to anyone

nice guy, funny... if you have it at 8:30am it tends to get old after a while.  lots and lots of questions, tricky ones, on the exams.  80 midterm 100 final.  read the book and be prepared.  do the extra credit cases.

Best teacher Ive had in college.  He's funny, knows the material very well, and conveys it in an a way that is easy to understand.  Must be prepared for class as he calls on everyone, but he seemed to get everyone more motivated than any teacher Ive had. You have to take him if you get the chance.

By far my favorite instructor in my four years at OSU...he is hilarious, incredibly smart and makes the class tons of fun.  I learned more in those 10 weeks then most of my other courses combined.  Highly recommend!!

This guy is funny and a really good teacher. Honestly, take him if you can. He kept me studying and I'm the worst student ever. Plus, he makes an pretty interesting class really fun. I wish he could teach all my classes.
He's a great teacher, qualified (both a JD and CPA), but moreover he makes the class fun, despite the tough material. You will learn if you take his class.
Fantastic! is really funny and fair, makes you learn, only drawback is the class was at 8:30 AM with a 7:30 final, still, HIGHLY recommended

Very Good Professor.  Tough yet Fair.  He on your toes bc he will know who you are and he knows when you are BSing an answer.  I would recommend his class if you want to learn something and be amused.  Be ready to work hard in that class though
Best teacher in fisher.  Be prepared, be attentive, be on time, and you'll get an A.
HE is just gr8. you will luv his class. he is funny and a good teacher.i highly recommend him for 510.
Excellent teacher.  Cream of the crop.  Highly reccomend.
great teacher...very entertaining.  calls on everyone and learns everyone's name.
Interesting class with real world usefulness.  He gets on your ass if you aren't prepared.  Do the work, come to class, and actually learn something.  Idiots should get someone else.

summary_comment: Professor Yilmazer's teaching quality is widely regarded as poor; students find her lectures confusing and unengaging, and she fails to adequately explain incorrect answers. The class is described as unorganized, with difficult homework and quizzes that often cover material not discussed in class or textbook. While some appreciate her effort to help students, the overall consensus is negative, with many advising against taking her class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yilmazer's teaching quality is generally poor, with students finding her lectures confusing and unengaging, and her approach to addressing student questions ineffective. The class is described as unorganized, with difficult homework and quizzes that lack clear coverage in the course materials, leading to a frustrating learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Do. Not. Take. This. Class. With. Her. Save yourself before you can't

She was very difficult to understand, however, I do giver her credit because she did seem to care a little bit about her students. However, every time someone got a questions wrong, instead of explaining why it was wrong, she just said it was wrong and moved on. I don't think I learned anything at the end of her class.

She gives a lot of busy type work and lectures are truly boring and awful. I struggled to stay awake during class and was bored out of my mind as she made fairly simple material way more complicated than it actually was. Basically have to teach the material to yourself because she is useless. Plus you have to buy a huge book

This class was so unorganized, the whole class is based on the textbooks and the online lectures are worthless. The homework is impossible to do well on and the quizzes have questions that are not covered in anywhere in the book or in class. Completely unfair class but the graded problems sets are with a lot of points and are easy.
It's an interesting finance course.

SEI.Class Name: Theories and Models in Consumer Sciences II

SEI.Class Name: Healthy Finances and Economic Wellbeing for Individuals and Families

summary_comment: Professor Pirim is a passionate lecturer who excels in making complex topics accessible, though his class requires significant effort and engagement. While some students found the exams straightforward and the course manageable with adequate preparation, others criticized his lack of responsiveness, unprofessionalism, and reliance on automated materials, leading to frustration and disappointment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pirim is a passionate lecturer who excels in engaging students with the FinTech world, though his class requires significant preparation and is not easy. However, some students found his approach unprofessional and unhelpful, with issues regarding exam accommodations and lack of timely support.

Ratings.comment: He is a great teacher that loves what is teaching about. The class is made for people that like the FinTech world before hand, but you are going to learn a lot. Prepare yourself to read and talk. If you attend class, you will enjoy but it is not the easiest class.
Taner is a fine lecturer for such a big class. Exams were very straightforward with questions pulled straight from the study guide. Nothing to complain about, really.

Horrible. Never helps when students have a question and refuses to meet over zoom so you have to trek to the business campus if you have a question that could be an email. Has never answered my questions and just redirects me to figure it out.

This professor was the least accommodating, most un professional professor Ive ever had. He ignored what he stated in the syllabus, then claimed he was following the syllabus. He forgot to release assignment due dates and people were given zeros. If you were kicked out of proctorio exams were not allowed extra time, and he said it was your fault.

The worst teacher I have ever met. The course was basically fully automated and the instructional videos were not even recorded by him. Not actively helping or even ignoring the questions and difficulties raised by the students, which is very disappointing to me.

I had already taken an interest theory class, so this one was about 90% review for me. As a result, I dont have much to say about Prof. Pirim. He seemed nice enough. There was weekly homework from the online textbook which could be lengthy. Exams very closely mimic the practice exams and werent too difficult.

Our lectures were recorded by someone else, our exam was multiple choice graded by carmen and his practice problem videos were 2+ years old. He didnt do anything this semester. I asked him what something meant and he said Im not really sure. His class is manageable if you put a lot of time in it, but I did not enjoy it. Do the study guide tho!

Took his course Spring semester and I can feel he is quite careless as the lecture recording was made by someone else and material came from Person( which is a really disgusting website, freak out quite often). Many exercises provided by him were full of small typos and vague points. He use proctorio for exam and it's a poor designed system.
He spent a lot of time outside of class to teach us... He is very enthusiastic and FAIR to his students...
Great guy period!

I didn't understand his lectures. Disorganized & poorly communicated. Powerpoints were useless. Wrote on chalkboard but illegible. Also blew through material quickly. Biggest problem for me was exams. 2/3 comes from study guide, but they were LONG. About 38 math questions for 55 minutes. I got 80% on exams. Aced final solely bc I had more time.

Second time I have taken a class with Dr. Pirim. First was FIN 3120. This one was much easier and way more enjoyable. Definitely recommend taking it. He really wants you to learn and see you succeed both in his class and in the future.

He really is a great professor and teacher. He is full of energy and humor. His classes are NEVER BORING. He has very wide knowledge of what is going on in real world as he worked many years for big companies and has a strong background in business and engineering. He is really cool and unique in his own way. He truly cares about his students.

Exams are easy, material is low key hard. Study guides are a must to do well. As a person, he's not great. He isn't flexible about your schedule whatsoever (I missed an important religious event because he refused to move my exam earlier by a couple hours). Lectures are useless if you watch the videos.
Be prepared for the last statement of the courses.

Read the textbook and go to class. I did both and I still struggled a lot in this class. He may be hard to reach outside of office hours but he will definitely do the best he can to help you when you are there. Hard material and doesn't cover everything that is tested on during class but a study guide is given which helps a lot.
Graded solely on midterm and final exams. However, study guide is provided for each exam. 2/3 of questions on exam are pulled from study guide.

I'm Actuarial Science major, so lots of he stuff is already learned in Math 3618; I only look at the slides and practice tests to study for exams, which are made of exact same questions and questions you can get insights from studying practice questions. He's very hilarious and caring, but I stopped going to class...

Best business class I've ever taken. He explains everything perfectly and repeats problems, which some people will find annoying however I found it very helpful and didn't mind. Great guy and you will learn a lot.

He makes it really easy to do well in this class. 2/3 of the questions on the exams come word for word from the study guide, and you are given the answers. A lot of the questions are just plug-and-chug on the calculator and you are given a formula sheet. A financial calculator is a huge help on the tests.

I dropped this course halfway through the semester and decided to take a parallel course at a different university while I was doing a full-time internship back home. I cannot stres how much better that course was and I am thankful everyday that OSU approved it as credit for the course. This is not easy subject matter, made more difficult by Pirim.

Great teacher. Unlike many other professors, this guy seems almost like a real person, he tries to connect with the students through humor and is funny. There are 3 midterms and a final (33% of final grade) and that's your final grade- No homework. Pay attention in class, and get the book. READ THE BOOK! 70% of test questions come from study guide.

EXTREMELY condescending and rude in office hours. I went in with questions about the powerpoint slides, and he basically told me I was studying wrong and had to buy the book, which ended up being the exact same as what was on the slides. Awfully unorganized class structure with an unhelpful prof. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM IF YOU CAN AVOID IT!!!
Really nice professor!

He is a really funny guy and wants you to understand finance. He doesn't treat the class as some formula sheet to a test but will make sure that you understand real world finance. I visited him in his office hours and each time helped incredibly.

He cares if you understand the material and goes over stuff really slow to make sure you do. He has an enjoyable personally so class is not bad. Gives you a helpful study guide with 2/3 test questions on it, but some questions on the test can be a little tricky if you haven't seen them before. Make sure you use your book and quizlet for tests!

Taner is extremely smart (look up his degrees & past experience) and knows how to effectively communicate concepts/how to crunch numbers. His lectures are pretty much from the slides and he shows easy & practical methods how to break down & solve problems. He's willing to help when asked, cares about how you do, and is the best professor I've had.
There is a lot on the exam that is straight from the book that is not covered in class. He is very helpful if you go into office hours though.

You have two paths  Path 1: Dont go to class and memorize his study guide for each exam since about 70% of the study guide is on the exam (literally copies and pastes the questions). If you do this, you will receive a C.  Path 2: Go to class, enjoy his lectures, and learn the material... and still memorize the study guide for safe measures.
This is a tough class but Dr. Pirim is a great teacher. It is important to go to class, I would recommend this prof. he really cares about his students.
He is really good. He knows what he is talking about and has industry experience which is a super plus!...
Do the practice tests posted on Carmen. 75% of the tests are from the practice tests. They also help you study for the 25% of the questions that are not on the practice test.

summary_comment: Professor Melone is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and passion for finance, making complex concepts easy to understand. His strong academic background and real-world experience in the finance industry provide valuable insights, including life skills such as meditation. While some students find his Italian accent occasionally challenging to hear, his overall approach to teaching, including open note quizzes, group presentations, and guest speakers, is well-received.
summary_comment_short: Professor Melone is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex financial concepts accessible and engaging. His deep academic background and real-world experience in finance provide valuable insights that extend beyond the classroom, enhancing students' understanding and appreciation of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Alessandro is a really nice professor, recommend taking his class

He's definitely one of my favorite professors. The way he explains the material makes it easy to understand, and you can tell he's really passionate and knowledgeable about finance. With his strong academic background and real-world experience in the finance industry, he gave insights that go beyond just career advice—life skills like meditation.

Very great professor which is pretty cool considering it was only his first year I think. He also gave us a list of his favorite investment-related books which I thought was pretty cool. Grade consists of like 6 open note quizzes, group presentation, 2 guest speakers, and a final. Only downside is sometimes hard to hear through the Italian accent.

summary_comment: Professor Schneider's teaching quality is mixed. Some students find his classes straightforward and easy, particularly if they have prior experience with Excel, and appreciate his clear explanations and practical skills. However, others criticize his instructional quality as poor and the course materials as outdated, citing difficulties with accessing resources and disorganization. Overall, while some find him valuable, especially for specific finance topics, others struggle with his teaching methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schneider's teaching quality is generally considered satisfactory, with students finding the class straightforward if they watch the provided videos and complete the Excel assignments. However, some students have noted issues with the organization of the course, outdated materials, and poor lecture quality, suggesting mixed reviews regarding the instructional delivery.

Ratings.comment: This class is pretty straightforward if you watch the videos he provides. Course consists of a few Excel assignments, a couple discussion questions, and six quizzes, including the final "comprehensive quiz." He drops one quiz including the final, so if you do well on the first five, you don't even have to worry about taking it.
The class is very easy if you just watch the lectures. He teaches everything clearly and gives you important skills that you might use in the real world.

Class is quick, if you've taken CSE 2111 or worked in Excel at an internship the class is a breeze. Finished the course within a week of starting it barring the final. Instructional videos are extremely grainy. Doesn't answer emails on-time though, pointed out a clear mistake in a quiz and he refused to regrade unless others got it wrong.

He pronounces Finance like Finnance. Other than that, he is a good prof. This class will give you whiplash though. The first week of class we basically had a midterm, but the class got easier as it went on. You will get a good grade if you put in effort and ask questions. Funny guy.

The instruction quality is awful. I've been going to college since 2012 and I can say, with the utmost confidence that he is not it when it comes to lecturing. He needs to stick to accounting and leave TEACHING to the professionals. Despite providing terrible lectures, he is very knowledgeable.

The course was profoundly disorganized and the quality of instruction was awful. Little effort made to maintain order or facilitate a conducive learning atmosphere. Very difficult quizzes that seemed misaligned with the poorly delivered lecture content. Material that was either not covered or hastily brushed over during class sessions.

This is an online class. His teaching materials are very outdated. Many of the websites he provides cannot be opened. There is a lot of material and the location of them is very confusing and messy. You will spend several times more time looking for it than the video. The first quiz is difficult.

Took his financial data class and short selling class (BusFin 4237) and is one of the best professors at Ohio State. If you're interested in equity research and valuation short selling with Tod Schneider is extremely valuable and I can't recommend it enough.

Professor Schneider clearly knows a LOT about what he is talking about, and has a lot of industry experience that really helps to contextualize the things you learn. You mostly learn practical excel skills that are used in beginning analyst roles.
He was a good teacher that explained things clearly. Although there were a few challenging/confusing assignments, he would answer all questions to clear things up.

Professor Schneider did a great job at setting up this course. The course is built as a more advanced excel course and is really beneficial if you will be working with excel extensively in the future. The class consists of a few quizzes, homework assignments and a final quiz at the end that's optional if you did well enough on the other quizzes.

Very easy class. I spent maybe 2 hours for every quiz watching the lecture vids, doing the practice, and then taking the quiz. The final exam was short, but managed to cover all the topics we learned. Highly recommend if you need an easy A, and like asynchronous classes. His videos are literally tutorials for how to do the quiz. Mostly use excel.

Class should not be as difficult as it is. You end up having to teach self majority of information, specifically in the last unit and quiz, because it is not well explained as no live lectures and YouTube videos. Frustrating and Tedious.
A 1.5 credit class with too much workload. He gives awful video demonstrations that don't line up with any of the actual assignments. Super unorganized. Quizzes are hard for no reason.
Class is very easy and you know what is expected. Basically just an advanced Excel course.
Very easy class. He explains each module very well, which is rare for an online class. He's great!!

Its a 7 week class over financial websites & excel so every Sunday theres usually 2-3 assignments to do. Over one topic there will be an assignment, quiz, and discussion question. His video modules show you exactly what you need to know for the assignments. He drops the lowest quiz grade so you can skip the final if you did good on other quizzes.

7-week online course so starts off strong or else it will be hard to recover. Grades pretty much 50% completion and 50% quizzes so complete all the assignments and you're looking good. Dont wait until the last minute on Sunday since some of the assignments are lengthy.

This is one of the more helpful classes I've taken so far. Great information and skills that can be applied to a career in Financial Services are learned in the class. The only problem I had was the inability to review your past quizzes. You never know what you got right or wrong and it is hard to correct your mistakes for the cumulative final quiz

Tod is fine, not great. Completely online class and the video modules can be unclear and sometimes more complex than needed. The software used to monitor cheating, Proctorio, is a pain. I reccomend taking detailed notes over the videos and do the optional practice files and save them, as they often show up on quizzes. Wish hed post solutions.

Professor Schneider is a brilliant resource for finance however his lectures are very technical. Since he is very smart, he uses complex technical jargon and I think he forgets that he needs to dumb things down for students; so, his lectures are hard to understand. He is hysterical though, and a great person overall.
Tod is a great professor is who more than willing to go the extra mile to help students to understand topics.

Yet another example of someone who has no business teaching. He spent years in the financial industry and decided to come back and do what he calls teaching. The material its self is simple excel basics that everyone should know by now. Every quiz would have typos and errors, he needs to learn how to administer a course.

Schneider doesn't know how to administer a course. Quizzes & assignments constantly have errors. Assignments can be misleading and some I didn't learn anything. Can't seen to have consistent office hours. Regardless, he is nice & hilarious to talk with in-person.

summary_comment: Professor Schiller is highly passionate about teaching and offers a fair course structure with grades largely determined by six quizzes and two exams, which are challenging but open-book. The exams heavily rely on lecture slides and practice problems, though he occasionally asks questions on unaddressed topics later in the course. Overall, while the course material is demanding, particularly for a higher-level class, students appreciate his enthusiasm and recommend diligent practice, especially using Excel.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schiller is highly passionate about teaching, with grades primarily determined by six quizzes and two exams that are challenging but open-book. The exams heavily rely on lecture slides and practice problems, though he occasionally asks questions on untaught material, particularly later in the course.

Ratings.comment: He is definitely passionate about teaching. Your grade is mostly based on 6 quizzes and two exams, which are tough but open book. Exams are heavily based on lecture slides and practice problems, however there seemed to be times where he asked questions based on things he hadn't gone over, especially in the latter half of the course.

I think Professor Schiller is very passionate about teaching and his class is generally fair. This is a higher level course so it is hard and you need to do the optional practice problems to do well. I liked him as a teacher but the course is hard so that's where some of the hate comes from. Recommend putting everything into excel after learning

summary_comment: Professor Daniel is widely regarded as an ineffective lecturer, frequently making basic errors in his classes. Students report that they learned nothing from his instruction and strongly advise against enrolling in his courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Daniel is considered an ineffective lecturer, frequently making errors in his presentations and failing to impart meaningful knowledge to students. Students strongly advise avoiding his classes.

Ratings.comment: Awful lecturer who made common mistakes in every class. I did not learn a single thing in this class, I would avoid at all costs.

summary_comment: Professor Goncalves is highly knowledgeable and engaging in his teaching, with well-organized slides that aid understanding, especially during quizzes. However, his accent can sometimes pose a challenge. The final exam carries significant weight, potentially greatly impacting students' grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Goncalves is highly knowledgeable and engaging in his teaching, with well-organized slides that aid understanding and performance on quizzes. However, the final exam carries significant weight, potentially drastically affecting students' grades.

Ratings.comment: He has an accent but the slides are laid out nicely. You're allowed to use the slides during quizzes which makes them easy. He is very knowledgable and I looked forward to going to class. Only problem is the final is weighted very heavily and can completely change your grade.

summary_comment: Professor O’Daniel is widely regarded as ineffective in delivering quality education, as students find his lectures unhelpful and the material not covered adequately. Examinations are significantly more challenging than the homework, often including questions not previously seen, leading to poor performance despite diligent study. Comparisons with Teaching Assistants who have taught similar courses highlight a notable gap in instructional effectiveness.
summary_comment_short: Professor O’Daniel is widely regarded as ineffective in delivering meaningful content during lectures and does not facilitate problem-solving sessions, leaving students largely to自学. The exams are significantly more challenging than the homework, with questions that do not align with the material provided, making the course particularly difficult without additional support.

Ratings.comment: Might be the worst professor I've ever had. Don't learn anything during lectures and doesn't go over any problems so you pretty much have to teach yourself. Exams are 10x more difficult than the homeworks with questions that weren't even on the homework. I've had TA's teach a class similar to this and were 100% better than this professor.

summary_comment: Professor Shaffer is widely regarded as ineffective in providing adequate information for exams and covering course materials adequately. Students find her lectures disjointed from the course materials, leading to challenging exams without additional credit opportunities. Many advise avoiding her due to the heavy homework load and difficulty of her assessments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shaffer is widely regarded as a poor instructor who fails to adequately prepare students for exams and whose lectures do not align with course materials. Students find her classes overly challenging with excessive homework and very difficult exams without extra credit, leading many to advise avoiding her altogether.

Ratings.comment: Terrible professor. Didn't provide adequate info for exams.
professor shaffer genuinely cares about the success of her students and gets to know you as an individual
She knows nothing about what to teach. Awful experience!

Investments is a class with so many options of instructors, definitely you should avoid Sharon. Her lectures perfectly avoid her course materials and she has more homewroks than any of other instructors. Her exam are very difficult and does not provide extra credit. If your goal is E, what can be wrong choosing Sharon?

summary_comment: Professor Zipfel is known for his challenging exams and comprehensive slide-based lectures, making the class effective for exam preparation. However, students find him unapproachable and often dismissive during office hours, and many would avoid taking another of his classes. While some praise his accessibility and care for students, others criticize the asynchronous format and lack of preparation for the in-person final exam.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zipfel is known for his challenging exams and reliance on slides, making the class passable only through thorough preparation and attention. While some students praise his accessibility and care for students, others find him dismissive and unhelpful, especially during office hours, and criticize the course structure and final exam preparation.

Ratings.comment: Just ace your exams and you'll be good just know all the slides and pay attention for quizzes

Doesn't think you're worth his time. Don't even try to schedule office hours with him because he will brush you off. Ran into him in Fisher and he's rude in person as well. This is an easy class but I would not take another class with him if I had the choice.

This class is an asynchronous course, 90% of your work has to be done at home by watching hours of videos each week. When you have difficulties, the teacher seems to be exhausted by your questions. Would definitely not take this class again.
Best professor I have ever had! I learned so much and my respect levels are off the charts for this man. Gives a lot of real life examples from his past experience. Chad is almost HIM
Online asynchronous class with in person final makes no sense. Doesn't prepare students for final at all
Exams and quizzes were pretty difficult.
Professor Zipfel is the best professor for corporate finance! You will learn a lot from him. He is very accessible outside class and really cares for his students.

Professor Zipfel does a great job with this class. It has the perfect amount of work for a 1.5 credit hour class. It consisted of quizzes, weekly discussions and homework assignments, and a final at the end of the course. The professor had a lot on his plate, but was still willing to help. He definitely knows how to setup this course for success.
Chad makes the class easy and straightforward.

He is easily the best teacher for Corporate and tries to make the material interesting and gets to know everyone in the class. The toughest part of the class is having online lectures from other teachers who do not explain the content as well as Chad.
Chad is a good professor but feels like he makes his tests unnecessarily hard. Would still recommend his though.
This class definitely isn't an easy A but Chad is very passionate and explains the material in an interesting and relevant way. Study hard for the exams or you're screwed.

Chad is a really great teacher who genuinely wants his students to succeed. He is extremely passionate about what he does and really goes above and beyond! Although, I will say, this course is very "sink or swim"(his words); weekly quizzes are timed, he doesn't hand out practice problems, and if you fall behind he doesn't wait for you to catch up.

Chad has been one of my favorite professors. He adds a lot of outside information and is genuinely interested in finance and teaching. Personality wise: terrific. Teaching wise, pretty good, you can get a lot from him. His answers to questions may be tough to understand though. He sometimes responds at a very high level. Would recommend.
Really cares for student success and provides everything needed to do well in the course

It is a easy class. All difficult concepts are from AP ECON and 4211(other knowledge is straight forward ). I recommend to take 4211 first and, then take this class in the next semester(can safe your time when understanding some concepts). Exams are all from PPT, so just remember as much as you can before the Exams and you will be good.

Even though he insisted he did not want to trick us, he put specific and wordy questions on his tests. His detailed economics that he teaches in the online lectures always show up on his tests. We get 60 minutes to complete 35 questions online for the final. It's a tough class.

He looks like a cool professor and cares about his students. BUT that's just on the surface!! When you need some actual help on your course work to improve your grade it seems as if there nothing he can do.

Zipfel is a great teacher that genuinely cares about his students inside and outside of the classroom. Whether it is taking a theoretical financial concept and connecting it to a current event or helping a student find an internship or get an interview he's awesome. To succeed in the class look through his power points and take notes &attend class

Seems inconvenienced when you go to his office hours, but then encourages it in class... it's a catch 22. He also makes students feel stupid in class; if you aren't confident in your answer, do NOT raise your hand... he will humiliate you. Cases are far too difficult for this level. He forgets who he is teaching and can be quite arrogant at times.

So here's the deal. Chad is a great lecturer. He loves to teach and is passionate about corporate finance. He tells people to go to office hours but then I feel like he doesn't want me there. Oh and good luck with the final case - impossible.

There was really no need in reading the book because all the material is on the powerpoint. I wasted too much time reading when I could have just watched the lectures and focused on what he spent time on. If you need an A, memorize the powerpoint slides.

He seems really passionate about what he is teaching and has a lot of real world experience he brings to lectures. Quizzes are hard and monitored (even online)!!! The online lectures do not prepare you well. Was extremely off-putting when I went to office hours, was very short and clearly did not want to spend the time helping me.

One of the best instructors who care for students. Take his class and you'll get real industry knowledge and experience. One thing to warn is that group projects are actually intensive and involved. You need to take time digesting some of the materials outside his class since he focuses more on sharing but not teaching math problems.
Professor Chad was wonderful while the class materials are hard in its nature. Chad would be a good choice for you as you need to take BUSFIN 3220 At Fisher
One of the best professors I've had that really cares about students success.

Semester started off a bit rocky, but overall a really good finance professor. Quizzes, Midterm, Final are all multiple choice and he gives you a pretty good study guide for each. Assigned a group at the beginning for a series of group projects. He is a nice guy with industry experience and is pretty good at what he does. Do not get the textbook.
First year teacher has great potential very smart and personable. Class is not difficult few group work assignments but overall solid teacher and class. Would recommend

Fairly easy class, midterm was easy. Truly cares about teaching/your grade and knows a lot about the subject. First time teaching the class, so has trouble explaining topics at times, but if you ask him to clarify he always does.
Good professor, still learning. He is a new professor so he is still learning the ropes. Mid term was easy, pay attention in class and read you should do fine.

this guy knows so much about corporate finance that he forgets that he is teaching a class full of students who dont know what he is talking about. this guy expects us to know everything before he even begins teaching. cool guy but cannot teach
This is his first semester teaching. He knows what he is talking about corporate finance-wise, but he expects his students to know more than the usual for finance. A lot of group work.
He is a nice guy but he can not teach.

SEI.Subject: BUSFIN
SEI.Class Name: Financial Budgeting and Management in an MNC

summary_comment: Professor Staufenberg is highly regarded for his thorough explanations and genuine interest in his students' success. Students consistently praise his enthusiasm, passion for the subject matter, and willingness to help, often recommending his courses. While some find his teaching "decent" and effective, his overall teaching quality is generally positive and appreciated by those who have taken his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Staufenberg is highly regarded for his thorough explanations and genuine interest in his students' success. Students consistently praise his enthusiasm, willingness to help, and ability to make complex topics understandable.

Ratings.comment: BUSFIN 3300: Derik is an amazing Professor, I am in his class currently and have really been enjoying it. He is extremely knowledgeable, enthusiastic about teaching, and truly wants to see his students succeed. Derik has been the best Professor that I've had at OSU and I would love to get the opportunity to take another course with him.
BUSFIN 3300: He's a very nice professor, puts a lot of effort into his lectures, and wants the students to do well.  Would definitely recommend for Principles of Insurance.

He's very passionate about the subject and cares a lot about helping his students succeed. The content of the class is straightforward and easy to understand, and the assignments are pretty easy. I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes.

Derik Staufenberg is an amazing professor! He thoroughly explains concepts and really wants to help his students. I had him for principles of insurance and he was great! 100% would recommend taking his class.
I had my online recitation with him.  He was a nice guy who explained the problems well and was willing to help his students.
Super cool guy! Talks kind of like Owen Wilson. Cares about his students and wants them to get the most out of the course. Very helpful and accessible. Would thoroughly recommend.
Decent professor. Not bad but not good, helpful enough.
He does a decent job of breaking things down. He's not an out of this world professor but gets the job done.

SEI.Subject: BUSFIN
SEI.Class Name: Personal Finance for the Health, Law and Public Policy Professionals

SEI.Subject: BUSFIN
SEI.Class Name: Personal Finance for the Health, Law and Public Policy Professionals

SEI.Subject: BUSFIN
SEI.Class Name: Personal Finance for the Health, Law and Public Policy Professionals

summary_comment: Professor Wellman is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and genuine care for students' understanding, making complex financial concepts accessible. Students praise his willingness to help outside of class and find his quizzes and exams to be fair and reasonable. However, some warn that the class can be challenging, particularly the exams, which are often difficult and time-consuming.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wellman is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and genuine care for his students, making complex financial concepts accessible and engaging. While his exams are challenging, students appreciate his approachable nature, willingness to help outside of class, and fair assessment methods.

Ratings.comment: Learned more from this class and Professor Wellman than any other course I've taken at OSU. He's genuinely a wonderful person and always willing to answer questions and help outside of class. Very reasonable quizzes and exams, all open note. By far the best professor to take Corporate Finance with.
Best professor at OSU. Genuinely wants you to do good and very kind. He's also very funny and his lectures are never boring.
One of the best professors at the university. He makes a hard subject like Finance very interesting. Learnt a lot in this class.
Professor Wellman is a great lecturer and if you pay attention in class and do enough studying you will do well on the exams.

This is probably the hardest class that I have taken at Fisher, but an A is still incredibly achievable. The class is graded on a curve (91 was an A), as the average for the midterm was in the 70s. With that being said, just do the end of chapter problems because those have a striking resemblance to most of the exam questions (he mentions this).

Professor Wellman is a funny guy and he does seem like he genuinely cares but his exams are absolutely ridiculous. The midterm and the final make up 40% of the grade and a lot of the people in my class didnt even finish the exam before time was up. Like I said, really nice guy but try to take the class with someone else.
Class is not easy. Go to lectures and office hours. Try to take another professor.

I actually really liked attending class because he was a really great conversationalist, and was easy to listen to! There really wasn't a bunch of homework but if you didn't do practice problems from the textbook, I don't think I would have passed. His exams were extremely hard and the class average for them was always in the 60's. Great person tho

This class was difficult for me because I didnt get the textbook and he assigns textbook problems to do for practice. This would have helped for the midterm and final. There were 5 graded homeworks, a market concepts thing that you do for completion, and a portfolio project you can do with a group if you choose.

Hardest course Ive taken at osu. I studied for two weeks for the final and thought I did well and ended up getting a 61, the average was a 66. He purposefully makes the exams so hard abs curved a little so my 77 ended up as a B but still. Terrible teacher, nice guy.

Really great guy who cares about your success. Has office hours, but offers his help through email 24/7. Easy online quizzes with a group project he helps a ton with and then two tests. Whole class curved up (A- to A, B+ to A- etc) but he really does care about his students and is super knowledgable.
Jay is a great professor! He makes the dry material a little more tolerable by making jokes throughout lecture. Exams are pretty straight forward. I liked him a lot!

Professor Wellman is the best option for finance. Extremely knowledgable, very clear, and fantastic lecture/communication skills. Very willing to help outside of class, and often asks for questions in lecture. Not the most interesting subject to teach, but Professor Wellman does it exceptionally.

Great man. Has is doctorate in finance and is very knowledgeable. The class (also taught by Susan, another great instructor) followed a basic format: 1) Watch lecture videos 2) go to lecture, 3)do recitation problems  4) go to recitation 5) if you struggle do the book practice problems. Class was easy if you care. Conceptual and it builds on itself

Imagine having your dad teach a class and that's Jay Wellman.  Good guy, very knowledgable but lectures were pointless because he says the same exact thing as he does in the video.  Class is easy if you just go to class and pay attention.
Easy class. The class is well structured if you go to lecture and do the problem sets you should be able to get an A or A- no problem.

He makes finance interesting to listen to. Honestly cares about his students and tries to help as much as possible. Funny in class and recitation but teaches a hard course so be prepared. Go to recitation and do the practice problems and you should be set.

I really like Professor Wellman. He is a super easy going guy. Most students feel comfortable asking him questions in big lectures. He explains thing well and is organized. Also responds quickly to emails. Class is hard because you have to stay on top of it which is hard to do considering the fee amount of grades.

Tough class, only grades are a few problem sets and the exams so it's easy to fall behind by pushing it off. Go to lectures and recitations, do practice problems. MC exams. Exams are worth a lot but only put into 20 questions so they're worth a lot. Jay is funny and seems to care about students doing well. Stay ontop of material! Didn't use book

Jay Wellman is easily the best professor in Fisher. He is very clear when describing hard topics, and is willing to work with you if you need extra help. It is vital to go to lecture and recitation every week, because the material builds on itself. But, he does a good job of making class interesting and interactive. Must read book before exams.

Super nice guy and fun to talk to if you go to his office hours - one of my favorite professors ever. He's very numbers-focused when explaining things. Book is optional. The video modules provided cover almost everything. I would absolutely take another one of his classes.
Prof. Wellman was incredibly helpful, hilarious in lecture, very approachable and exams were fair. Great guy!
The class is very straightforward. Not a difficult class at all. The exams are curved fairly well and if you do practice problems you will be fine.
Great professor, I really enjoyed this class.  If you practice the recitation problems and go over the practice exams you'll most likely do okay.

AMAZING PROFESSOR. he really knows his stuff about finance. he teaches the ideas very clearly and will try his best to answer everyone's questions to ensure understanding. exams are fair. you have to read the book and practice working through problems before the exams, but if you do so you'll do fine. it's all about the amount of effort you put in.

Professor Wellman is a great instructor. He gives very clear lectures and tells you exactly what you should know for the exams. The tests can be a little tricky, specifically the conceptual questions, but nothing unfair. A lot of pressure on exams as each question is worth 5 points in a 400 point class

Jay captures students' attention in class and goes over what is actually on the exams. His ability to communicate concepts AND fine details concisely makes learning finance enjoyable. He posts online lectures where he discusses concepts and does problems to help students cement their learning. He's one of the best educators I've had. The man cares.
good professor, exams are fair
Great professor, very helpful and likes teaching

Professor Wellman is a remarkably eloquent lecturer. He is easygoing and knowledgeable, which makes him very easy to approach. Although I didn't do well in the class, this was purely my own fault; keep up with the material, and it should be pretty easy.
Go to class and pay attention. Study for the exams and read the book. Then you will be fine. People that think the class is hard usually aren't studying enough.

First exam is pretty easy. It gets much harder after that. But as long as you keep up and do the practice problems it is not a hard class. Before exams just do the practice exam a few times and do the book and recitation problems. Grade is pretty much only exams and a little bit of homework so do not slack.
