Great lecturer. Seems like a cool guy to hang out with... just sucks that it has to be in a finance class.
Great professor, good lecturer, easy class. Just do the practice and you'll be fine.

Wellman is a great teacher and taught the class very well. Anyone can agree that your grade is entirely up to the effort you want to put in. If you go to class, follow along, and put a decent amount of time into studying and understanding the material for the midterms you can do well in the class.

Jay is great.  He loves what he teaches and he's very clear, concise and is more than willing to answer any questions.  The exams are a bit intimidating because they are only 20 MC questions, each worth 5 points so you can only miss 2 for a 90, no partial credit. The class is curved for a 80 average though.  Plus he has a cute personality.
Amazing Professor - plain and simple. Most students won't love finance, but they'll love Jay. But since everyone has to take it, try and get Professor Wellman!

Amazing lecturer. Well behaved, which is a surprise in Fisher. To do well in this class, there are several ways. The most reliable would be to read the chapters and solve the practice problems BEFORE lectures. Or after if you want to procrastinate. It's a gamble since you HAVE to do well in exams. 1 question=5 points= 1.25% total grade

First off for anyone who is not a finance major this will be the hardest class you take at Fisher. Jay Wellman is a GREAT instructor, but your grade hinges on only 3 exams-that are nothing like the questions from MyFinanceLab or practice exams. If you want to pass the class the first time, be at the tutoring sessions, do MFL, and read the chapters.
This was an awesome class! Just make sure to read the textbook and you will do well. The tests are all 20 multiple choice questions.

Professor Wellman is definitely in my top 3 favorite professors in Fisher. Though the content is hard/tricky he is an exceptionally clear professor and stand up person. Last week was my first time going to his office hours and I only wish I had started in week 1. He completely understands that finance isn't everyone's thing and is super helpful!

Very helpful professor. Lectures can be boring, but he goes over the material well, and you get out of class pretty early. Study for the exams, since if you miss 2 questions, you're already down to a B.
Wellman is awesome. Hate finance but he is a very clear and fair instructor.

Prof Wellman is an exquisite finance professor especially for the large class size he deals with. He's personable in lecture, puts everything online, and is insanely organized. Plus even though he explains everything up front he still helps you when you have questions. Just a stand-up guy in general.
Great lecture, if interested in business math no problem. Everyone else might have issues with exams, but quizzes will save you! Read textbook is a must for the exams!

This class is definitely a weed out course. The practice problems, Carmen quizes and extra problems were rarely similar to the questions asked on the exams.  You can understand the concepts and still do very poorly in this class.

Wellman is a great professor and definitely your best option for the course. He is extremely helpful and teaches the subject matter very clearly. This class is difficult but like any other class, if you do practice problems and familiarize yourself with how to do each problem, you will be fine for the exams. Use Carmen quizzes to boost your grade

I went into this class fearing that it would be impossible and I would get a low grade. Turns out its exactly the opposite. You get formula sheets on the exams and its literally plug and chug from there. Wellman is an extremely clear and helpful instructor. He is also pretty cool if you go to his office hours and get to know him a little.

Take advantage of the quizzes for points. Exams are difficult. Do practice problems. Very good teacher, but just a hard class.  You have to work for you grade and exams can be tricky, but this is the best teacher for this class at OSU. The two teachers actually alternate making the tests for everyone so its not a big deal who you get.

He is definitely the best professor of Finance 620. Not only he did all the modules, but also because he focus a lot more on the problem-solving rather than sticking on the theories. He talks really clearly in the class and his slides are pretty concise.

this is guy is really bad. Made mistakes in lecture all the time, got emails every week how he either messed the grade up or messed some problem up in lecture. He would cancel chapters from the course then quiz you on it. and he curves DOWN, my buddy got every question right on the test, finished with a 97. He needs to get organized

Interesting class, good lecturer, easy quizzes and example problems from the book. Exams were a whole different ballgame. The hardest examples from the book were comparable to the easiest on the exams. He added about 4 points on each test for the so called curve.
Great teacher but extremely difficult tests even if you do the practice problems. You definitely need the book if you want to get an okay grade. Quizzes help buffer grade
Great teacher I've ever have in Fisher! He made the tough and boring class interesting. He knows what him teaching, but you do need to do hard after class. The quiz and exam are really challenging...

He made this class bearable because he is such a good teacher. I had no interest in Finance, and he is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. It is a hard class, but with his teaching style, enthusiasm, and humor the class was not as bad as I thought it would be.
Great professor. Interesting class. Easy exam. Nice curve. Love him=)!!!

Jay Wellman is easily one of the best professors I've had in four years at Ohio State. He knows what he's talking about, and makes it relevant outside of the class room.  Quizzes were easy and very straight forward, 2 exams were very difficult but he gave a generous curve.  Take a class with him if you have a chance.
He is a really nice teacher, from the viewpoint of an international student. He is really nice and gentle. He made the classes interesting, not boring. But he does speak a little bit fast

Jay is a really good guy. Very helpful and insightful and pretty funny, has a PhD in Finance from Harvard so he knows just about everything. That is good and bad because he knows so much but his exams are really challenging. 2 exams, 5 quizzes and 1 project. I do recommend taking him.

Jay Wellman is an excellent professor. It is clear that he has a passion for teaching and truly cares about the progression of his students. I strongly recommend taking him for 620 and any other class you can. Quizzes are not difficult if you start them well ahead of time. Also, this class is not impossible. Do the practice problems! Nice curve too
He is definitely the nicest guy I ever met in Fisher. He made the finance class interesting.  Take his class or you will regret.

Great teacher and a funny guy. Lectures are all on powerpoints, you definitely need the book to do practice problems for the exam. 2 midterms + 6 quizzes (drop lowest) + final exam = 400 points. I thought the exams were fairly difficult and didn't do great, quizzes were easy. Malkiel book was very interesting.

Literally the best teacher I have had in Fisher.  Kept lecture interesting, and was really good at explaining hard concepts.  The class is hard, but Jay was an awesome teacher.  I learned valuable life skills and I can't wait to take more classes from him.

The best professor I've ever had at osu. He expalined the lectures very clearly and he is very patient when you asked him questions. The test is a little hard but fair. You can definitely learn a lot from him!

summary_comment: Professor Dancer is highly regarded for his commitment to student success, using engaging and practical examples to simplify complex material. While lectures are not mandatory, they are recommended as they help maintain student engagement. His approachable and kind demeanor ensures a supportive learning environment, and exams are structured to align with the course material, setting students up for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dancer is an effective instructor who prioritizes student success, making the material accessible through clear explanations and real-life examples. His dedication is evident in his engaging teaching style and supportive approach, though his lectures, while beneficial, can be lengthy.

Ratings.comment: I would highly recommend taking this class with Ernest Dancer. He is determined for his students to succeed. His lectures aren't mandatory but I would recommend attending, he does a great job of trying to keep students engaged. The material is not overly difficult and you are provided the  materials in order to complete assignments and study.

If you are considering taking this class with him, do it! The material isn't overly interesting, so lectures can be a bit long, but he does his best to engage the class. He uses simple and real life examples to explain topics which is very helpful. He is kind, accommodating, and it is clear he wants students to succeed. Exams set you up to do well!

summary_comment: Professor Hou is highly regarded for his engaging and challenging teaching style, which effectively conveys complex concepts in a straightforward manner. Students find him knowledgeable, patient, and professional, leading to significant learning outcomes. However, some students caution that his exams can be tricky and that the grading system may favor those who practice extensively.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hou is highly regarded for his engaging and challenging teaching style, making complex topics accessible and helping students learn effectively. However, some students found his exams difficult and felt they learned more through self-study than in class.

Ratings.comment: Challenging but engaging, learned a lot, love this guy

Kewei Hou was teaching me derivatives 1 last year. He is super nice, intelligent and patient. He can make the sophisticated knowledge easy to understand. I learned a great deal of derivatives 1 than the derivatives 2, which was taught by another professor.
very nice one
Terrible professor.  Learned more by reading book than going to class.  Practice final 25% and final 75%, that's it no other grades.  Avoid him if u can.
Wonderful teacher

Mr. Hou is very nice and professional, you can learn a lot from him. There are 2 exams. Higher score exam weighs 60% and exams were very straight forward. If you want to learn and get an A. Avoid Green, take Hou.
Great Class!  The material is dry and challenging but worth the effort.  Hou is very professional which helps bring clarity to the material.

I learned more about derivative securities in pretty much every other class.  Not only is he a terrible professor, but his exams are only trick questions that you can't understand even if you've been in the options biz for a while  Avoid at all cost.
No Comments
Sometimes get inpatient with student regarding help.  But other than that can be pretty nice. A little stingy on grades.  Learn alot.

summary_comment: Professor Shams is an engaging and knowledgeable lecturer, particularly when discussing topics related to cryptocurrency and machine learning, which he teaches with passion. He is described as a nice and easy-grading professor who makes the class accessible with only four assignments and one final exam, though some students find his lectures somewhat boring and easier than expected.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shams is an easy grader and a very approachable instructor, particularly engaging when discussing topics related to cryptocurrency and machine learning. However, his lectures can be quite dry and boring for those not interested in these subjects, potentially leading to difficulties staying engaged in class.

Ratings.comment: If you're not interested in cryptocurrency/machine learning you will be bored out of your mind. But if you do like that stuff, his lectures are very interesting and you can tell he's really passionate about what he talks about. Easy grader and a very nice guy. Despite how easy the class was, I feel like I learned a lot from him.
He was such a nice and brilliant guy. Very interesting discussion on bitcoin, blockchain, and machine learning. He is hot!
Nice professor but makes you want to fall asleep in class, lectures are kind of boring.
He is such a nice professor. Very easy and interesting class. Easy grader. 4 assignments and one final.

summary_comment: Professor Stuckwisch is known for teaching a challenging but highly informative class on real estate finance, where exams are difficult and require extensive preparation. Students appreciate his expertise and his ability to connect them with job opportunities, though some find his lectures dry and boring. Overall, he is regarded as a dedicated and caring professor who genuinely cares about his students' understanding and future careers in real estate.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stuckwisch is known for teaching a challenging yet highly informative class on real estate finance, with exams that are difficult and non-curved, and lectures that, while sometimes dry, are deeply relevant to the real estate industry. Students appreciate his experience and willingness to provide career guidance, despite the course being perceived as demanding and occasionally boring.

Ratings.comment: Exams are difficult, 0 curve  and worksheets are beyond hard.

Often times you have professors that are so out of touch with how the real world works but Steve is not that guy. He teaches a tough class, but I have never learned so much as I did in his class. He's also a great resource to connect you with job opportunities. Overall it's a great class if you're genuinely interested in real estate investing.
Pretty easy course to take if you study. Awesome and astute professor who cares about his students. Definitely take this course.
Stephen is a nice guy, but his exams are very difficult! you are expected to know 250+ concepts in depth per test. lectures can get boring, and attendance is mandatory.

Professor Stuckwisch can tend to get a bad rep based on the difficulty of the class, but he teaches real estate finance, a tough subject, as best he can. 

Incredibly experienced in the field, he was able to provide me & my classmates with career guidance and he teaches his class to actually be relevant to working in the world of real estate
His classes are so boring and he covers information on his exams that he just simply doesn't go over in class. Does not present any information clearly and just plainly sucks.
His lectures are so boring but he is a pretty nice guy.

Professor Stuckwisch is a real estate geek in the best way possible. His lectures can be dry sometimes, but if you are passionate about learning more about CRE, definitely take his class. You can tell he cares about his students and will take the time to answer any questions and make sure they are understood.
The average for the first midterm was a D-. He has a hard time presenting the material, and setting up students for success.
Terrible at explaining content. Do not recommend.

This was, quite simply, a boring class. Real estate is not all its hopped up to be. He's a total wonk who geeks out on this stuff so hard, if you don't live and breathe this stuff, it can be unbearable.

Stephen is an awesome teacher who is really passionate about the real estate industry. He brings in a ton of speakers to talk about their different jobs in real estate. If you have the opportunity, take this class!

summary_comment: Professor Ben-David is highly regarded by some students for his passion and depth of knowledge in real estate and finance, challenging students to think critically and offering support when needed. However, others find his teaching style difficult, citing challenging problem sets, lack of examples in class, limited office hours, and a heavy accent. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some finding his courses exceptionally demanding but rewarding, while others consider them among their worst experiences.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ben-David is widely regarded as challenging and demanding, with a heavy focus on independent thinking and substantial written work. However, students also note his unavailability and unresponsiveness outside of class, particularly through email, and criticize the lack of clear guidance and support.

Ratings.comment: AVOID taking Professor Ben-David for 4410 at all costs. No exams but the problem sets given out throughout the semester are ridiculous, as no examples are provided in class. Only 1 hour of office hours a week. Unresponsive and unhelpful when emailed. 3 large final papers are given out within a week of each other, making it impossible to plan ahead.

Professor Ben-Davids course was one of my favorites in Fisher. He is passionate about the material taught, and extremely knowledgeable in both real estate and finance. He challenges students to think for themselves, but is always there to help with assignments when needed. If youre lucky enough to take his class, read some of his publications!

Worst professor I've ever had at Ohio State this far. Writes on the board for nearly the entire lecture (has bad handwriting) then barely uses the slides. Expects you to have taken previous finance classes, when intro is the only pre-req. Also makes you feel dumb for asking questions in office hours. Haven't even had the midterm yet.
Accent Heavy. No Electronics. Just not a good lecturer.

Zahi is a great prof as well as my favorite prof at Fisher. His class is not easy, but you will learn a ton: both applied and theoretical aspects in Finance. He is the guy who would give tough assignments, but be there for you if you need help. A caring, intelligent and HOT-looking prof! would take him for another class.

summary_comment: Professor Rives maintains a structured approach in his insurance class, relying heavily on the textbook and offering practice quizzes to prepare students for exams. His exams are challenging, designed to test deep understanding rather than rote memorization, and he does not provide lectures, making self-study crucial. While some students find his methods effective, others criticize his teaching style and difficulty level, recommending alternatives like Weinstock's lectures for better performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rives maintains a structured course focused on a textbook, with exams and quizzes heavily based on the material. His teaching style is largely self-directed, with minimal lectures and a focus on practice quizzes, making the course challenging for those who rely on in-class instruction.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Rives does a great job of keeping a structured course for his insurance class. Most of the material you need can be found in the textbook and all of the quizzes and exams are based around it. He does not have any lectures so it really is up to how motivated you are in doing well in the course.  The practice quizzes are especially helpful.

You do not have to show up for class if you don't want to. Class is 3 exams and 12 online quizzes. Can use any material you want on exams including computers, but unless you know the material at least somewhat, you won't have time to lookup all the answers. He makes exams difficult on purpose to get around this. Would recommend for a Fin elective
Awful lecturer.  I went to several office hours but he just talked about how good he was...never did any examples in class, had to teach yourself the material.  Go to Weinstocks lectures/office hours

Absolutely awful. The 2 midterms are tough; the final is impossible. I know of people with a 3.5+ GPA who got 30% on the final. Weinstock writes some questions, which aren't easy. But if you see a question that doesn't give you all the information needed to solve the problem, that's Bill's work. HOW DOES FISHER LET HIM TEACH???
He's absolutely terrible.  He does not teach to the exam.  Take Weinstock instead.  Too bad they use the same exams, which are also hard as hell.  I got a D+ and worked really hard for it.
I learned nothing from him. What he spoke in the lecture were mostly common sense. Nothing about the exam materials.
Madatory for RM&I Majors. Class was very intense but learned alot of good pratical information from Dr. Rives and Jack.
He isn't all that bad, but if you really care about grades, go to Weinstock's lecture instead.

i had rives, but i only went to weinstocks class. rives just talks about things that arent relavent to the exams, while wienstock actually does problems and gets you ready for exams. this class isn't that hard, just do all the practice problems that are on carmen and you'll be fine. if you think this class is hard, ur spendin too much time w/ rives

Team teaches with Oglevee, but is more boring to listen to and harder to follow. Considering the average quiz grades dropped by a reasonable ammount once he took over the 2nd half of the course, it should be some indication that his style does not suit the material.

Tests are a real struggle even if you have done every problem. I am a senior with a 3.8 and the class is super hard. Fairly certain the man loves people failing because then he has a hard class and weeds out would be finance majors. Just do the problems and work your butt off and you might do well.

I'm registered w/ Rives but I switched out on the first lecture b/c he teaches completely incomprehensible and irrelevant topics. He hates going over questions and he doesn't respond to emails or office hrs. Avoid him if possible. I did well in the class due to my own hard work.

if people would put the time that they complain about the lecture into application practice maybe they wouldnt have issues.the class is difficult material;EXPECT to put in a lot of effort.bill is a great instructor and has been helpful.he doesnt answer questions directly bc he encourages thinking for yourself so put time into studying;youll be fine

One the most worthless teachers ever.  Tells pointless stories in class! Acts like he will do anything to help his students out, but in reality doesn't put forth much effort.  Take Wienstock for 620!!

Anyone looking to be challenged should remain in the class.  It is a must that you put in the time and practice problems at the end of assigned chapters.  Rives' teaching style consists more of a real-world (actual capital markets/business)approach.  Weinstock spends more time actaully going through the arithmatic involved in calculating problems.

Was signed up for Rives class, but after the 1st day when he went over nothing to do with the chapter, I never went again. Definetely go to Weinstock's lecture, regardless of who you are signed up for..hard to get an A in the class..I Studied a ton and only got a B

Let me start out by saying I have a 3.7 and I am an honors student.  I have very good class attendance, but I can honestly say I have attended about 15% of the classes and I got more out of staying at home in bed than listening to this "teacher".  Do yourself a favor and take Weinstock, and if they switch the profs on you, the you should switch too

Terrible! Talks about random financial stories that have nothing to do with exams. Nothing we did in class prepared us for the exams and he can't answer a simple question clearly if you try to go to his office hours. Stay away!

He is a great guy who knows his stuff; if you are finance/acct major and cant deal with this class, then switch majors. Tests are hard,the only way to get a good grade is do every single practice problem after each chapter and review questions are a must. If you dont do those,then forget about a good grade
What he teaches, has nothing to do with the exams. Take Weinstock if you can. However, either way you need to work really hard to do well. TA is worthless too!
real world stories, doesnt prepare you for exams.  should do more examples and doesnt teach half the stuff from the book even though it will be on the test.
A very good lecturer especially for FIN beginners. Take his FIN 620.

summary_comment: Professor Lyonnet is known for his strong knowledge of corporate finance and his willingness to assist students via email. However, his teaching style can be challenging, particularly for students who struggle with dense material and extensive memorization requirements. Despite occasional difficulties, many students appreciate his kindness and dedication, with some finding his classes relatively easy and recommending him highly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lyonnet is known for his strong knowledge and willingness to help students, despite a sometimes challenging teaching style that can make the class demanding. Students appreciate his kindness and availability, though some find his lectures and exam requirements rigorous and the course structure difficult to navigate.

Ratings.comment: Victor speaks English with a French accent. The class is not marked for attendance. You can even just show up at the bi-weekly quiz. He doesn't care how much work you pay for the class or interact with him. He only cares and only writes letters of recommendation for those who get A. Not even an A-.
Hes very knowledgeable and extremely nice. Hes very responsive to emails and always willing to help.
Prof Lyonnet was pretty average. Don't know if it was more the structure of the class that didn't help or the fact that his explanations were sometimes a little hard to follow.

Victor is probably the nicest professor Ive ever had. His French accent is great and he cares about his students. Very responsive to emails. Class is very straightforward - study lecture slides and practice exams and you will be fine.

Victor clearly cares about students and understands corporate finance on his own, but he struggles to teach students anything. Makes you memorize 20+ formulas for the midterm AND final exams, half of which aren't even used. Class averages on the exams 75% and 63%, but weren't curved. He's a nice professor, but the course is incredibly unforgiving.

Hes a nice guy and I can tell he is trying his hardest to do a good job... but he made this class so much more difficult than it needed to be. Be ready to memorize 20+ formulas for the midterm and even more for the final and basically teach yourself :/

Professor Lyonnet is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. It is clear he cares about his students. Despite a thick French accent, he is very knowledgeable about corporate finance. The class is composed of a few cases, quizzes, and two exams. Overall, the class is very easy and I highly recommend Professor Lyonnet.

Prof. Lyonnet can seem intimidating at first, but is one of the nicest people in Fisher. The material can seem dense at first, but Lyonnet is always available and willing to help any students. Also, he gives out candy on the last day of class!

Worst professor I've ever had at Ohio State. He doesn't know how to explain concepts to us and he can't even teach the calculator applications that we need to know for exams. He has high expectations but isn't clear on them. I have to continually teach myself and reach out to other professors or the TA for help. Calls students lazy.

summary_comment: Professor Nguyen is extremely knowledgeable but presents a challenging class, particularly due to its math-heavy content. While he offers opportunities for extra credit and curves, the class is generally considered difficult, and many students warn against taking it, citing its negative impact on GPA and overall difficulty.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nguyen is extremely knowledgeable but presents a challenging class with significant mathematical content. Students find it difficult and warn against taking it, recommending alternative electives instead.

Ratings.comment: Thien is super knowledgeable and nice BUT DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! PICK ANOTHER ELECTIVE!!! Very math heavy, but he does curve & offers bonus points for questions. Got a B+ (not sure how i even got that) and ruined my magnum cum laude GPA. pick financial institutions, behavioral finance, real estate ANYTHING BUT THIS ONE!

Professor is extremely knowledgeable. This class is difficult, but if you do the extra practice problems and the practice exams then you should be fine for the midterm and final. Also participate in class to get a nice boost to your grade.

Hands down the worst/most difficult class I have ever taken. Professor Nguyen is the worst professor I have ever had. He reads highly quantitative material off of the slides and offers very little help outside of class. Asking questions in class gets you a bonus point, but he answers them as if you are an idiot. Do not take this class.
Provided little assistance outside of notes.

Got lots of extra credits from participating in recitations and from the grade curve and those really boost the grade. Professor Nguyen is a nice guy, but the class is a little tough with lots of math and calculations. However, the sample exams are very helpful, so if you prepare well, you will do fine in this class.

i am not even kidding you when i say this is the hardest class ive ever taken. I have a 3.8GPA i did better in marc smith than this class........ do NOT take do not take. I cannot stress this enough I am writing this struggling to study for the final i wish i never took this. I am not being dramatic you will thank me later.
A really smart guy but isn't the best at explaining everything. He gives a lot of partial credit so that helps on exams, but definitely not an easy class.

summary_comment: Professor Erel is known for being a fair and helpful instructor who provides a significant curve, making the final grades more manageable. However, her classes are challenging and often described as boring, with tests that require thorough preparation. Despite the difficulties, many students find her teaching to be effective and appreciate the support she offers.
summary_comment_short: Professor Erel is known for being a fair and helpful instructor who provides significant grading curves, though her classes can be challenging and require attentive attendance. Her lectures are often described as difficult and somewhat boring, with tests that require thorough preparation from her lecture slides.

Ratings.comment: Isil is incredibly smart and sometimes forgets that not everyone really understands what she's saying. Class is hard and has very few assignments to boost your grade. Curve at the end helps a lot.
Try to pay attention in class (if you can). Pretty boring lectures and the tests are very hard. I have heard other teachers are way easier for this class. If you can, take it with someone else.
Tests are fair, you basically need to memorize her lecture slides. There is a big curve at the end of the class too. She is helpful and very nice.
difficult but fair test, need to go to class.
Good teacher. Great curve.

def gave one of the best curves ive ever seen...she is very fair. the material is kind of difficult but the midterm is def ace-able...final was comprehensive and kind of difficult...but she gives you more than enough prep for the type of problems
The class is soooooo boring, and the tests are pretty darn hard.  It is a necessary class, and I dont know what other professors teach it, but she's OK.  I think she gives a pretty good curve

summary_comment: Professor Hanna is widely regarded as one of the worst professors at Ohio State University, according to student feedback. Students criticize his unorganized lectures, lack of responsiveness to student needs, and extremely difficult quizzes and exams. Many find his teaching methods ineffective and frustrating.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hanna is widely regarded as one of the worst professors at Ohio State University, consistently criticized for his unorganized lectures, lack of student engagement, and extremely difficult quizzes and exams. Students find his teaching style ineffective and his grading inconsistent and harsh.

Ratings.comment: Hanna unarguably is the WORST professor I have had at OSU. He's highly unorganized, doesn't listen to students, lectures are hard to follow, and his quizzes and exams are ridiculously hard to understand. He continuously says "we'll talk about this later in the course" and never comes back to it. If there was a 0 rating I would give it to him.
Horrible lectures. Impossible to listen to him. Doesnt listen to his students. Its his way and thats all

Wouldn't take him by choice, but he has been there the longest so he won't be fired. He is also the chair so all complaints are taken by him. If you have a complaint about him, you're out of luck. Had him for 2 classes - tax planning and capstone.
Ticky Tack grader, and an inconsistent grader. Doesn't know what he is talking about, and doesn't even try to stay up to date.
Unorganized. Out-dated. For students who want an easy A. Curve is ridiculous. Guy is an idiot. Would not have taken him if it weren't required for my minor.

Worst professor I've ever had at Ohio State. His quizzes are impossibly difficult. Exams are 12 m.c. questions and 4 math questions for 150 points. Basically, you can't miss a question or you'll fail the exams. His lectures are equivalent to watching paint dry. The only way I learned anything was from reading the textbook, which has many pages.

This is by far the worst class, don't expect to learn anything. There is a semester project that is extremely outdated (like from the 90s!). The course is unorganized and assignment due dates are hard to keep up with. Check your grade on Carmen because he forgets to post grades (this is the second class I've had with him).
One of the best professors I've ever had.  Took a year or two ago, graduated and I still use what I learned in that class today.  It put me leaps and bounds above others.

His class is very unstructured. His exams that he gives have no real format either and the material covered on it was always a mystery. Sometimes he would cover past material even though the tests were not cumulative.

Sherman is a super nice guy, responds to emails very quickly and is thorough when he responds. However, this class was very difficult. It was online, and the quizzesexams are very tough and worded very confusingly. There was a change in the book and the quizzes were old and did not match up with direct information which made it hard.

Great Professor! Very helpful, very nice, and very knowledgeable about anything in finance. Do not expect an easy A class, but it is so easy to get good grade as long as you read textbook, do hw, and ask questions.

I cannot believe he is still employed. Worst professor, does not care and assignments are weekly take at least 4 hours to complete plus presentation plus finding a client who will talk to you and give you financial info weekly??? This is ridiculous.

If you expect an easy this is it, but you have to complete all the assignments ahead of time and not wait the last minute. The key to success in this class is following the course package and asking questions. You do that and you should get a good grade.

I really learned a lot from this class, especially in investment and retirement planning. It is not as hard as you think but just a little bit complicated. If you follow his steps, use your brain, be serious, and pay attention on the minor tricky points, you should be fine. BTW, I got an A.
I am in his class now and this guy is awful. It doesn't matter how smart you are because he will have you confused. avoid at ALL costs

Terrible. He does not actually teach. Every week you will just continue to go over his made up "course packet". Nothing taught in this class is applicable to actual financial planning. Bring a phone to class so you can play Angry Birds!
Totally agree with previous review. Lectures are a waste of time and he talks more about CSFRM 660 in our class. His textbook contains more typos than a teenager's english essay. Avoid at all costs!!
Everything about this professor is bad. He cannot teach, his textbook is useless and frankly I learned more in CSFM 359 more than 360. I am surprised why the goons at human ecology don't fire him.

haha. This guy is a joke!! The average score on the final OPEN BOOK exam was a 30.81%, with only 5 people receiving between a 60%-89%. Lectures are pointless, only talks about old homework, which you had to figure out on your own. This guy is a disgrace to ALL professors, and Ohio State. I have now received my first "C"   at Ohio State. what a pos

Read all the other comments.  Everything everyone said is true about this class.  The zip packet is useless the homework is pointless.  All of the lectures are only about how to fill out homework assignments.  The homework assignments are just made up numbers anyways.  I am halfway through the class and I have printed more pages than any other clas

All of the exam questions are from examples that he puts in the zip packet...but you NEED to buy his calculator (Texas Ins. BA II Plus).  Trust me, I didn't do it until the final assignment and exam and it made life so much easier.  It was only like $35 at Walmart and worth it.  I bombed the first 2 exams w/ out it and got an A on the final.

I don't even know where to begin! This class is a JOKE! I haven't learned ONE thing and his assignments are absolutely insane and ridiculous! I would say avoid him, but I'm not sure of who else teaches this course.  If you can do not take him or you'll be totally disappointed!

This homework makes my eye lid twitch.  Sherman Hanna, is rude, could care less about teaching at all, and I have never worked so hard to learn so little and do so terrible.  Run! Run away if you can! I had to take this mess of class.  Worst Professor I've had these whole 5 years.
Terrible.  Just plain terrible.  He's totally getting grilled on SEI Evaluations.  Thank goodness I don't have to take 660.

He's so bad!  I don't know how he's still employed by OSU.  Why do we have good guys like Fox in the department then we have to deal with this guy's garbage.  Zip packet is a waste of money, why can't they be posed on carmen!  It's full of type-o's.  Homework is insane!  He's BAD BAD BAD!  Read everyone else's rating of him...it's the truth!

This guy is TERRIBLE!  I could have put that 22 dollars I spent on his stupid zip packet to better use, his assignments are ridiculous, I'm not sure what the heck he's going on about when he lectures and if you're going to become a financial planner, you will NEVER use this stuff in your everyday life!  I had no choice but to take this guy though..
360 and 660 are the most useless classes I have ever taken. The material has nothing to do with actual financial planning and his grading scheme is nuts. Easily the worst teacher I have ever had.
Hes pretty bad.

350 words isn't long enough to express how much this man wanted to make me beat my head against a wall rather than go to his class.  The man has no point, will ramble on for 2 hours at a time about NOTHING, and never teaches, just goes over the packet and the homework assignment, which will leave you more confused than when you walked in the door.

i never really get on here but he is horrible.  that zip packet is beyond confusing and the fin-state crap is just as confusing.  i dont know how you can go from J. Fox to this guy and not have the HEC college itself realize how misinformed this baboon is.

This guy is terrible.  He's terrible at communicating, and uses over and over the statement, "well I have tenure so it's not like I can get fired."  Be prepared to self-teach yourself EVERYTHING in this class, because all he does in lecture is just go over your homework assignment for that night, which will leave you even more confused.

WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD!  This class is ridiculous.  Spends all of the time explaining his logic to the class, but does not teach.  The zip packet has all of the wrong dates and typos are everywhere.  This guy has no clue, no logic.  I asked him a question one day, his reply: "I don't know, I read it somewhere, but I can't remember"  WOW.
WORST PROFESSOR IN OHIO.  Has no idea how to teach, quizes are hard becasue he never teaches anything that is going to be on them.  Zip Packet is a JOKE.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Worst teacher i've ever had....i didn't learn one thing in that class...Horrible, i suggest no one ever take this class!
He can't even do the problems he assigns. Maybe he should look at the Zip Packet! Has no idea how to teach, he spends the whole time talking about the zip packet instead of teaching.
This guy couldn't teach a kid to tie their shoes.  He'd have them so confused that they woud be crying for days.  I can't believe this guy is teaching anything, let alone financial planning.

MOST FRUSTRATING CLASS/PROF. EVER.  By far the worse professor ever at The Ohio State University...his "zip book" is a joke, half of it is bolded and half isnt, nothing is organized, not even the lectures.  He once even taught us something after we were assigned have it turned it...avoid this guy.

Two weeks into the class and I can already rate this clown.  Did an adolescent child help him with his syllabus and organizational skills?  I can't agree more with the previous ratings.  I can't believe this is the guy The Ohio State University lets leave an impact on my college career.

I can't believe this man has a degree. He can't even assign homework without having something wrong with it. His assignments are long and pointless. He is by far the worst prof I have had here in 4 years. He even screws up the exams.
absolutely horrible
Hanna = poooop  Words can't describe how bad he is.

Awful.  This guy makes me want to take a pencil and jam it through my left eye.  He can't even pass out a test without making it difficult and screwing it up.  You will have hours of frustration trying to straighten up everything he f'd up.

This guy is the worst professor is have ever seen.  He thinks he's so perfect in everything he does and he's not.  He expects people to guess on how he got an answer without explaining anything.  What a loser.

The absolute worst professor I've had in my 4 yrs at OSU.  Errors, errors, and holy crap more errors on every thing he assigns.  He has absolutely no clue what is going on. Unprofessional..you must experience it to believe it.

Worst teacher I have ever had, mumbles during lecture, loses topics constantly.  Unhelpful, has yelled at students for bringing up differing opinions.  A pity he is the teacher of the capstone course in the college.  Has made me rethink career choice

summary_comment: Professor Karnaukh is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, which significantly enhances students' understanding and interest in the subject matter. However, some students find her classes unorganized and lack clear guidance, leading to frustration and poor performance without additional effort. Overall, while her enthusiasm and personal involvement are evident, the teaching approach varies widely among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Karnaukh is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, which significantly enhances students' understanding and interest in the subject matter. However, some students find her classes unorganized and lack clear guidance, leading to frustration and mixed reviews regarding her teaching approach.

Ratings.comment: Nina greatly expanded my knowledge.  Seeing the course, it seemed to me that it would be the most boring of many subjects, but this professor proved that it was not at all. A positive, engaging personality that inspires to learn and develop.

I got a good grade after fighting with her she promises extra credit and she doesnt give you anything. She get angry when you ask her why she has an attitude and really in general was a waste of time I did everything on my own she does not really give you any kind of guidelines. She will give you exam review but dont get fooled by that. Horrible

She really is just a dreadful teacher. Most unorganized class I have ever taken. You're expected to fill in powerpoints as she lectures, but she never even gives the answers! Boring, awful teacher. Avoid if possible

I loved class with Nina! She has done a lot of economic research and is very interested in what she does. It shows in her teaching that she really loves to be there. She is funny and quirky! She is really caring and will try to explain things many times until you understand it. She is one of my favorite professors and always made me smile!

Nina has a lot of experience and a pretty impressive background. A lot of her own work is included in the material, which was very cool to see. Also, she's really quirky and tells a bunch of stories and def tries to keep things fun. In class quizzes don't count for grade, but if you're not there you might not be able to access questions later.

summary_comment: Professor Minton's classes are considered among the most challenging advanced electives in finance, known for their rigorous grading and numerous assignments. While some students find the material interesting and achievable with sufficient effort, others describe her teaching style as ineffective and her lectures as unhelpful, focusing more on reading slides than in-depth explanations. Overall, her classes are perceived as high-risk for GPA due to the demanding workload and subjective grading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Minton's teaching style is characterized by a heavy workload with frequent quizzes and exams, and she is known for being a strict grader. Despite this, some students find the class valuable, particularly for advanced finance electives, and note that it is possible to achieve a high grade with sufficient effort.

Ratings.comment: Class is best advanced elective for finance. Minton is a weird grader (gives points increments of like .25) But if you argue for a better grade she will change it if you prove a good point. Lots of guest speakers.
She is a tough grader but it is definitely possible to get an A in the class with some effort. I got an A and it really wasn't that bad.

way too many assignments and grades them hard. Exams are fairly easy if you study but overall she is very unfair and barely teaches material in class and expects us to do well on assignments and papers. she is a MAJOR RISK to your GPA

A LOT OF QUIZS AND EXAMS, PLUS THE ASSIGNMENT EVERY WEEK, HARD GRADER, USUALLY GIVE A LOW GRADE WITHOUT RUBIC. YOU NEED TO LEARN ALL THE PROJECT AND BLOOMBERG BY YOURSELVES. LECTURES ARE USELESS, SHE ONLY READ THE SLIDES QUICKLY DURING CLASS TIME.

Just cause someone has a PhD in finance does not mean they can teach. She is nice but she her teaching style is terrible. Her study guides do not remotely resemble what is taught in class. She reads off the powerpoints and does not go in depth into the material.
class was interesting. if you attend you get at least a b. papers and final project not bad

Prepare to learn how to sleep with your eyes open. 2 page paper due every week. You will learn a lot of information about banking that you can take to your grave shortly after the semester is over due to the slow and steady death you will endure whilst sitting in this class twice a week. The quizzes and exams are pretty easy. Enjoy!!
She is definitely a tough grader. Her class is not interesting at all. I trans my major after taking her class.
Rude to students. Doesn't move her mouth when she speaks. Lecture heavy but does try to make course enjoyable. Avoid.
She is not helpful at all.
Material covered in this class is inconsistent with the course description in the buckeyelink. Plus this class is more of a writing class than a finance class.

Early adm in2 biz schl '94; 3.4 avg. took abs worst prof in acct prof & acct club prof for 211; received  D. Took Minton for 620 Intro. Awesome. Helpful. Still have her self made packet & still use it. Go 2 her pre exam study session. See her dur off hrs.  Cares. Earned a B+; took her for futures & options too. Graduated with Finance &  R.E.
She doesn't respond to students' emails and was not helpful to questions.
This is a new course and I don't expect they to offer it again. She is easy-going and wants you to learn. Hope every professors at this school are as good as her.

It is an Easy A. The materials could be very complex but she tries to make everything easy for you. The take home final was a joke. The average was 91%. meaning that everybody would have at least an A-. My friend got 92% and he got an A.

Took this course with the Honors Cohort. Bernadette is incredibly fair, but really surprised most of us at the end of the quarter with the capital budgeting case. She took a very relaxed approach throughout the quarter, then violated our self-esteem at the end of the quarter with shockingly low scores. Sample exams are very similar to the real exam
Her class was sooo easy.  Just pay attention in class and you'll easily get an A.  She is so much easier than the other professors for 620, but you learn just as much.

I took the honors version. She offered some extra credit. The tests were fair if you studied in advance. She is nice, but can go over slides very fast at times. There was one big group project that involved a lot of teamwork. All in all, a good teacher if you put in the time and go to class on a regular basis.
she was incredibly nice and fair

Never went to class and still did good.  Class is a waste, read the book and MEMORIZE the sample exam, they are the same as the test.  From what I saw of her on the first few days she's not terrible, just boring.

One of the worst teachers I have ever had. Avoid like the plague. Going to class and the review sessions was worthless. I tought myself out of the book. Thank God the final was an exact copy of the sample exam. AVOID THIS WOMAN.

Take this class as distance learning. I have heard horrible things about this particular class with ANY professor. I was very discouraged in the beginning of this course, however, she made the final very easy and incorporates a curve so that you end up with a decent grade. Very difficult course though.
Absolutely hated this class!  Book is crap.  She does not explain things.  Doesn't move her mouth when she talks!  If you can take this class with any other professor - do it!  She is awful!

Fiance 723 Options and Futures is the most difficult finance course offered at OSU. That being said, it is asumed you already have a throught finance background and strong math skills. The course moves fast and is interesting and challenging. SHe does a good job to keep you focused & interested.
terrible teacher...all she does is mumble and assume that students already know everything...AVOID!
Be Warned! You would be making the worst mistake in your life at OSU if you take a course with this teacher. Very bad teaching skills. Lest you think about taking a course with this one.

summary_comment: Professor Ellis is highly knowledgeable but struggles significantly with engaging his students. His classes lack interactive elements and are often perceived as monotonous, leading to low attendance. Additionally, frequent cancellations further diminish the quality of his instruction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ellis is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge in the subject matter, but his teaching style is criticized for being monotonous and lacking engagement. The class frequently has low attendance due to students perceiving it as unhelpful and canceled sessions are common.

Ratings.comment: Chris Ellis is obviously a very knowledgeable individual. However, his class is not the best. Ellis is so boring. There are no activities or interactions with the class. Not many students show up because they feel like attending is not helpful, which shouldn't be the case. He cancels classes often.

summary_comment: Professor Zhang is highly regarded for her dedication to her teaching role, consistently providing students with valuable learning experiences. However, her lectures can be challenging to follow, particularly due to her accent, and some students found them hard to understand, leading to low attendance. Despite these challenges, many students appreciate her fairness and the quality of her instruction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhang is highly regarded for her dedication to her teaching role, consistently helping students feel they learn something valuable each day. However, her lectures can be challenging to follow, particularly due to her accent, and some students found them hard to attend regularly.

Ratings.comment: She didn't put any grades in before the final so I didn't know how well I had to do. Her lectures were hard to follow and didn't provide me with any real benefit so I stopped going halfway through the semester
Hard to understand at times because of her accent, so try not to skip her lectures even though they're hard to follow.

One of the best professors I have ever had at Fisher. She is definitely serious about her job, but I leave class everyday feeling like Ive learned something! She was very fair for the midterm (the final was another story ��) but overall she is great at her job and I would take her again.
Prof Zhang is a young and beautiful Lady. A tough one. Be careful.

summary_comment: Professor Fuller is highly regarded for his extensive industry experience, particularly in leadership roles, and his ability to engage students through case-based discussions and insightful guest speakers. While his grading can be perceived as lenient, especially for case studies and papers, his classes are generally considered manageable and fair, with straightforward tests and a focus on key concepts. However, some students find his lectures and grading methods, particularly the update frequency, to be less than ideal.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fuller is highly regarded for his extensive industry experience, particularly in leadership roles, and his ability to engage students through case-based discussions and insightful guest speakers. Despite some students finding his grading methods unconventional and the lectures occasionally dry, his classes are generally considered manageable, fair, and beneficial, with straightforward tests and a tendency to curve grades to maintain a high average.

Ratings.comment: Strange grading. Even if you speak in every class, you still just got a low participate grade. Never update the total grade. He's nice, but I think his grading is inappropriate.

Professor Fuller is extremely experienced in the business world especially in leadership roles. His class was case-based and class discussions occurred at each meeting, but they were extremely interesting and beneficial. Professor Fuller is a great guy and very respectful. I learned so much from him and LOVED his class!!

A great elective for senior year. Overall a very forgiving course in terms of assignments and case discussions. Tests are straightforward - just attend the exam review, fill out the review guide and skim lecture notes.

Solid dude, great industry experience and brings insightful guest speakers in to talk. Make sure you participate on the case discussion days to get points. Tests are not difficult and very fair in terms of what you are tested on, nothing too specific and no "trick" questions. Exams are graded fairly as well, overall he was great! I highly recommend

He grades cases and papers very leniently! The class can be dull and lecture slides are especially dry, but Professor Fuller does a good job of making the class manageable and engaging, especially for students with senioritis. Midterms are very straight forward and easy if you do the review guide and skim lecture notes.

Overall a great professor with lots of industry banking experience. Grades very easily and curves to a class average of an A-. Two midterm exams, individual and group case assignments, in class participation for cases, and some good guest speakers. Lectures can be boring, but review class before exam makes exam easy. Tested on high-level concepts

The man is a wealth of information when it comes to banking, his experience within the industry is unmatched. His lectures can get a bit boring but other than that the class is pretty enjoyable. He is not that hard of a grader and will only test you on important things and won't try to trick you. If you want to go into banking, he is for you.

summary_comment: Professor Pirim is highly regarded as one of the best professors at Fisher, known for her caring nature, engaging lectures, and commitment to her students' success. Her classes can be challenging, particularly at the senior level, but students find her accessible and willing to help. While some students find her classes overwhelming or difficult to follow, the consensus is that her dedication to teaching and student success sets her apart.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pirim is highly regarded as one of the best professors at Fisher, known for her caring nature, engaging lectures, and dedication to her students' success. Her classes are challenging but manageable with consistent attendance and engagement.

Ratings.comment: Best Professor in Fisher. I would recommend everyone to take her class. She cares about her students a lot and you learn without realizing.
4229 seems overwhelming but Professor Pirim really cares about her students and makes the class interesting and wants everyone to learn, if you come to class and just pay attention you will be fine.

I have taken Options and Futures class last semester as one of my advanced courses. Wow what a great experience I had. She was by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU. She is very caring with amazing lectures. She loves teaching and show that she cares about her students success.. She is a rock star teacher.

This was one of the last classes that I took at Fisher and can say that Professor Pirim is the best professor I have ever had. This content of the class can be difficult at times but if you show up to class, stay engaged, and ask questions then you will have no problems. I wish I could have taken more classes similar to this.

Professor Pirim is one of the best professors at Fisher. Although she does set a hard standard with her course load, it is not extreme by any nature. The work is difficult, but that is to be expected considering that they are all senior level. She is very accessible outside of class, and will meet at literally almost any time during the week.

She seem very nice however it was awful class she is very unpredictable when it comes to approximation I lost most of my grade in the final because of that she does not care also. I never was able to comprehend her so is everyone else. If you dont want your grade before you graduate to sync dont take it with her shes horrible

Dreadful professor and a really hard class. Went in to this class with a 4.0, and now I can kiss that goodbye. Not worth the trouble, STAY AWAY FROM THIS CLASS. Terrible at lecturing, cannot explain concepts to save her life, and makes everything harder than it needs to be. Should have taken advanced corporate.
She is really good! Best prof in Fisher

Homework problems are very similar to exam questions are pretty similar. Easy stuffs the first midterm kind of challenging for me in the second half. She tried to scared us at beginning but lots of extra credits+over 20% A. Be sure to ask question for Cases and COME to class. Best professor in Fisher and the best choice for advanced finance.
She is really good! One of the best in Fisher...

Incredibly tough class that covered derivatives from the perspective of someone who would need to hedge portfolios. Recently graduated and work at a bank, almost all of our portfolios need this so it was a handy class to understand that. Otherwise I wouldnt recommend, the material isnt as useful anywhere else. Very challenging topic, fair grades

She is extremely nice, and makes things as clear as possible on lectures. If you go to class and do the practice problems then you will succeed in this class. She tried to scare us off the first day, but honestly it's not the hardest class you'll take at fisher nor the most work.

This class is very difficult. I have great grades but just know you WILL need to work for this grade. If you are a graduating senior just stay away. She is a smart professor but she goes fast pace and assumes you should know everything. If you take notes and study you can get an A, it is just not what you want for one semester left. Take corporate.

She is one of the most fair professors ive had. Yes the material is hard, but if you go to class and take notes... there will be zero surprises on the exams. Exam problems come directly from sample problems we do in class. She says the textbook is necessary but I never used it

Does not take it easy on us. Mostly a seniors only course which means if you fail, you won't graduate on time. Just be aware ahead of time that you will need to at least put in a bit of effort for this course unlike some of the other classes offered in the business school. I'm very stressed out for the 2nd midterm and the final. I need to pass. plz

This class has been my hardest class at Fisher by far. It is an in depth class that focuses on options and futures from an academic perspective. If you want to be prepared for a career in investments this is NOT THE CLASS. Birsel does a poor job of explaining material and assumes everyone is as good as she is at math. TAKE CORPORATE OR RISK MGT.

She's not the best for explaining, but she did her best. The class is fast pace. but She's really helpful and patient if you go to office hour and pretty laid back. 3 fair exams, will just cover the topic she taught (need study from her exercise in class! she won't post the answer online). Will curve a little bit
Avoid Prof. Pirim like the plague. She breezes over tough topics that show up on the exam.
Take corporate or risk instead
You need to work for your grade. She isn't the best at explaining things and thinks the class understands concepts just because it is easy to her.

Overall a pretty difficult class just because of the material. Not the teachers fault. Very lecture heavy class which can get boring and very confusing. Takes lots of understanding and practice to pass the exams. Very fair exams though, and homework is not bad. You don't need to work ridiculously hard, but you will need to work for your grade

Awesome teacher!Her exam are pretty easy and she gives you a review guide for each exam. Many times there will be exact problems with the same answers from the review on the exam. She is very, very forgiving and will help your grade out GREATLY if you mess up Awesome teacher! Put forth some effort and you'll pass. An A requires some work, though.

summary_comment: Professor Sabin is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and genuine care for his students' success. He is known for making the subject matter engaging and offering numerous opportunities for extra credit, group projects, and presentations. Students appreciate his industry experience and willingness to go above and beyond to help them achieve their goals.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sabin is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and genuine care for his students' success. He is known for making finance engaging through humor and practical industry experience, offering numerous opportunities for extra credit and hands-on learning.

Ratings.comment: By far the best professor I've had at OSU. Truly cares about his students and wants you to succeed!
Excellent class
Definitely my favorite finance teacher I've had st OSU. Cool laid back guy who's pretty relatable. Assignments are pretty easy and had a take home final
Good professor and offers a lot of industry experience!
Super funny guy. Makes a boring subject fun.  I would take him again.
Really great professor.  Offers a lot of industry experience, and is willing to go beyond to help you succeed.
Kind of a goofy guy, but he made the class fun. Lots of chances for extra credit.  Essay exams. Group projects. And multiple presentations required.
First class at OSU, so he was learning how we do things.  Seems to care a lot about students.  Mildly entertaining.
Greg is one of those profs who "get it". He's clear, fair, and doesn't assign work for work's sake. Overall, excellent professor who has pretty good stories and is extremely responsive to questions.

summary_comment: Professor Cronqvist is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and ability to connect theoretical concepts with real-world applications, particularly in areas like DCF, NPV, and APV analysis. His classes are well-structured, with clear lectures and ample in-class practice, though they require active participation and consistent effort to excel. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his positive impact on their learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cronqvist is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, clear explanations, and ability to connect theoretical concepts with real-world applications, particularly in areas like DCF, NPV, and APV analysis. His structured and engaging lectures, combined with mandatory attendance and participation, ensure students stay engaged and well-prepared for exams.

Ratings.comment: Cool professor with participation and weekly group projects accounting for 2/3 of the grade with the final making up the final 1/3. Class was pretty straightforward. Attendance is "mandatory" in that your participation (contribution to the class/questions) are noted and affect your final grade.

Professor Cronqvist is really good at teaching.I agree with the previous reviews as well.This prof. certainly brings in real world examples such as DCF,NPV and APV analysis, valuation analysis which is useful in major financial instituitions and investment banks.I received an easy B+, and i got to learn so  much which certainly will be applicable
Awesome professor and class! Probably best professor I have ever had. Lots of Powerpoint but worth it. Very well structured material. Exams reflect lectures. Ties in business news into class.

Forget the book, go to every class.  Very structured, very clear lectures.  Ample in-class practice questions.  Hard class, but keep up with material and you won't be bored.  Cronqvist is very willing to help and is a very good lecturer.  The material is useful.  "The Cronq" is the best!
excellent course. prepares for real world. moderate to hard tests, but curves. nice prof, helps if you ask
Excellent professor! Clear content, examples from real world, investment banking, etc. Highly recommend to any finance major.

One of the better class in OSU. It is relatively esay if you study hard and attend class. If need advice for getting A, Making sure go through the practice problem before test and Sample Final. Highly recommended if he teaches this class again

Very good teacher.  Explains things well, gives good examples, and tests are pretty easy.  Not to mention he curves the class so the average is a B/B+.  He's a really nice guy too.  I highly recommend.
Very well organized materials and lecture. Tests are quite tricky but gave generous curve. One of the best finance professor.
Lectures make sense etc..  Tests incredibly hard!  The very nice curve makes the class passable though.

summary_comment: Professor Saks is rated very poorly as a TA, particularly for course 4201, where students found him unresponsive to emails and incomplete in answering questions. The class starts easily but becomes challenging later, with difficult online quizzes. Students unanimously advise against taking this class with him.
summary_comment_short: Professor Saks is rated very poorly as a TA, with students reporting non-responsive communication, difficult later course material, and impossible online quizzes. His class has been described as one of the worst experiences at Fisher, even for strong students who ended up with a C grade.

Ratings.comment: he was the TA for 4201. BAD TA! do not take this class with him.  he will not respond to your e-mails, if he does, he doesnt answer all of your questions.  the first few weeks are easy, but the last two are hard. the online quizzes are impossible.  worst experience at Fisher thus far.  I am an A student, got a C in his class. DONT TAKE HIM!

summary_comment: Professor Bryan is highly regarded for his expertise and engaging teaching style, making complex topics in the insurance industry accessible and interesting. Students appreciate his fairness, clear explanations, and the abundance of review materials provided for exams. His classes are generally considered straightforward and manageable, with ample opportunities for extra credit.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bryan is highly regarded for his expertise and engaging lectures, making complex topics accessible and interesting. Students appreciate his fairness, the abundance of review materials, and the numerous opportunities for extra credit, leading to generally high grades.

Ratings.comment: Professor Bryan rocks! He is a very knowledgeable person with a lot of insight on the Insurance industry. The way he lectures keeps you interested, and makes learning the material easy. Exam and quizzes are straight forward, he provides more than enough review material to study. Best professor I have had at Fisher!

Outstanding professor...highly recommend his class as a finance elective, even if you don't have interest in insurance (I didn't). If you don't end up with an A there is something wrong with you. Only downside is he cold calls on people...but I mean it could be worse.
He's the best in Fisher. Will take him again for BUSFIN 749

Professor Bryan teaches Risk Management in a very straightforward and clear way. Attendance is mandatory but he keeps your attention the full time. 5 Quizzes, Paper/Presentation, EC, and Final. Just show up, do the EC, and you'll walk out of there with an A- at the absolute worst.

Professor Bryan is very fair and is genuinly interested in his class. Sample quizzes and exams are online and they are basically identical to the actual things. You have one group project that almost everyone gets an A on and he offers easy extra credit. Great professor, wish I had more like him!

Professor Bryan is an excellent instructor with real-world experience.  I went into the class with little-to-no interest in Insurance and really enjoyed the class! He's genuinely interested in students understanding the information.  Highly recommended!
Prof Bryan is tops. Does not get any better. One of the most qualified Fisher has to offer.

Gives alot of opportunities for Extra Credit and all before all quizzes and exams he gives out sample problems that are almost identical to the actually questions! Pretty easy class as long as you study the sample problems and go to class. Did not use the book.

Best professor!! Insurance isn't a easy field to step in; however, professor Bryan gave made class interesting and clear by giving lots of examples. Just go to class and you will do great! Strongly Recommend!!

Best professor and best course at OSU ever. Listen to lecture and do all practice exams, you will definitely do WELL!! You not only get the grade you expected, but also learn stuff from the professor. Best professor...extremely recommend
My favorite and indeed the best teacher in OSU! He teahces clearly and is very willing to help student out! You should NOT miss a professor like this while in fisher.

My favorite professor at Fisher! He is genuinely interested that you learn and know the material for tests/quizzes-and life. Offers many chances for you to do well if you put the time into it.  Great style of teaching!
Easy A as long as you keep up with the assignment n go to class everyday.. 20 points extra credit and a make-up quiz. Hes the best teacher if u are interesting in Insurance....

Professor Bryan is one of the best instructors at Fisher. For our class, there were 5 quizzes and a final (multiple choice and essay) as well as 20 points worth of extra credit. Go to class! He is great at teaching the material and really cares about students understanding everything!

There are 5 HWs, 5 quizzes, a midterm and a final.  In addition, like everyone else said, there are 20 points extra credit.  As long as you attend class and keep up with the material, you'll be fine.  He will give you sample MC questions, some of those will be on the midterm/final.

Class was not bad. He gives you alot of practice problems that are usually on the exam. If you do the extra credit you get 20 extra points so if I finish those Ill probably end up with and A or A-. He does call on people randomly in class, but he doesnt expect you to always know the answer. Some guest speakers are interesting. I recommend him.

He is so knowledgeable about insurance that sometimes he expects students to be on his level. He is also very successful in the field and has a lot to share. The class is not bad and the tests are similar to practice ones he posts. Some homework and quizzes to do, but there is a 13% grade boost if one does all extra credit. TAKE HIM!

summary_comment: Professor Liao is highly regarded for her excellent teaching in finance courses, particularly noted for her ability to cover a substantial amount of material efficiently within a short timeframe. She explains concepts clearly and provides comprehensive lecture notes that complement the textbook effectively. Students recommend her classes enthusiastically and suggest taking any course she teaches.
summary_comment_short: Professor Liao is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, covering a substantial amount of material efficiently in her finance classes. Her clear explanations and comprehensive lecture notes make her courses stand out, earning her students' strong recommendations.

Ratings.comment: This was the best finance class that I have taken at Fisher.Since it was a summer course there was a good amount of material to cover in a short amount of time.Rose explained everything perfectly with helpful class/lecture notes that are just as helpful as the book.This young professor's on the start to a great future,when/if she teaches take it!

summary_comment: Professor Phipps is an knowledgeable instructor in real estate, particularly for Finance and Accounting majors. His classes are generally considered fair and straightforward, though his teaching style can be loud and unconventional. Despite this, most students find his expertise and approachable nature beneficial.
summary_comment_short: Professor Phipps is an knowledgeable instructor who provides valuable insights into the real estate industry. His classes are considered fair and manageable for Finance and Accounting majors, though his teaching style is notably loud and unconventional, which most students find acceptable.

Ratings.comment: Knows a great deal about the real estate world today. Always pretty fair and course is pretty easy for Finance and Accounting majors looking to pick up a real estate course. Phipps is a pretty loud and unusual man but most students seem to be ok with that, no one seems to really dislike him or the class.

great teacher- knows a lot about real estate today and how to get in with what you want to do.  His class is really fair and you must read the book but the readings are really short and easy to understand.

summary_comment: Professor Chang is highly regarded for his clear and practical teaching style, focusing on essential concepts and real-world applications. His lectures, while sometimes dry, are enlivened with humor and personal anecdotes, making the material more engaging. He is known for his accessibility and willingness to help students outside of class, and his exams are straightforward and well-prepared.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chang is highly regarded for his clarity and practical approach to teaching, making complex concepts easy to understand. He brings real-world experience into the classroom and is known for his engaging, though occasionally dry, lectures that are enhanced with humor.

Ratings.comment: My favorite professor so far.  He's straight forward and not obscure so you actually learn what is important. Personnable, very helpful before and after class, makes jokes, and he is the CFO of a development firm, so he teaches what he does in real life. Take him!!!

Solid prof,teaches real world knowledge. Lectures are kind of dry, but he tries to spice things up by making jokes throughout class (mostly making fun of people or himself). Attendance isn't really mandatory, but he does take spot-check attendances every once in a while. Exams are straight-forward, and he walks you thru the material before the exam

summary_comment: Professor Fox is known for his engaging and interactive lectures, making the class relatively easy with straightforward instructions and quizzes based on readings. However, the class requires consistent effort with weekly online quizzes, homework assignments, and in-class activities that contribute significantly to the grade. While some find the workload manageable and the class enjoyable, others note it can be time-consuming and challenging if not kept up with regularly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fox is known for his engaging and interactive lectures, making the class relatively easy with straightforward instructions and minimal heavy lifting required for good grades. However, the workload can be significant, especially for those who fall behind, with numerous quizzes and homework assignments that demand consistent effort.

Ratings.comment: He is a very interactive and interesting professor.Easy class.For papers and in-class exercise,youll get easy A if you listen to his simple instructions and watch the videos showed in class.Quizzes are based on reading.Not too heavy.Also good grade if you just skim the reading carefully.

Very easy class overall. No tb.  Should really name this class the green consumer.  It is all he talks about, fair trade, green consumption, etc.  Dont skip class almost always some sort of point assignment due or given in class.  Quizzes are easy.  No need to really read just google it or skim over as you take the quiz.

He is a cool person but not really a good teacher.grades are based on papers and online quizzes that are from these articles posted on carmen.No midterms or final which is cool, but they should make the class online.I would of skip the class if it wasnt 4 the inclass activities which is worth points & you have to turn papers in during lectures.

One of the best professors at OSU. Very interactive lectures that keeps students engaged in the class. That is really important to me personally. About medium amount of homework but pretty easy if you pay attention. Great teacher!

Good class if you are looking for a 2 credit elective class. He is an awesome teacher and makes the class very interesting and fun. Although there is a lot of work, it isn't very hard. We didn't have a midterm or final, so the online quizzes and assignments made up for those points. I highly recommend Mr. Fox and this class!

One of my favorite teachers at OSU, however, there is alot to stay on top of in the classes. you have two online quizzes and homework due each week, which means two chapters of reading. The good news is, its all open book, even the midterm and final.
