wow...this class is super hard if you don't stay on top of things..there is tons of work, two quiz's (50 q's each) and two homeworks due every week! so you have to read two chapters every week so you can do those. the homeworks are completion grades. the quiz's you can take twice. the final is really difficult.Over all this class is TIME CONSUMING!

Dr. Fox is a great professor and he knows what he is talking about. Very energetic in lecture, but there is a lot of work to do, 18 online quizzes, 18 h/w assignments, midterm and final. Quizzes you take twice. Lowest quiz and h/w assignment are dropped. Overall, easy class with a great professor that likes the subject.

GREAT teacher. Sounds/acts just like Robin Williams. Homework is a completion grade, online quizzes are open book. Quizzes/Homework account for 92% of grade, test/midterm only 8%. Only one midterm, and final, both which are open book in class.
Great teacher. He likes to multiply your grade by 100% for a job well done. If you attend class and pay attention you will do fine.
Dr. Fox is an excellent professor.  I learned a great deal from him, and it is obvious he enjoys teaching, he is very helpful and provides feedback!
He is awesome,  and he is hot too, BONUS!
Great.
Best teacher I have had at OSU.  Just saying that I enjoyed his class has helped me get a job.  Definitely take this class if you can.  I really enjoyed going to class.

This guy is amazing.  By far the best professor I had at OSU.  His exams are open book, so he doesn't make you memorize things you'll never need to know.  He's always available outside of class to help and his recommendation landed me a job after I graduated.  His class isn't a cake walk, he makes you think, but I learned tons from this guy!
Fox is the best teacher. If he taught more classes I would take them. He knows how to teach so you understand it, no note taking. His exams are open book and aren't hard at all.

This man is just breathtaking. Going into this class, I wasn't really expecting much. But just after the first day I was relieved to have such a down to earth professor with a great sense of humour. His class is very hands on and includes lots of activities which keeps your attention. I have yet to take a nap in his class. Oh and he he's pretty easy on the eyes too so thats a plus.
Jonathon Fox was awesome! I loved him!!!!

I hat Prof. Fox when I went to Ohio State a couple of years ago.  For a very large lecture class he made it feel very very small.  I wish every professor at Ohio State was this good and engaging with the students.  GO BUCKS!!!

He's a great teacher, very interesting!  His exams are hard, quizzes and homework are easy.  You have to do a group presentation which is rather easier if you do it earlier in the quarter than later in the quarter.  Books cost almost $200 and be prepared to come to class every time and for the whole time.

One of the best professors Ive had at OSU...if not the best.  Always out to help you and answer questions.  His classes require alot of work but all is fair if you put in the effort...blows "Big Sherm" out of the water.  Fox even says "those who cant do...teach" and I respect him for that.
Fox is a great teacher, hes really there to help out when you need it.  Beware, his classes aren't easy to skip, hes got something due every period. One of the best I've had at osu.

I hope my vote makes up for the guy that said "nuff said."  If he is typing like that maybe he shouldn't be in a higher education environment.  Very good teacher.  Best I've ever had.  Feels like he's on your team, not against you like most so-called professors.
Dr. Fox is great, and I agree I wish he could replace Hanna!
very easy teacher to approach and understand
One of the few professors I've had that really seems to care.  Good instructor and entertaining.  I agree with the comment below, if only he could replace Sherman "Read my Mind" Hannah in 360 and 660
Dr. Fox is the greatest.  I wish he taught 360 and 660!  Instead of Sherman (I think Im perfect) Hanna.
Awful, just awful, nuff said
No Comments

Dr. Fox is an exceptional teacher and to be commended among his peers.  He communicates the subject matter clearly and is always helpful whenever you ask him a question.  Without a doubt Jonathon Fox is the best teacher I have had in 17 years of education
Reminds me of Robin Williams...

summary_comment: Professor Wong is highly regarded as one of the best instructors at Fisher, known for his comprehensive review sheets and detailed lecture notes that effectively prepare students for exams, ensuring many achieve top grades in his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wong is highly regarded as one of the best instructors at Fisher, known for his comprehensive review sheets and detailed lecture notes that effectively prepare students for exams, ensuring many achieve top grades.

Ratings.comment: Hands down, one of the best instructors at Fisher. His review sheets mirror the exam, and his lecture notes are all you need to secure yourself an A in this class.

summary_comment: Professor Kimmel is known for being extremely knowledgeable and helpful, often going out of his way to assist students. However, many find his lectures monotonous and focused heavily on statistics, which some students find less relevant to the course material. Overall, while the class is not particularly difficult, it is generally considered boring and not engaging, leading many to recommend avoiding him or taking the class elsewhere.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kimmel is known for being extremely knowledgeable and helpful, often willing to go above and beyond to assist students, though his teaching style can be monotonous and his lectures focus heavily on statistics, which some find boring. Despite this, the class is generally not difficult, and many students manage to do well without attending lectures regularly.

Ratings.comment: Get over it you guys. You're finance majors -- you deal with numbers on a daily basis. Professor Kimmel is extremely helpful and is more than willing to go out of his way to help you understand the material. The class wasn't that hard -- pay attention and participate in class. It makes time go by quickly. Further, he curves the class. Great guy.

His 722 section did not go over materially normally covered by other 722 classes, but instead focused mainly on statistics and their use in Finance for the entire quarter.  Avoid him as much as you can, even if you go to class you won't learn anything ... incredibly boring and monotone.  I wish I would have gotten to take this class with Hal Green!

I really enjoyed this class. He is extremely knowledgeable and teaches much more than you will need to know on the midterm and final. Not too tough of a class.  His tone is monotonous but paying attention will make the class go faster
avoid him as much you can
He drones on for forever about really boring numbers.... graphs.... hard time staying awake.  Avoid this prof.
Absolutely misterable class. You can basically do nothing and get a B but it's honestly not worth your time.  722 could be an interesting important class but Kimmel is AWFUL.  DO NOT TAKE HIM!
This class is soooooo boring but not hard at all. I NEVER went to class and I got a B+. Do Not even bother buying the book you will never use it.
Take someone else. This class isn't fun. Extremely boring lectures. No one shows up.

summary_comment: Professor Nichter is highly regarded for his comprehensive study guides that simplify test preparation, but some students find his lectures boring and disorganized, lacking practice problems. Despite this, his guidance is effective for exam success, though the tests' narrow focus and high stakes (with only 50 multiple-choice questions) can be challenging. Attendance is mandatory.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nichter is highly regarded for his comprehensive study guides that simplify test preparation significantly. However, he is also criticized for being monotonous and disorganized, failing to provide practice problems, which left students unprepared for the challenging multiple-choice exams with limited margin for error.

Ratings.comment: phenomenal!!!!
Gives you a great study guide, which makes the tests easy.

He is extremely boring and scatter-brained. He never gave practice problems. This made everyone scared for the midterm because we didn't know what he considered important out of 13 chapters of assigned reading. Oh yea, I forgot to mention that the test only had 50 MC questions. This means there was no room for error. Attendance is mandatory!!

summary_comment: Professor Sexton is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, making even challenging material accessible through clear explanations. He is an excellent resource, and both his grading and tests are straightforward, leading to high grades with minimal effort. Students strongly recommend his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sexton is highly dedicated to his students' success, making even challenging material accessible through clear explanations. He is an excellent resource, and his classes are known for their easy grading and straightforward tests based on provided review materials.

Ratings.comment: He really cares about his students doing well. Some of the material is challenging but he explains it in a way that makes it easy. Tests were straightforward, group projects are pretty easy and he grades very easy. This guy is a wealth of information would definitely recommend.

Genuinely wants his students to do well. Really easy grader; you get about a 90% for just turning in your work. Tests are solely based on the powerpoint review he makes. Would definitely recommend taking this class with him.

summary_comment: Professor Chernenko is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, with students consistently advising against taking his courses. Feedback highlights his disorganized lectures, difficulty in following the material, and lack of effective teaching methods, leading many to switch majors or seek out different professors. Students found the class challenging and felt they learned little despite the effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chernenko is widely regarded as one of the worst professors, with students consistently advising to avoid his courses at all costs. His teaching style is described as confusing, disorganized, and ineffective, with many students feeling they did not learn the material despite their efforts.

Ratings.comment: DON'T CHOOSE HIM. The worst professor I've met.
AVOID AT ALL COST. i got an B but I learned nothing from this course.

I switched my major due to the complexity and dryness of the course. No direction what so ever. Case studies would be presented day of and due few hours later. Office hours weren't any help. No organization within course. The material was hard to follow and confusing even when asking questions. Take this course with another professor!

Had Sergey for corporate finance last semester and he was literally the worst teacher I have ever had.  The class was extremely difficult and but I don't feel like I learned anything.  He was a walking corporate finance textbook but had no idea how to effectively teach and assumed that everyone would already know as much as him.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS
A lot of group projects and quizzes.   Cases are curved, but there is only one exam with little help in getting prepared for it.

Sergey's lectures were all over the place and really didn't pertain to the final exam at all. Also make sure you pick a good group at the very beginning because you'll work with them on everything. If you have the option to take this with another professor - do it. He makes the material unnecessarily difficult.
He expects you to already know everything. Very intelligent guy but doesn't know how to teach concepts to you. Very hard class but you have to take it

Very confusing with no in class help really. You just sort of go through the class and rely on a curve. Lectures are long, boring, and not very helpful to doing the problems on quizzes or the final. This class needs to be more organized, with actual in class practice on how to do anything rather than just lecturing random info. Would not take again

His lectures are very boring and confusing.  You must do a lot of extra reading to sort through his confusing lectures and layout of the course.  His tests are sort of tough, but he curves like a champ!! (Thankfully)  If I could pick another professor, I would.
Very hard class. Hard to pay attention and stay awake not a good Teacher

He was great!  He has an accent, but its not bad at all.  He curves everything and is really good at answering questions.  The class has one midterm (curved) and 3 cases (curved) and finally a final project (10 page group paper...curved).  He likes to joke and makes class fun.  Very worth while taking it with him.

Horrible. Avoid taking his class at all costs even if it delays your graduation a quarter. The guy is a D*ck and attempts to impose his knowledge of text book finance on his students. No real world experience.

Russian Harvard graduate..enough said. Has no idea how to teach information to his students. Everything is curved. Don't be surprised to get a 13/20 on a case and get a b+. As a finance major I feel that his course taught me nothing useful except that curves are a great cover up for not teaching your students anything. Got an A but learned nothing

PhD student from Ukraine. Thick accent, talks like a robot. Has very high expectations of his students, which we always fall short of and he is forced to curve grades down.  weekly carmen quizzes and group homework case-study assignments.  i hear the other profs are much easier than him.

summary_comment: Professor Magestro is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, and he genuinely cares about his students' success. He is one of the best instructors available at Fisher, known for his industry experience and dedication to his classes. With consistent effort and attendance, students find it attainable to earn an A.
summary_comment_short: Professor Magestro is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, and he genuinely cares about his students' success. He is one of the best instructors available at Fisher, known for his industry experience and dedication to his classes; students achieve high grades by attending lectures and completing all assigned work.

Ratings.comment: Great professor! really funny and genuinely cares about his students. Not hard to get an A if you pay attention

One of the best instructors available at Fisher. Works in the industry, enjoys his field. Extremely helpful and devoted to the class. Do all of the work and attend lecture and an A is certainly attainable.

summary_comment: Professor Chabi-Yo is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and supportive approach. Students find his classes easy with clear expectations and ample resources, such as detailed notes and review exams. He is known for his humor and dedication to student success, often resulting in high average scores on exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chabi-Yo is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and supportive approach, making his class both easy and informative. Students appreciate his comprehensive lecture notes, extra study materials, and high average scores on exams, along with his humorous and engaging personality.

Ratings.comment: I bought the textbook (because it was only like 10 dollars on ebay) but you don't need it. His notes are all you need. You learn a lot and it the class is pretty easy. He is very helpful and cares about students, but it is pretty funny when he walks around before the class and asks students if they have any questions about the material.

DEFINITELY TAKE HIM. Class is super easy.  And you actually learn something. 6 Homeworks are easy pts. 8 quizzes that he gives you the questions to before hand. Gives you most of the midterm and final before hand. Midterm average was 96%. Final was a little lower but still high. Really nice guy, too.
You will not regret taking him. Averages were high 90's for the midterm and final. Great guy and funny too. If you get below an A, you should not be in college.
I dont care how bad your schedual looks make sure your in his class. The funniest man in Fisher. I promiss you'll thank me for it.
Hard to understand at first, but a very nice guy. He gives you review exams that are 90% the same exam. 20% of the class is easy homework, graded on completion + 1 questions quiz's.

summary_comment: Professor Zhang is a highly regarded educator known for his excellent teaching quality, effectively engaging students and fostering a deep understanding of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhang is a highly regarded educator known for his excellent teaching quality and ability to clearly convey complex concepts. Students consistently praise his thoroughness and engaging teaching style.

Ratings.comment: good professor

summary_comment: Professor Jindra is highly regarded for his clarity in teaching and willingness to help students outside of class. His lectures, while complex, align well with the exam content, and he emphasizes the importance of doing the suggested problems. With extensive professional experience, he also provides valuable guidance on future career planning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jindra is an effective instructor who clarifies complex topics and is available to answer questions beyond class time, contributing valuable career advice. His lectures, while challenging, align well with the exam content, and students find success through diligent note-taking and practice.

Ratings.comment: Doing the suggested problems from the text is important. The lectures were more complex than the exam. You only have to attend class for the final.

He is a really good professor, who made everything clearly. He is also happy to answer the questions even after the class. He has long time working experience which may give some advice on future career plan. Taking notes and doing the assigned practice lecture is important. Then you will find the exam is not difficult.

summary_comment: Professor Cox is widely regarded as one of the top instructors, praised for his brilliance and passion for teaching, which significantly enhance the learning experience. However, his teaching style and material can be challenging, particularly for those who struggle to keep up, leading some students to find his lectures and exams difficult. Conversely, those who do engage actively often benefit greatly from his availability and willingness to help during office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cox is highly regarded by many students as one of the best professors they have ever had, noted for his brilliance and willingness to help outside of class, making a significant positive impact on their academic journey. However, other students find his teaching style challenging and criticize him for being unclear, condescending, and imposing his political views, leading some to advise avoiding his classes altogether.

Ratings.comment: Without a doubt the best professor I've ever had. I'm currently at an Ivy League law school, and I can honestly say I couldn't have done it without Professor Cox. He is absolutely brilliant and frankly, is severely overqualified to be teaching at OSU. Learning from him both inside and outside the classroom was an absolute pleasure.

Not a bad class. Most of the class did well. If you have the time, definitely go to his office hours just to talk over coffee. More than willing to help you. The exams were a little difficult and he writes his numbers small on the board so make sure you bring the notes to class if he's going over a problem. 1 mid.1fin 3 pop quizzes, 2 online,1 case

Cox teaches because he wants to and enjoys it. Very helpful, but doesn't like or have patience for dumb people. This explains all the negative comments. If you think there is a chance  you  are a retard, don't take a class with this professor.
He is terrible.  Imposes his liberal views all throughout class.  Examples are straight from the book and not well explained.  The midterm covers 14 chapters.  AVOID!

Hands down the worst professor in Fisher. His lectors are painfully boring and unclear. He stands in the way when he writes on the board so you cant see what hes doing, and he faces the board when he talks. This guy is a nightmare, avoid at all costs....If you read this and still take his class you're an idiot

Maurice is by far the worst instructor at Fisher. His degree is in engineering, yet he teaches an advanced finance course in risk evaluation, options, derivatives, and futures. He is unclear, condescending, unorganized, careless, and just doesn't give a damn about his students. You'll be teaching yourself in this class. Get ready to work.
Maury is a terrible instructor. His slides are unclear and his exams are as bad. He is boring and doesn't seem to care. Avoid him if possible.

Brace yourself. His slides and problem solutions are wrong. He is condescending to students. He promotes his liberal views, even though we are business students. My 3 exam scores went from 90s to 70s to 50-60s, since the latter part of the course is harder to teach to yourself than the beginning. Overall, easily the worst prof I've had in Fisher

I tried really hard to like him. It's nice to bring in a page of notes into a test. But his tests are super specific and his questions, taken from the publsher, do not account for the fact that he doesn't cover many things. His slides have mostly tables and charts; book slides are much better! It is possible to do really well in the class though
Worst professor I have in Fisher.  Ludicrously unprepared for lecture.  No attempt to make class interesting.  Avoid at all costs.

Maury really made this class interesting. You don't need the textbook just listen to lectures. He tells great personal stories. This guy really knows what he's talking about. Unlike the guy below me I think anyone who can maintain a venture capitalist fund of 100 million is the real deal.

Obvious inferiority complex.  Feels the need to tell the class about his experiences (I'm sure many of which are made up or over-blown).  Typical ex-CEO that could't cut it in the real world so now he's teaching.  Pretty much drove CompuServe into the ground with his "WOW!" project.  It's an easy class and he grades easy. I got a B and didn't study

Maury spent a lot of class time talking about personal experience in Finance. You would think this might not help for class but it actually keeps it interesting. You can tell he knows his stuff inside and out and does a very good job of explaining. Go to class, read through the book, get A.

summary_comment: Professor Green is known for making his exams extremely easy, often posting review problems that closely mirror the test questions. While his lectures are optional and he encourages self-study, many students find them informative and helpful. Despite his unconventional teaching style and lack of strict attendance policies, Professor Green is praised for his willingness to assist students and share practical, real-world knowledge.
summary_comment_short: Professor Green is known for making his exams extremely easy, often posting review problems that are nearly identical to the test questions. While his teaching style is casual and he is helpful when asked, attendance is not strictly necessary, and many students succeed by simply memorizing provided review materials.

Ratings.comment: TAKE THIS CLASS. Professor green is an absolute nut case and a pretty bad teacher but the exams are SO easy and he is really helpful if you ask him. He jokes with students and makes fun of them but will gladly answer any question you have. He doesn't care if you come to class or not, and he's super lenient and understanding.

Easiest class I have ever taken. Never went to class, even though he basically gives you a review of what you will see on the test the class before exams. Posts review problems, albeit there can be a ton, for each chapter which you can just memorize and will see verbatim on the test. Class is laughable since I never went and didn't miss a point.

Very easy. You have to go to class (I went 90% of the time to a 7:30AM). As long as you go to class, take good notes, and do the homework.. You. Will. Be. Fine. I got an A- and missed the A by a point. He gives you a review sheet for the midterm so focus on that. Cheers.
Never went to class after the first test.  Never bought a book.  Studied practice problems that he posts online the day before the test and got a 97%.

Pretty easy class, only 3 mc test.  Don't need to go to class really, just the second to last one before each exam bc he will tell you everything on the test.  Knows a lot about business and is very successful so its kind of cool to hear some of his stories.  Will joke a little and try to make interesting for 730 am. Dont buy textbook just use slid

This class was cake! I rarely went to lecture. The exams were super easy after studying the practice questions because they're the EXACT SAME questions on the exam. The information from the 2nd exam to the final was definitely worthwhile because it taught personal finance. I now know how I should invest my $$ to become a millionaire (lol).

Hal is a great man. For once osu has a professor with real world knowledge and not just a book worm. Test are easy. Although you do not need to go to lecture, they are very informative and he gives alot of real examples. Very smart guy and funny.

SO EASY! I never went to class, just memorized the review sheets that he posted for each exam. Yes the review sheets are approx 100 questions per chapter. so it's a lot to memorize. but the questions on the exam are exactly the same. the final is a joke. he makes it as easy as possible...took me 10 minutes and i got 100%. Easy A
Horrible teacher! I didn't learn anything from him! The only way I "learned" anything was by trying to memorize the 20-30 pages PER chapter of example questions he so generously gave us.
Great professor. Tests are VERY easy. Gets his questions straight from the practice exams. He understands that those taking 420 are not business majors and makes the class very interesting and funny.

One of the best finance professors out there. If you want real-life finance advice, he is the person to go to. Has had a lot of experience dealing with financial markets. Overall, great professor and keeps the class entertaining with his humor
There are two worst professor Fisher has to offer. Murry Cox and him avoid at all cost. I want me tuition back!!!!

I don't know why everyone is hating on him... When I am scheduling I look for which class he is teaching.  Every exam comes with a review sheet, he is always available in office hours, has practical job advice, and he definitely did buy-fix-sell (flip) companies.  If you are looking to learn really technical finance, then tell him. Fav. Fin. Prof.
IS HE DRUNK DURING CLASS??? Irrelevant stories, no structure at all. Attendance was part of the grade in 725, but not the case in some of his other classes

Absolutly awful. No carmen, slides, or anything. He just talks about buying and selling comapanies, investing in european technology, Japanese karaoke, him witnessing a killing in Chicago, him getting stuffed in the locker by his then-coach Investments don't really get covered by him. Maury Cox and him probably get along

This class would be pretty easy regardless of who teaches it as it's really just a review of fin620, fin 721, and econ520.  There is actually quite a bit of work in this class as you have homework and pop quizzes, but the exams and generally pretty straight forward.
I got an A because the tests/homework weren't very hard, but yes, you did have to teach yourself anything you really wanted to learn. Horrible teacher. I would avoid him if possible.
I love this guy man, definitely the easiest class i been into. No crap on his test at all, we are not majoring in finance, "GLAD HE KNOWS IT!" I thanks him for my GPA. 5/5
you have to teach yourself if you want to learn. easy grader

I had him for Fin 721 and 722. He just repeated the same thing he said in every class. He rarely use textbook but you have to read it on your own. If you want a GPA booster class. Take him. If you really want to learn. Avoid him. I am not trying to say he is useless. just irrelevant to the course. If you like Bill Rives, take him then

Easy A.  All of his exams are MC.  He gives you 200-300 example questions with answers before the exam and all 30 exam questions come from the examples.  Go to class the day before the exam, he tells you everything that will be on it!  You don't need to attend lecture.  The first exam only took me 15 minutes!  Don't really learn much though.

He has major ADD and talks about the most random things. However, he is so easy and literally hands you a review sheet for each exam with bullet points and that is exactly what is on it. Must attend class for points but they are given points. Highly recommended.
I didn't do a whole lot in the class and still got an A-. Definetely easier than 620

this class is easy and he lets you know right away that it will be easy. most of the people taking it are grad. seniors. no final exam but a final presentation that is 15-20 mins long where he only grades you on your ability to answer questions.

hal green as a person is much better than hal green the teacher. easy exams (if you know his "tell you everything" review sheet) but you kind of need to have some knowledge of the topics prior because of all the info he talks about only about 3% make the exam and additional info is on the exam that was never discussed because he uses the same exams
He's kind of a d*ck, but can be funny.  Tests are real easy, but you have to go to class and do all of the homework to get a decent grade
Decent professor as far as ease. Lectures are death by powerpoint. Book was very helpful in learning the material. His tests are thorough, but fair.

Good professor, he only covers material that you should know and that probably you need to know if you are FIN major. You can always read the book and try to learn more if you want. Remember you are not in High School anymore.
if you want an easy B or A take him. If you want to learn he is not for you. green comes to class talks about anything he feels like and cover 15% of the material.

Hal Green is one of the best professors in Fisher.  He teaches you what you need to know (and usually repeats it) and cuts out the BS.  His exams can be challenging, but has a guided review sheet.  His lectures are entertaining and usually let out early.  It's hard to get below a B in his class.

I disagree with the last comments.  I though being a real estate major this was a pretty useful class.  He's fair in that he will tell you specifically what's on the tests.  Make sure you go to class and get the easy points for quizzes and homeworks.  I hope to take green again for other classes

I took very little away from this class and this is my major!  We never used all of class time and often got out an hour early.  His exams were curved to make up for the terrible wording.  Basically know how to do NPV and a few other fomulas and you're all set.  Overall I felt like I was wasting my time but it is pretty easy.
one of the easiest classes i've ever taken, make sure you go to the class before the exam, he basically tells you what is on it
Easy A.  Great Teacher.

Ok teacher, easy first test, second is more difficult easy third test.  Not cumulative, keep up with the reading in each chapter.  No need to attend class.  TEst questions can be confusing.  Go to his review he gives before the test, he'll give al the answers.  Study the review

Great guy, easy class.  Attending his lectures is easy, because he's a dirty old man who keeps you on your toes with his bad jokes.  His class is fun, and the tests are simple.  He tells you what you need to know.  Like exactly what you need to know.  No tricks.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

The class wasn't that difficult and he gave out review sheets before both exams. The book is pretty useless, since you only need to know about 10% of the material in it. He has a very odd sense of humor, but overall he's a pretty nice guy. Although, if you say something stupid, he will pick on you.

Getting an A i his class requires little. He has a lot of industry expierence but you don't learn anything his class.  If you want a GPA booster take him, or if you want to learn more in Finance, take Cronqvist or Fallenbrach.
Can't say anything that hasn't already been said... except can you say GPA BOOSTER! heh it's that easy....the A is yours for the taking
easy and fun, easy and fun, easy and fun

one of the best professors i've ever had.  he has been very successful in the business field so he tells it like it is.  this class is not very hard but what you get out of it depends on you.  if you don't feel like studying until the day before the midterm, you're still going to be ok, but you won't get anything out of the course.  recommended.
If you want to struggle, then dont take him.  If you want to pass and get a descent grade, then i would recommend him.  PLus he's funny and tells what you really need to no.  NO BS.
Gets you out of class as ASAP.  Just study what is on his study guide and you are golden.  You learn what you need to know and he doesn't fill the class with BS.

Prof. Green is the most eccentric teacher i've ever had. Our 2 hour class periods barely ever last more than 45 min., and the midterm avg. was an A. This is the easiest prof. you could ever have for this class; all he does is tell us crazy stories.

summary_comment: Professor Sanders is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, offering accessible online notes and stimulating class content that translates well to real-world applications. His class is known for its wit and industry insight, setting him apart from other faculty members in the field of real estate finance and investment. Students appreciate his willingness to engage with students and provide support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sanders is an excellent teacher known for his stimulating class content, real-world experience, and availability to help students with problems. His classes are engaging and he brings valuable industry insights to the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Excellent teacher!  Notes always available online, stimulating class and course content!  Ready to help with problems.  Real world experience; you actually learn skills that you will take into the work environment.
TALKS LIKE A BAD HARD HEAD IN CLASS AND WILL CALL ON PEPOLE RANDOM BUT GET TO KNOW HIM AND HE IS ALL RIGHT !!!!
Great Teacher
No Comments

This is a real estate finance and investment class.  He is witty, intelligent and has industry experience (unlike the other OSU faculty).  He is one of the only finance professors that I really liked (Anil Makhija is the other).

summary_comment: Professor Lin is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging material, using original slides and providing homework and in-class practice to keep students engaged. While his exams are challenging, particularly the first one, which is math-heavy, his classes are generally recommended due to his clear instruction and focus on essential material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lin is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, offering original and helpful slides, engaging homework assignments, and in-class practice problems. Despite the challenging exams, which account for a significant portion of the grade, students find his approach straightforward and his lectures informative.

Ratings.comment: Prof Lin is one of the best instructors I've had at OSU. His slides are original and incredibly helpful, and he gives homework assignments and in-class practice problems to keep the you engaged with the material. Don't get me wrong though, the class is tough. two exams. First is very math heavy, but show work for partial credit. DON'T miss class.

Almost weekly homework that can be done in groups. Lectures aren't mandatory but help a ton with homework. Exams are tough, but if you study hard you'll do fine. Two exams for 80% of grade, and homework for 20%. Final was quite difficult but definitely curved. Lecture could be boring at times. Definitely don't buy the book, you don't need it.

Very intelligent professor that really works to help you understand the material. He teaches you only what you need to know. There is homework almost every week but you can work with others on it. One of the best professors I've had.

Pretty simple clear instruction. 2 exams for 80% of your grade and about 9 home works for 20%. Homework is easy, and tests are exactly what he teaches you. Supposedly a lot easier than other investments professors. Would recommend.

Xiaoji was a great professor.  He only teaches the material you need to know and will use in your career.  He assigns weekly group homework but are easy to complete.  His test are challenging but easy if you study.  His lecture notes are straight forward and well informative.  I would take any class with him.
Great Professor. Easy lectures, Easy HW. TAKE HIS CLASSES!

summary_comment: Professor Brandl is known for his rigorous and passionate approach to teaching economics, delivering engaging lectures but assigning challenging tests that significantly impact grades. While some students find his teaching style demanding and his grading strict, many appreciate his dedication to ensuring deep understanding over easy grades. Overall, his classes are highly regarded for their academic rigor and depth, though his sometimes harsh demeanor and strict policies on electronics in class can be off-putting to some.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brandl is known for his rigorous teaching approach and deep passion for economics, which students find both enlightening and challenging. While his lectures are highly informative and engaging, his grading is tough, and he enforces strict classroom policies, making the learning experience demanding but rewarding.

Ratings.comment: He is a good lecturer but not a very nice person. He is the first teacher/professor EVER make me so embarrassed in class. DON'T USE ANY ELECTRONICS IN CLASS OR HE WILL STARE AT YOU AND LET THE WHOLE CLASS STARE AT YOUR UNTIL YOU GET EVERYTHING CLEARED. Besides that, I find him a little mean. But the homework and the test are super easy.

Listen, if you want an easy A teacher he is not it. But if you stick with it you will obtain knowledge that will actually stick with you in the long run. The average test grades (as well as the test themselves) will be HORRIFYING, but don't let it discourage you too much because he curves heavy. Missed class means a lot of missed content.

He really loves economics and you will learn A LOT, but your grade might not show it. His tests are the majority of your grade, and they are IMPOSSIBLE. Class average was always low. His lectures are interesting. He is very nice, but not super helpful if you are not doing well in class.
All classes by Brandl are tough!

He genuinely cares about students and their education. He grades hard but is more focused on the fact that students actually learn than the grade they get. He is clearly passionate about economics, and his lectures are incredibly interesting. He's strict about his technology policy and tests are hard but it is worth it because the class is so good.

Well he is very nice person, but don't fall for that. His few tests can simply put you in danger. If you have already took one of his course before, my personal advice: don't. This is because he will repeat the same content again and it's not fun, and it will make the things more complicated. If you want to learn Econ, go ahead but for grade, don't

I took Professor Brandl for two different courses at once this semester (4002.02 and 4200) and I absolutely loved him for both.  If I could take any other courses taught by him, I would in a heartbeat.  His lectures are informative and interesting and I honestly would have wished they lasted longer than the 1.5 hours they were. Take this class.

A friend of mine recommended Brandl and he did not disappoint. The man has a deep understanding and passion for Economics from theoretical, applicable, and historical points of view. He presents an extremely interesting narrative. He has been one of the best professors I've had. However, if you are looking for an easy prof, Brandl is not your guy.

Professor Brandl was the hardest professor I have ever had at Ohio State. Exams are insanely hard. A lot of the possible answers are right, but you need to pick the "best" one possible. Makes simple material harder than it needs to be. Took with a different professor following semester and received a B+. Avoid if possible.

He's a passionate professor and really funny. However the exams are horrible. It makes me feel like it's not only an intermediate econ class but a 4000 level finance class. NEVER take his class. It's impossible for you to learn by yourself because he doesn't require textbooks. All the readings are scanned by him. To much reading, can not finish.

Brandl's lectures are the best part of the class. Very informative and he's very entertaining with presenting material. Might not be the easiest class if you don't enjoy economics, but if you do I'd highly suggest him. Emphasizes using real world examples which makes the class even more interesting. A little crazy but definitely gets the job done.

His content was really interesting and I learned a lot, however most of the exam questions were hypothetical situations that you needed to apply what was learned to get the best answer. Meaning that a few of the options could be correct but only the BEST option was accepted. None of the topics discussed were actually tested on except in homeworks.

Makes you get the textbook which is expensive and very poorly written.  Lectures are decent but the exams ask questions way beyond the scope of what he teaches/what you read in the book. Clearly knows his stuff but makes this class way too difficult.
Exams are way too hard. Expect to watch hours of videos every week, multiple times a week and read 100's of pages to do alright in this class. Class shouldn't be online.

Weekly videos are lengthy and illogical.  The instructor spent 15 minutes to repeat a concept that he could teach in 5 minutes.  This is definitely NOT a global finance class! It is more like a class about the history of  American economics. Heavy course load and unreasonable exams. Over 700+ pages reading required including a novel!
Weekly videos that are long and boring. He absolutely refuses to answer questions. Exams are ridiculously hard.

Online, well organized class and engaging. My problem with this class however is the exams. I read the readings, watched the lecture videos multiple times and still would fail or do just above it on exams. Questions on the exams are far above the level you are taught at. Would say avoid IF YOU CAN.

I love Professor Brandl. Absolutely, he has a decent knowledge in Macroeconomics and brings a really clear and insightful lecture every time. He is class is amazing and energetic. Take notes and review it. Make sure you really understand what he illustrates in class. He will teach you hot to be smart!
Very little in the way of homework. Funny guy and a good lecturer. Gives fair exams.  Overall, a very good teacher.

Brandl is one of our best economist at ohio state, he makes things clear and is always open to give advice during office ours. The material is not hard, any serious finance major knows at least 60% of the material even before the course. Just review before each exam, because his questions are conceptual.

Professor Brandl is an amazing professor! He is nice, easy to talk to and most definitely enjoys chatting about topics related to the course. He is knowledgeable and did a wonderful job not only teaching the concepts learned but also in applying them in real life situations. I would definitely take more courses under him if I could.

The class was all online.  The lectures were presented in video form and readings were also assigned.  The lectures and readings take FOREVER!! Quizzes are easy but exams are hard.  You can't get around this professor, just get ready to devote 10 hours a week to his class to get a good grade.
It doesn't matter if you think you know the material well before exams, you will still do bad. Some exam questions are more in depth than anything he covers.

Amazing lecturer, he is one of the best teachers I've taken in Fisher. Definitely take this class if you want to learning something. I never paid attention before but this guy makes it worth it. Exams are tough but if you take decent notes they are very doable.

Best professor I have had so far at OSU. He is very passionate about his field and lectures were always very intriguing and informative. The exams are challenging, but doable if you work hard. I highly recommend this professor because he gives a comprehensive understanding of the macroeconomy and the various models that exist.
Very Hard. Final make up 75% of the grade. I get 30ish/100 despite having 100% on all the quiz. Take at your own risk. You will Fail if you're a 2.5 average student

I liked this professor for financial institutions, but the online class of global finance was ridiculous. The whole class is online except for the in-person final worth 75% of the final grade! The questions were incredibly specific and hard compared to any of the online homework questions. I think he finds joy in people failing this class.

Excellent professor. Comprehensive approach to Macro. Focus on historical significance, accuracy, and empirical nature of every major economic model since the 19th century. Exams are tough, but it is well worth taking Brandl's class if you want to understand the fundamentals of the macro economy.

By far, Dr. Brandl is one of the most compelling and talented professors I've had in college. He really knows how to speak publicly, how to engage the audience, and understands the subject matter. Hands down, he remains my favorite one OSU.
Excellent professor, the exam is very very hard, but worth taking his class! You'll learn a lot!

Great Professor. He does not simply lecture straight from the text like so many Fisher professors. Lecture is always entertaining and interesting. Treats students with respect. Attendance is “mandatory” but he never takes it. Exams WILL be difficult if you do not come to class and take notes! Read the text and study your notes for a solid grade.

His class is really interesting and covering a bunch of materials. He is keen on teaching but not really like to reply email. if you really want to learn something, definitely take his class. and listening to his lecture very very carefully and that will makes u a good result.

summary_comment: Professor Schwert is highly regarded for his depth of knowledge and genuine concern for student learning. He presents complex material in an understandable way and ensures that exams are fair and based on class content. However, his lectures can be slow and somewhat dull, and he emphasizes the importance of attendance and participation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schwert is highly regarded for his depth of knowledge and genuine concern for student learning, presenting material in an understandable way. However, his lectures are often described as slow and boring, with exams being challenging but fair if students attend class regularly and participate.

Ratings.comment: Overall good professor. Very experienced and definitely cares about students' learning. He presented the material in a manner that was easy to understand. Exams were sometimes challenging but were fairly based from the practice problems and quizzes so if you attend class it's not a problem. Participation definitely matters.
The course material comes most from BUSFIN 3220 but more specific, the attendance is necessary and exams are fair game. His lecture is boring and you just need to pay attention to lecture slices.

Prof. Schwert clearly knows finance well, but doesn't do a very good job of making it interesting for the class. Lectures are slow & boring. Exams are difficult and participation matters in class. Don't miss the case study days. Didn't use the textbook.

summary_comment: Professor Bennett is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, known for his lack of knowledge in key accounting and finance topics, convoluted exam questions, and disorganized lectures. Despite some positive feedback from a few students who found his class manageable with diligent preparation, the overall consensus is that he struggles with teaching effectively and should be avoided.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bennett is widely regarded as one of the worst professors, with students criticizing his lack of knowledge, confusing lectures, and poorly worded exam questions. Many students advise avoiding his classes altogether due to his unhelpful teaching style and grading practices.

Ratings.comment: The worst professor I have ever had by ALOT; he doesnt know key accounting/ finance topics, and was regularly corrected by STUDENTS. Clearly reads the textbook the night before and just regurgitates what he read. Questions on exams are worded in the most convoluted way possible. Avoid at all costs to avoid getting stupider.

Literally the worst professor to ever set foot on Tulane's campus. He does not know how to give a lecture or word exam questions. He says "I think" after every sentence. Everything he says is confusing and he has no empathy. He doesn't care about his students and will kick you out of class for going to the bathroom. AVOID taking him at all costs.

Despite the negative reviews on this website for Bennett, I took his class and enjoyed it. It involved studying, but the tests and final were nothing like what other reviews said. Not many grades so stay on top of quizzes and prepare for midterm and you'll be fine. He is a very solid teacher that wants the students to learn.
One of the best teachers Ive had at osu. Started off slow but picked up throughout the semester. He inspired me to get into corporate finance.

This professor is by far the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. He is brand new at teaching and it shows. Every class he answers at least one student's question with: "I don't know" and shows no motivation to try and help. His grading is completely bias, because all of the cases are subjective. Has said he has never had any finance experience.

Strap in folks, gonna be a bumpy ride. Clearly his first time teaching. Nice guy, absolutely no feel. 8 easy online quizzes. Midterm was like taking candy from a baby. Absolute cake. The final? Yeah, not so much.  Your worst nightmare. Don't bother studying. Better chance of winning the powerball than getting some of those questions right. Enjoy!
He's a nice guy who really cares about the students. However, he definitely struggled at times to present the material. The final was an absolute dumpster fire. Overall, decent professor

One midterm, one final, bi-weekly Carmen quizzes are the only grades. The first midterm was a reasonable difficulty, but after the average was a B+, made the final more difficult and supplied the class with a study guide which had study questions of a much lower difficulty. Because of this how well you did on the final depended on guessing ability.
